loans.name: Hugo Dionisio

texts.en: Hugo is a member of the Covadonga Village Bank. He is 66 years old and is married with five children. Hugo sells many different varieties of beer wholesale from his house in the Enace housing complex. He is planning to expand his store to add games.  Hugo is requesting a loan to buy beer and expand his store. He dreams of improving his store and of building a large, full-service restaurant on a plot of land in Canaan.

loans.use: To buy beer for his beer store

loans.name: Erick Enmanuel

texts.es: El joven Erick Manuel tiene la edad de 29 años habita en la Concepción, junto a su mamá y hermanos este joven es muy trabajador, se dedica a la agricultura y a la vez trabaja en una empresa para poder ayudarle con los gastos del hogar a su mamá y hermanos .E l papá del joven le ayuda en la finca para que el vaya a trabajar. Los sueños de este joven es llegar a establecer una manzana más de piña. Ya que el se siente muy contento por el apoyo que le brinda nuestra financiera. El solicita este préstamo para comprar insumos agrícola, como abono, veneno y otros para los cultivos y así tener una buena cosecha del cultivo de piña, y ofertar a sus clientes la buena calidad y la captación de mas clientes.
texts.en:
Erick Manuel is 29 years old and lives in the Concepcion with his mom and brothers. He is very hard working, works in a farm and at company to help his mom and brothers. His father helps him on the farm, so he can go to work. Erick would like to create another block of pineapple. He is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies, like fertilizers among others. He wants to have a good harvest of pineapple and offer his clients good quality products and increase his clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies like fertilizer

loans.name: Giovanny

texts.es:
Giovanny forma parte del Banco Comunal “Señor Del Cautivo II”, distrito de Independencia, provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Giovanny tiene 38 años de edad. Comenta que junto a su esposo y a sus 02 hijos ha podido mantenerse tranquila en su vida sin muchos problemas difíciles que afrontar. Ambos empezaron su negocio con poca inversión y que ahora tienen invertido un promedio de S/.10,000 en todo su negocio. Vende ambulatoriamente costales, rafias (hilos para cocer en canastas y sacos) y agujas. Todos los lunes vende en la feria de Huaraz y los jueves cerca al puente Bolívar. También comenta que ha crecido y que en la actualidad todo le va bien porque incluso ella y su esposo han podido construir su casa gracias a este negocio. 

Con este préstamo de S/.1,200, el cual será cancelado en 8 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de costales y costalillos en cantidad porque ya empiezan las cosechas en esta zona.
 
A Giovanny le gustaría capacitarse para mejorar su negocio y también poder mejorar tanto su vida personal como familiar.
texts.en:
Giovanny belongs to the community bank of Senor del Cautivo II, district of Independence, and department of Ancash. Giovanny is 38 years old, she lives with her husband and 2 children. They both started a business with a small investment, that now has about S/.10,000 of investment. They sell sawing supplies: treads, needles. They sell every Monday at the Huaraz market and on Thursdays near the Bolivar Bridge. The business keeps on growing very well, and it helped them pay for their house. With the loan of S/.1,200 which will be paid in 8 quotes, she will invest buying supplies because harvest time is almost in. Giovanny wants to study to improve her business and her personal life.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Carina

texts.en: Carina is a member of the Covadonga Village Bank. She is 32 years old and lives with her partner and their child. She sells a variety of puddings made with purple corn, rice and pumpkin from a mobile cart each day in the Magdalena Market which is located in the center of the city of Ayacucho.  Carina is requesting a loan to buy a small cart to sell pudding from. Carina’s dreams are to have a stable job, to open her own store, and for her child to graduate from college with a professional degree.

loans.use: To buy a cart to sell pudding from

loans.name: Nueva Iluminacion Group

texts.en: "Nueva Iluminacion" is a large group of Esperanza borrowers, now with 18 new borrowers applying for a loan. Lourdes is the group representative and has a small business selling fruit and vegetables. She has two teenage children that she must care for while also running her business. She has had some success after taking out her first loan and believes the next loan will help her increase the size of her business. Before her first loan, she was having a hard time providing food for her family, and her kids were having to work instead of attending school. Now she is able to provide for her children and they are able to attend school. She dreams of sending them to college someday and having her own grocery store. She feels like she is on track to reach these dreams and find a better life for her and her family. This whole group has similar stories, and for the first time in their lives they are starting to see success and hope for the future. They see this next loan as the next step towards a better life!

loans.use: To buy wholesale products for resale

loans.name: Gladys Marlene

texts.es:
Gladys forma parte del Banco Comunal “Palatinas Al Progreso” del distrito de Tarica, provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Tiene 40 años de edad, tres hijos y convive con el padre de sus hijos que es profesor. Comenta que aún cuando su más grande logro ha sido tener una profesión, porque ella también es profesora, no lo pueda ejercer debido al cuidado que debe tener con sus hijos, convirtiéndose ello en su mayor dificultad. En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza que distribuye a pedido desde hace cuatro años en la casa de sus padres en Paltay s/n. También comenta que todo está tranquilo por ahora, porque en el negocio aún cuando no le pagan a tiempo tiene reservas para suplir su inversión con productos de promoción y en su familia se encuentra bien porque afirma que el velar por sus hijos también es una gran satisfacción.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, invertirá en la educación de sus hijos y en la compra de cosméticos para tenerlos de reserva.
 
Gladys afirma que la mejor inversión que puede hacer es brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the communal bank called "Palatinas Al Progreso" in the district of Tarica, in the province of Huaraz in the state of Ancash. She's 40 years old with 3 children. She lives with the father of her children who is a teacher. She tells us that, even though she has been able to achieved one of her biggest goals which is to become a teacher, she can't teach at this time because she's taking care of her children who are her biggest responsability for now and her main reason to stay at home. She currently sells beauty products which she distributes/delivers to people who have placed orders. She has been doing this for the past 4 years out of her parent's home in the city of Paltay. She also tells us that everything is going very well because even when people don't pay her on time, she has reserves to purchase promotional items. Her family is doing well and she tells us that taking care of her children give her great satisfaction. With this loan, which she will repay within 6 months, she will put some money away for her kids' education and she will purchase more cosmetics to have as a surplus. Gladys tells us that the best investment she can make is to give to her children the best life has to offer.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finance her kids' education and to purchase more cosmetics

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en: Felicitas is a member of the Covadonga Village Bank. She is 46 years old and is married with two children. She has a store that is located in her house in the Enace housing complex, where she sells dry goods and drinks each day with the help of her son. Felicitas is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar and beer. She dreams of having a profitable business and that her children will graduate from college with professional degrees.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and beer

loans.name: Lastenia

texts.es:
Lastenia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Señor Del Cautivo II” del distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Lastenia tiene 56 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo. Menciona que no ha tenido problemas difíciles en su vida familiar, que todo ha sido tranquilo hasta ahora. Su logro mayor ha sido tener una familia constituida. Tiene una bodega en su casa, en L. Av. Atusparia 783 desde hace 20 años. Comenta que en su negocio a veces le va muy bien y a veces pierde en sus productos perecibles, siendo ello su principal dificultad. En L. actualidad se encuentra tranquiL. y sigue adelante con su negocio para lo cual recibe L. ayuda constante de su esposo que es cesante (recibe una pensión por haber servido laboralmente al país).
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en L. compra de abarrotes, arroz, azúcar y leche.
 
Lastenia sigue adelante y le gustaría aprender para mejorar el crecimiento de su negocio.
texts.en:
Lastenia is a member of the communal bank called “Señor Del Cautivo II” in the district of Huaraz in the state of Ancash. Lastenia is 56 years old. She's married and has one child. She tells us that she has never had any major family issue/difficulty and that everything has been running smoothly up until now. Her biggest accomplishment has been to have a good, solid and close family life. She has a small store which she runs out of her home, located in the Avenue Atusparia 783, which she has been running over the past 20 years. She tells us that some days are good and then there are some days when she looses all her perishables which is her biggest problem. The business is running o.k. and everything is running smoothly with the help of her husband's pension. Lastenia's husband is deceased and he gets a pension for having served his country. With this loan, which she will repay within 4 months, she will purchase rice, sugar, milk and other groceries. Lastenia just moves ahead and puts her problems behind her. She would like to learn how to better manage and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar and milk

loans.name: Corina

texts.es:
Corina forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Pariahuanquinas II” del distrito de Pariahuaca, provincia de Carhuaz, departamento de Ancash.

Corina tiene 38 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos. Aunque no ha tenido muchos problemas en su familia, comenta que iniciar una nueva vida en Pariahuanca ha sido un reto debido a que es natural de la ciudad de Lima, que junto a su conviviente, quien es taxista, y a sus hijos, se estableció en el lugar de origen de su conviviente. Tiene como actual negocio la crianza y venta de cuyes, que los cría en su casa en Pariahuanca s/n. También menciona que empezó con 30 cuyes y ahora ella tiene 75 a los cuales alimenta con alfalfa que afortunadamente se produce en este lugar. Vende a pedido en la ciudad de Huaraz. Se siente bien porque afirma que la vida de campo es mas tranquila que en la ciudad.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800, el cual será cancelado en cuatro cuotas, invertirá en la compra de semillas, porque ahora desea sembrar alfalfa, comprará cuyes, y conejos.
 
A Corina le encantaría capacitarse, para mejorar la producción en su negocio.
texts.en:
Corina is a member of the communal bank called “Mujeres Pariahuanquinas II” in the district of Parihuaca in the province of Cahuaz in the state of Ancash. Corina is 38 years old. She has a life partner and she has 3 children. Even though, she's never had any major family issues, she tells us that having to start a new life in Pariahuanca has been a challenge since she's originally from the capital, Lima. Together with her life partner, who's a taxi driver, and her children, they moved to the native city of her life partner. Her current business is raising guinea pigs which she takes care of out of her home in Pariahuanca. She also tells us that she began with only 30 guinea pigs and now she has a total of 75. She feeds them alfalfa which grows in this part of town. She sells through special orders in the city of Huaraz. She feels good because she says that country life is very calm and quiet compared to the city. With this loan, which she will repay within 4 months, she will purchase seeds to grow alfalfa, guinea pigs and rabbits. Corina hopes to make a good profit so that she can improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds to grow alfalfa, guinea pigs and rabbits

loans.name: Julia Bertha

texts.en: Julia is a member of the Covadonga Village Bank. She is 50 years old and is married with six children. She and her husband have a carpentry workshop in their house in the Covadonga neighborhood. They work on special orders and Julia helps her husband to sand and paint. Julia is requesting a loan to buy more wood. She dreams of expanding her business, of working more and that her children will finish their studies.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Azucena Eusebia

texts.es:
Azucena M. Domínguez forma parte del Banco Comunal “Señor Del Cautivo II” del distrito de Independencia, provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Tiene 40 años de edad y es madre soltera de dos hijos. Comenta que la mayor dificultad en su vida ha sido enfrentar, junto a sus hijos, las carencias económicas que ha tenido a causa del abandono del padre de sus hijos. Tiene como su mayor logro haber podido educar a sus hijos mediante su trabajo que le ha dado mucha satisfacción porque con ello ha podido construir una casa y ha podido educar a sus hijos, aunque también tristeza porque se siente sola debido a que sus hijos por su trabajo han llegado a tener mayor cariño a su abuela, por ello ha decidido viajar fuera del país para poder trabajar. Vende especerías en un puesto ambulatorio en el Jr. Hualcán  en la ciudad de Huaraz. Compra los insumos de los mayoristas quienes vienen desde la zona costa que procesa en su casa para venderlos diariamente.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,300, el cual será cancelado en 8 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de ají y condimentos de reserva para las fechas navideñas, que es cuando la gente consume estos productos en mayor cantidad.
 
Azucena comenta que le gustaría capacitarse para mejorar su negocio y también su vida personal.
texts.en:
Azucena M. Domínguez belongs to the communal bank “Señor Del Cautivo II” in the Independence district, Huaraz province, in the department of Ancash. She is 40 years old and the single mother of two children. She comments that the biggest difficulty in her life has been confronting, along with her kids, the financial hardships caused by their father’s abandonment. Her biggest accomplishment has been educating her children through her work which has given her much satisfaction because, thanks to this, she has able to build a house and send her children to school. Regardless, she sometimes feels sad at being alone and because of her time spent at work her children have become very close to their grandmother. For this, she has decided to travel abroad to be able to work. She sells specialties from a stand located on Hualcán Street in the city of Huaraz. She purchases her supplies from wholesalers who come to the area and she processes them in her house to sell on a daily basis. With the loan of 2,300.00 soles, to be repaid in 8 installments, she will invest in the purchase of aji (peppers) and condiments for the holiday season which is when customers buy her products in great quantity. Azucena comments that she would like to learn how to manage her business more capably, as well as her personal life.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ají and condiments.

loans.name: Karina

texts.en: Karina is a member of the Kusirituy Village Bank; “Kusirikuy” means “get happy” in Quechua. She is 23 years old and lives with her partner and their son. Karina has a stand in the Gamarra Gamarrita Gallery, where she sells a variety of second-hand clothing. She used to sell from a market stall, but had to change locations because her lease was not renewed. Her sales have improved, and she is planning to travel to Lima to buy new clothes to sell. Karina needs a loan to buy new light jackets and blouses. Karina’s dreams are to own a large, strategically located store and for her son to grow up to be a minister.

loans.use: To buy new jackets and blouses to sell

loans.name: Jinna

texts.es:
Jinna pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Grandes Retos” del distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Tiene 20 años de edad y junto a su conviviente tienen 1 hijo. Afirma que su principal dificultad ha sido adecuarse a la ciudad de Huaraz porque es natural de la zona selva específicamente de Tocache. Desde hace 3 años vive en al ciudad de Huaraz y ha iniciado un negocio de venta de ropa a pedido y el lugar donde vive con su conviviente, Av. Manco Cápac 159, le sirve de almacén. Empezó este negocio con la venta de joyas y que ahora está invirtiendo en la venta de ropa. Su principal dificultad es que a veces los clientes se olvidan de pagarle o no le pagan a tiempo y ella tiene que buscarlos en sus respectivos domicilios para cobrarles.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de ropa para niños.
 
Jinna piensa crecer en su negocio y agradece el apoyo de su Banco Comunal por colaborar en su crecimiento.
texts.en:
Jinna belongs to the cooperative bank “Mujeres de Grandes Retos” (“Women of Great Challenges”), in the district and province of Huaraz, in the Ancash department. She is 20 years old and has one child with her partner. She affirms that her biggest challenge has been relocating to the city of Huaraz, as she is originally from the jungle area of Tocache. She has lived in Huaraz for three years, and has started a business selling clothing on order. The place where she lives with her partner, on Manco Cápac Avenue, is where she has installed her business. She started out selling jewelry, and is now investing in clothing sales. Her biggest hurdle is that, at times, her customers forget to pay her or don’t pay her on time. This forces her to seek them out in their respective homes in order to collect. With this loan of 500.00 soles, to be repaid in 4 installments, she will invest in the purchase of children’s clothes. Jinna plans to expand her business, and is grateful for the cooperative bank’s support and collaboration towards her growth.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase children's clothing.

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.en: Olga is a member of the Kusirituy Village Bank; “Kusirikuy” means “get happy” in Quechua. Olga is 24 years old and is married with five children. She and her husband have a store in a rented space. They sell bicycles, bike parts, and accessories, which they buy in the city of Ayacucho. Her husband also repairs bikes. The couple also owns a mototaxi, which her husband drives in Ayacucho. She is requesting a loan to buy replacement bike parts. Olga’s dreams are to open a larger, wholesale store and for her children to graduate from college with professional degrees.

loans.use: To buy replacement bicycle parts

loans.name: Zenabu

texts.en:
Zenabu A. is a 36-year-old married woman. She and her husband have four children, three of whom are currently in school while the oldest child is married and lives with her husband. She sells porridge in her neighborhood, and she explains that porridge is a very popular breakfast food enjoyed by nearly all Ghanians. More specifically, porridge is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, and is boiled and taken with sugar, milk, and bread; or, porridge could be taken with what Ghanians call Kose, which is prepared from milled beans and is fried with cooking oil for approximately 20 minutes so it can be served with the porridge.

Fortunately, Zenabu has developed a large and loyal customer base, so she is now seeking a loan to increase her porridge production by buying more raw materials such as bags of maize, millet, beans, sugar, and milk. She also would use a portion of the loan proceeds to increase her lingerie sales. In turn, she hopes to generate sufficient income to support her kids in school.

Notably, she is a member of group known as the "Abrabopa" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each others' loans as social collateral (i.e., if one member does not promptly repay his or her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears), and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans. She notes that she does not work during days when her group meets, and that her picture was taken at one of the group meetings.

loans.use: To increase her business' porridge production by purchasing additional raw materials (e.g., maize, millet, sugar, and milk)

loans.name: Yesica Yanet

texts.es:
Yesica forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Pariahuanquinas II” del distrito de Pariahuanca, provincia de Carhuaz, departamento de Ancash.

Tiene 23 años de edad y 01 hijo junto a su conviviente que es obrero. Comenta que se encuentra tranquila y que su logro ha sido ser independiente, vivir solamente con su familia. Vende golosinas, tanto en su casa que se encuentra ubicada frente a la plaza de Pariahuanca, como en el centro educativo de Pariahuanca. Sus productos los compra en la ciudad de Huaraz. También nos dice que su negocio ha crecido porque hace un tiempo vendía solamente helados. Actualmente ha diversificado su negocio con golosinas. Afirma que se encuentra tranquila y espera seguir creciendo en su negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de golosinas.
 
A Yesica le gustaría capacitarse para seguir adelante en su negocio y en su vida personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Yesica belongs to the “Mujeres Pariahuanquinas II” cooperative bank, located in the Pariahuanca district, Carhuaz province, in the Ancash department. She is 23 years old, and has one child with her partner who is a laborer. She comments that she feels content with her achievement of financial independence and of living only with her immediate family. She sells sweets both from her home, located in front of the Pariahuanca plaza, as well as in the educational center of that area. She buys her products in the city of Huaraz. She also tells us that her business has grown because, at one time, she only sold ice creams. Currently, she has diversified her enterprise to include other sweets/candy. She notes that she lives peacefully, and hopes to continue expanding her business. With this loan of 300.00 soles, to be repaid in four installments, she will invest in the purchase of candies. Yesica would like to learn further how to help her business get ahead, and how to manage her personal and family lives capably.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of candy/sweets.

loans.name: Maximo

texts.en: Maximo is a member of the Morenita Huamanga Village Bank. Maximo and his wife have a workshop called M. where they sew custom-made clothing. They receive orders from institutions and have six employees. The couple buys their materials in the city of Lima.  Maximo needs a loan to buy a variety of fabrics. He dreams of providing his children with a good education, of exporting his clothing, and of getting his children involved in his business.

loans.use: To buy fabric for tailoring shop

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence A. is a 52-year-old married woman with seven children. Two of them are currently learning apprenticeship in the auto mechanic and glazing industries. Florence started her fish-selling business 25 years ago in Teshie, a suburb of Accra, where she lives. Specifically, Florence prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good fish meals. She has lots of customers who buy from her stand. 

With the loan, she wants to increase her working capital to enable her purchase fresh fish in bulk to serve her community. She expects to see her business grow and to be able to support her children’s education. she is a member of the loan group known as the "Abrabopa" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each others' loans as social collateral and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans. She was in a meeting with her group members when her photograph was taken.

loans.use: To purchase assorted fresh fish.

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso Group

texts.en: "Nuevo Progreso" is a large group of borrowers from Esperanza International. Right now there are 13 hopefuls looking for another loan. Priseida is the representative of this group and also one of the group leaders. She was chosen because she is an extremely faithful and trustworthy person. She is the mother of four children and runs a small beauty salon. Before her first loan she was barely able to take care of her children, but now can proviD. food each day and even save for the future, such as her children's education. Priseida hopes she can make enough to send them all to college. She has been increasing her business at a steady pace, and feels like this next loan will take her to a new level. She is excited about her business and excited to have something to call her own. She feels like she is on the path to a better life and wants nothing more than a better future for her loved ones. The whole group is excited about this loan and ready for the challenge!

loans.use: To buy products for the salon

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma O., thirty years old. She is a married woman with two children who are in the high school. Emma lives with her family in Teshie in Ghana. She runs a small grocery kiosk in her neighbourhood. She also sells food items such as macaroni, tomatoes, etc on a table top in front of her kiosk. She has been in business for five years. She buys her goods from wholesalers in the city market and retail to her customers. Emma wants a bigger working capital. She desires to buy the goods in bulk whenever she travels to the city market in order to save her the problem of frequent trips. She is a member of the community group called “Do Good”. The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan support one another in handling repayment. She was in a meeting with her group members when her photograph was taken.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries like assorted drinks, sugar, bottled mineral water, and biscuits etc.

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
Hope has been financially down since the death of her husband. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance. Hope is a fashion designer. She makes lovely designs for her customers. Hope also sells clothes and tailoring materials to her customers. She is happy because the demands for her tailoring skills will increase during this yuletide season.

Hope is 48 years old and she is a widow with 2 children. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase a sewing machine, tailoring materials, and one deep freezer to start the sale of drinks. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and one deep-freezer

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en: Jesusa is a member of the Morenita Huamanga Village Bank. She is 53 years old and is married, with four children. She has a stand at the April 12th Market, where she sells dry goods and ground spices that she prepares herself very early in the morning. She is requesting a loan to buy rice and sugar. Her dreams are to educate her children so that they graduate with professional degrees and to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana María O. V. forma parte del Banco Comunal “Señor del cautivo II” del distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Ana María tiene 48 años de edad, es separada, no ha tenido hijos y menciona que su única dificultad fue tener a su conviviente que la maltrataba, superar la muerte de su bebé y como resultado la separación de su conviviente. Nos dice que después de muchos maltratados se sobrepuso y logró tener su negocio, de tal forma que ahora tiene dos tiendas, una tienda de flores artificiales y la otra es un locutorio con materiales y útiles de Limpieza, Comenta que empezó con muchas penurias, pero por medio de un traspaso logró obtener la tienda de flores y poco a poco habilitó la segunda tienda que ahora administra y cuida. Compra sus productos en la ciudad de lima para abastecerse. Menciona que la única dificultad en su negocio es que ella no encuentra a alguien de confianza para dejar a cargo sus tiendas, cuando sale a realizar sus compras y reuniones.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,300., el cual será cancelado en 8 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de materiales de limpieza, pañales y flores para navidad.
 
Ana maría comenta que el tiempo le es escaso, pero sí le gustaría capacitarse para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana María O. V. belongs to the “Señor del Cautivo II” cooperative bank, located in the district and province of Huaraz, in the Ancash department. Ana María is 48 years old, separated, and does not have children. She mentions that difficulties for her have included being married to someone who mistreated her, getting over the death of her baby, and the resulting separation from her husband. She tells us that, after much mistreatment, she managed to forge onward and start her own business. She currently has two stores, one where she sells artificial flowers and another which is a shop with cleaning supplies. She comments that she started with scarce resources, but little by little was able to outfit her flower store and then the second store. She buys her products in the city of Lima to supply her businesses. She mentions that one problem she confronts is finding someone honest and that she can depend on to help tend to her stores while she goes out to run errands and make purchases. With this loan of 2,300.00 soles, to be repaid in eight installments, she will invest in the purchase of cleaning supplies, rags and flowers for Christmas. Ana María comments that, though she has little spare time, she would like to learn how to better manage her enterprise.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cleaning supplies, rags, and flowers.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara A. is a 33-year-old married woman with three kids. They are currently in school. For the past two years, she has worked as a trader: she trades in jeans, clothes, blouses, skirts, women's underwear, bags, and plastic materials. Sara says her husband had provided the working capital for her business, but that such capital is inadequate to sustain her business because she is unable to purchase high-quality products. 

With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into her trade to enable her purchase high-quality products in large quantities, which she believe will scale up sales. She is a member of a community group known as the "Abrabopa" (Translated, Good Life) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each others' loans as social collateral and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans. Sara had joined her group at a meeting when her photograph was taken.

loans.use: To  purchase more jeans, ladies' clothing, and slippers

loans.name: Ifeoma

texts.en:
Ifeoma has a restaurant where she sells juice, drinks, cooked foods, and pepper soup. She has lots of customers patronizing her restaurant. Ifeoma is 30 years old and married with a child. Her husband sells electronics at Alaba international market.

Ifeoma has been in the restaurant business for the past 2 years. She is a LAPO client. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more drinks and juice to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and juice to sell

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana A. is a 30-year-old married woman with one child, who is currently in school. For the past five years, she has been supporting her husband to pay for their child's education by operating a seamstress shop. She sews all types and styles of female clothes, including kaba and slit, wedding dresses, funeral clothes, etc. She trains 2 young ladies in sewing as future carrier.

With the loan, she wants to purchase more sewing materials such as linens, threads, and thimbles to enable her meet her customers demands. She hopes to increase her savings to continue to support her child in school. She is a member of a loan group known as the "Abrabopa" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each others' loans as social collateral and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans. She was in attendance during her group meeting when her photograph was taken.

loans.use: To purchase additional sewing materials like linens, threads, thimbles, etc.)

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Gloria María forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras de Nicrupampa”, del distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Gloria tiene 39 años de edad y es madre soltera de una niña. Después de que su padre murió no tuvo apoyo debido a que también su conviviente abandonó el hogar, motivo por el cual tuvo que enfrentar y asumir la responsabilidad de su hija sola sin el apoyo de su padre ni de su conviviente. Su padre afortunadamente no la dejó desamparada como ella comenta, porque heredó un terreno a medio construir en el malecón norte del Río Quillcay s/n, terreno que ella ha podido terminar de construir para brindar los cuartos en alquiler. Comenta que la única dificultad ha sido tener que adecuar la casa con mucho esfuerzo para habilitarlos y tener ingresos tanto para ella como para su hija.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en el mejoramiento de sus cuartos para el alquiler de los mismos y la promoción de su hija.
 
A gloria le interesa emprender nuevos negocios en sociedad con su hermana. Afirma que es importante saber de temas de negocio..
texts.en:
Gloria María is part of “Las Triunfadoras de Nicrupampa” communal bank, in the district and province of Huaraz, Ancash Department. Gloria, 39, is the single mother of one daughter. After her father died she had no help, and because her partner also abandoned the home, she had to confront and assume sole responsibility for her daughter, without the help of either her father or her partner. Fortunately, her father did not leave her forsaken, as she says, because she inherited a half-built lot in the north waterfront of the Quillcay River. She has been able to complete the construction so she could rent out the rooms. She comments that the only difficulty has been the effort it has taken to make the house habitable for herself and her daughter as well as to generate income. This loan of $400, which will be repaid in 4 months, will be invested in the improvement of her rental rooms and in furthering her daughter's graduation. Gloria is interested in undertaking a new business together with her sister. She says that it is important to know about business matters.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the improvement of her rental rooms

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella sells cooked foods and bagged water in her shop located at Alaba international market. Stella has two salesgirls that assist her in her restaurant.

Stella is 40 years old and married with 2 children. She hopes to meet the demand of her customers. She is a LAPO client. She is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet sells foodstuffs such as rice, palm oil, vegetable oil, and tomato paste. Violet travels to Togo and Cotonou to purchase foodstuffs to sell in Lagos state. She is 38 years old and married with 4 children.

Violet is a LAPO client. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort B. is a 62-year-old married woman and the mother of six kids. Currently all of her children are working in their various professions, such as: teaching, welding, and hairdressing. She is into the sale of fresh fish, the business through which she makes a living. She has been selling fresh fish for thirteen years to support her family. She travels to various fishing communities to buy her stock of fish in order to avoid dealing with middlemen because middlemen buy from the fish farmers and re-sell to her at higher prices. 

She is now seeking a loan to buy fresh fish in bulk to better serve her loyal customers. She hopes to use a portion of her profits to further support her business' expansion and growth. Comfort is a member of a loan group known as the "Abrabopa" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each others' loans as social collateral and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans.

loans.use: To purchase fresh fish in bulk

loans.name: Sonia Martha

texts.es:
Sonia Martha P. T. forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras de Nicrupampa” del distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Sonia Martha tiene 36 años de edad y es conviviente con un hijo. Comenta que aún cuando su mayor dificultad fue recuperarse de la pérdida de su bebé cuando aún estaba embarazada, ha tenido la tranquilidad de tener a otro pequeño que ella considera su mayor éxito, así como tener una carrera profesional, pero que lamentablemente no ha podido ejercer. En la actualidad se dedica al alquiler de cuartos los cuales obtuvo por medio de la herencia de su padre en la Av. Las Flores N° 203 Nicrupampa. Habitaciones que van mejorando para incrementar el precio del alquiler. Sencuentra tranquila y con el deseo de emprender nuevos negocios.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en el mejoramiento de sus habitaciones para el alquiler de los mismos.
 
Sonia desea emprender nuevos negocios para lo cual desea capacitarse y aprender.
texts.en:
Sonia belongs to the Las Triunfadoras de Nicrupampa ["The (Women) Victors of Nicrupampa"] community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ancash. She is 36 years old, partnered and has one son. She says that the hardest time of her life was losing a baby during a past pregnancy. She ultimately had the peace of mind to have another baby, a child she considers her greatest success. She studied for a professional career but, unfortunately, she wasn't able to work in her chosen field. She now rents rooms in a house on the Avenida Nicrupampa that she inherited from her father. She's improving the rooms so that she can increase the rent. She's pleased with what she's accomplished and hopes to start new businesses in the future.

With this S/.1,200 [1,200 Peruvian soles] loan, to be repaid in 4 installments, she will invest in improving her rooms so that she can rent them.

Sonia wants to start other businesses so she'd like to train and learn.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve rooms for room-rental business.

loans.name: Bukola

texts.en: Bukola sells gifts and prayer items. Bukola is a LAPO client. She is 35 years old and married with a child. Bukola lives in Shibiri, Lagos state, Nigeria. She is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more prayer items and gifts to sell. She hopes to expand her business. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more gifts and prayer items to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira forma parte del Banco Comunal “Señor Del Cautivo II” del distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Tiene 55 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Comenta que su mayor dificultad es encontrarse sola en esta ciudad porque es de la ciudad de Lima y toda su familia se encuentra en dicho lugar, también comenta que a pesar de todo, su negocio le ha traído muchas sonrisas, porque ha podido colaborar con su esposo para construir su casa y ampliar su negocio. En la actualidad no le va muy bien en el negocio porque tiene mucha competencia. Vende ropa de manera ambulatoria en el pasaje del Banco de la Nación en la ciudad de Huaraz. Ha pensado abandonar el negocio porque poco a poco está bajando la venta por la presencia de muchos vendedores de sus mismos productos, aunque menciona que actualmente está pensando diversificar sus productos y tiene la esperanza de mejorar sus ventas en esta campaña navideña, para lo cual contará con la ayuda de su esposo.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,300, el cual será cancelada en 8 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de juguetes, paraguas y casacas a pedido.
 
Elvira afirma que su trabajo es muy valioso para su crecimiento personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Elvira is a member of the “Señor Del Cautivo II” community bank in the district and province of Huaraz, in the department of Ancash. She is a 55 year old married woman with 3 children. She says that the hardest thing for her is to not know anyone in the city, since she is from Lima, where all of her family is still located. On the other hand, she says that her business has brought her much happiness, because she has been able to work with her husband to build her home and increase her business. Currently, her business has not been doing well due to competition. She sells clothing door to door near Banco de la Nacion in the city of Juarez. She has considered giving up her business due to low sales and the prevalence of other vendors selling the same products. At the same time, she says that she has considered diversifying her product line, homing to improve her sales leading up to Christmas time, when she will receive help from her husband. With this loan of 2,300 soles, which she will repay in 8 payments, she will invest in the purchase of toys, umbrellas, and jackets which she offers on order. Elvira affirms the fact that her job is very important to her personal and family growth.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of toys, umbrellas, and jackets.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia S. is a 24-year-old married woman with two kids. For the past four years, Afia has been making a living through trading. She owns and operates a jewelry shop in her community. She sells earrings, necklaces, wristwatches etc. and supports her family with income from this business.

With the loan, She wants to increase her working capital to enable her purchase high quality jewelry products to serve her loyal customers during this festive seasons. She believes that she will generate additional income to improve her family's living conditions. She is a member of a group known as the "Abrabopa" (translated, Good life)Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each others' loans as social collateral and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans. She was in attendance during her group meeting when her photograph was taken.

loans.use: To purchase more earrings, necklaces, wristwatches etc.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy O. is a 40-year-old married woman with one child, who is currently in school. She has been trading for the past five years. she trades in clothing and lace materials. She treks to Nigeria to purchase lace clothes from wholesalers. Mercy believes in hard work and dedication in all aspects of her life. She is one of the successful traders in the Teshie market due to her good customer care. 

She requests for the loan to augment her working capital to enable her purchase additional high-quality products to meet her customers' demands. She hopes to make more income during this festive season to support her family, especially the kid's education. She belongs to the community group known as the Peter Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each others' loans as social collateral and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans. Mercy was in attendance during her group meeting when photograph was taken.

loans.use: To purchase  higher-quality clothing and lace materials.

loans.name: Delia Patricia

texts.es:
Delia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Grandes Retos” del distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. A pesar que su esposo trabaja en la Región Ancash, menciona que le hace falta el trabajo, porque junto a su esposo desean independizarse. Actualmente viven en la casa de los padres de ella, en la Av. Manco Cápac. 133, donde también es su lugar de venta. Vede ropa que trae desde la ciudad de Lima y Trujillo para distribuir a pedido a sus clientes. A pesar que menciona que su vida transcurre tranquilamente, comenta que su dificultad es que sus clientes a veces no pagan a tiempo o no le pagan los productos que ella les brinda a crédito.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será cancelado en 5 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de prendas de vestir y para el viaje y fiesta de promoción de su hijo.
 
Delia comenta que le gustaría recibir capacitaciones para mejorar su negocio y su vida personal.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the “Mujeres de Grandes Retos” communal bank, located in the district and province of Huaraz, in the department of Ancash. She is 42 years old, and is married with 3 children. Although her husband works in the Ancash area, she says that work has been slow, and that both she and her husband would like to become independent. The currently live in a house that belongs to Delia's parents, on Manco Capac avenue, number 133, where they also maintain their sales area. They offer clothing for sale, which they bring from the cities of Lima and Trujillo to sell on order to customers. Although she says they have a calm life, she mentions that the hardest thing is that sometimes customers do not pay on time, or they do not pay for products that she sells them on credit. With this 1,200 sol loan, which she will repay in 5 payments, Delia will invest in the purchase of clothing, and in payment for a trip and party for her son. Delia says that she enjoys receiving training to improve her business and personal life.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing purchase

loans.name: Lina Viviana

texts.es: La Sra. LINA T., es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo, se dedica a la D. venta D. ropa, principalmente deportiva, en uno D. los mercados D. ropa más grandes del país, en el cual es propietaria D. un pequeño puesto D. venta. Quedo viuda hace algunos años por lo que su trabajo es su único medio D. vida y con este esfuerzo y sacrificio sustenta a sus hijos, quienes tambien colaboran en la venta D. ropa en su tiempo libre. La señora es una persona emprendedora que afronta los retos con entereza. Trabaja con nuestra institución desD. el 22 D. julio D. 2008 y actualmente paga al día sus cuotas, es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora.
texts.en:
Mrs Lina T. is a hard worker who sells clothing - primarily sport clothes, in one of the largest clothing markets in the country where she has her own small stand. She was widowed a few years ago, and since then her job has been her only means of support. Her children also work helping her to sell clothing in their free time. Lina is an enterprising woman who faces challenges with fortituD.. She has worked with our institution since July 22, 2008, and as a responsible and hard working woman, she always makes her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products for sale

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia T. is a 32-year-old married woman with two kids. She lives with her family in Teshie in the Greater Accra region of Ghana. To earn a living, she sells eggs in her neighborhood. she makes her sales through 'hawking', a term used to describe door-to-door sales. She balances her goods of eggs on her head and moves to the door steps of her loyal customers. She says that the price of eggs has almost doubled over the last few months and this dwindled her working capital. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of eggs in bulk in order to avoid the constant price hikes. She hopes that the loan would enable her to make more income during this Christmas season, save more money to support her kids in school. Leticia is a member of the group known as the Macedonia Trust Group." In this group, members guarantee each others' loans as social collateral and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of eggs.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Mayda es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Grandes Retos”, tiene 33 años de edad y es madre de una niña. Su más grande éxito en su vida personal es ser profesional y como única dificultad es que está separada y sus ingresos son los únicos con los que cubre todos los gastos familiares.  Actualmente se dedica a la venta de ropa y joyas a pedido, que trae desde la ciudad de Lima y distribuye a sus clientes al crédito y al contado. Su último crédito de 300 soles lo invirtió en la compra de joyas y zapatos. Mayda comenta que le gustaría recibir capacitaciones para mejorar su negocio y su vida personal.
texts.en: Mayda is a member of the "Mujeres de Grandes Retos" communal bank. She is 33 years old and is the mother of a little girl. Her biggest success in her personal life is being a professional and her only difficulty is that she is separated and her income is the only one that covers all of the family expenses. She works in the sale of clothes and jewelry, which she brings from Lima and distributes to her clients on credit and with cash. Her last credit of 300 soles was invested in the purchase of jewelry and shoes. Mayda comments that she likes receiving trainings to better her business and personal life.

loans.use: Purchase of jewelry and shoes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. runs a grocery store and is requesting a loan to buy more stock. Mary is 32 years old and married. Her husband also runs the grocery store. She has two children who do not go to school. With the extra profits generated by this loan, she hopes to be able to send the children to school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es: La señora Saturnina, es una muy buena cliente de la institución, vive en la ciudad de El Alto, Bolivia en una casa muy sencilla y pequeña, que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos de sanidad, junto a ella vive su pequeño hijo quien se encuentra aún en edad escolar a quien cuida con mucho cariño y amor ya que ella es madre soltera. Se dedica a la venta de manteles, toallas y ropa, en la Feria de la Zona 16 de Julio, una populosa feria de la ciudad. Actualmente no cuenta con una gran stock de productos, es por ello que solicita este crédito, que le servirá para incrementar su stock de productos para su venta este fin de año.
texts.en:
Ms Saturnina is a very good customer of this institution. She lives in the city of El Alto, Bolivia, in a simple and small home which has all of the basic sanitary needs. She lives with her small school aged son, who she cares for with plenty of love and affection, as she is now a single mother. She works selling tablecloths, towels, and clothing in the Zona 16 de Julio market - a popular market in the city. Currently she does not have a wide stock of products, and that is why she is requesting this loan which she will use to increase her inventory of products to sell as the year ends.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Hermelinda Juana

texts.es:
Hermelinda forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Pariahuanquinas II”, del distrito de Pariahuanca, provincia de Carhuaz, departamento de Ancash.

Hermelinda tiene 28 años de edad y junto a su conviviente tienen un hijo y una hija. Su más grande dificultad ha sido enfrentar las carencias económicas, afirma que apoya a su conviviente, el cual vende abarrotes y los distribuye. Ha establecido en su casa un locutorio público el cual administra, pero le va regular porque en Pariahuanca no hay mucha población y no hay mucha cobertura en las líneas celulares, pero aún así ella asegura que se encuentra tranquila.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en el pago de las tarifas de las líneas del locutorio.
 
Hermelinda asevera que es necesario aprender para poder administrar mejor un negocio.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is a member of the “Mujeres Pariahuanquinas II” community bank, located in the district of Pariahuanca, Carhuaz province, department of Ancash. Hermelinda is 28 years old, and she lives with the father of her son and daughter. Her greatest challenge has been an economic shortage. She has the support of her common law husband who sells and delivers groceries. She has established in her home a public telephone which she runs, though her success has been limited, due to the small population in Pariahuanca and the limited cellular coverage. Even so, she says that she is doing well. With this 300 sol loan, which she will repay in 4 payments, she will invest in the payment of the bills for her telephone lines. Hermalinda asserts that it is necessary to learn in order to better administer a business.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in the payment of public telephone bills

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda forma parte del Banco Comunal “Palatinas Al Progreso” del distrito de Tarica, provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.
 
Tiene 48 años de edad, 5 hijos y es conviviente. A pesar que sufrió la muerte de su primer conviviente y quedó viuda a la edad de 27 años con cuatro hijos, considera la experiencia más difícil que pasó, sin embargo supo sobreponerse. En la actualidad ya casi todos sus hijos son independientes y ella trabaja para su hijo mas pequeño. Cría animales menores, como conejos y cuyes, así mismo es revendedora (intermediaria entre los productores y el consumidor directo) de verduras y frutas en la feria de Huaraz que se dan los lunes y los jueves. Comenta que ha crecido mucho y que se encuentra tranquila trabajando.
 
Con este préstamo de S/.1,400, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de alimentos para sus cuyes, conejos y chanchos.
 
Hermelinda asegura que aún necesita aprender más para seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is part of the “Palatinas Al Progreso” communal bank of the Tarica district in Huaraz province in the department of Ancash. She is 48 years old, has five children and cohabitates. Despite having endured the death of her first partner and being left a widow at age 27 with four children, she considers that experience her most difficult time and has been able to recover. Currently, almost all of her children are independent and she works for her youngest child. She raises small animals such as rabbits and guinea pigs and sells (buys from producers and sells to consumers) fruits and vegetables at the Huaraz market on Mondays and Thursdays. She says she has grown a lot and is calm about working. With this loan of S/.1,400 which will be paid back in six quotas, she will invest in purchasing food for her guinea pigs, rabbits and pigs. Hermelinda is sure that she still has a lot to learn in order to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food for her guinea pigs, rabbits and pigs

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria forma parte del Banco Comunal “Palatinas Al Progreso” del distrito de Tarica, provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Tiene 68 años de edad, 7 hijos y vive junto a su conviviente que es albañil. Su principal dificultad es el dolor de huesos que siente cuando camina mucho y cuando se mantiene de pie por mucho tiempo. Comenta que ha crecido mucho porque ha puesto su negocio de venta de golosinas en el Colegio José Carlos Mariátegui de Paltay, al costado del negocio de su hija. Aunque la vida en el campo le parece más agradable ha optado por este negocio por ser más sencillo el trabajo, aunque cada mañana ordeña a sus vacas que tiene en casa y con la venta de la leche apoya a sus hijos económicamente.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de medicinas para su vaca debido a que sufrió un accidente y necesita el animal en buen estado porque también es un sostén para su familia, así mismo comprará golosinas para su negocio.
 
Victoria espera permanecer en su banco comunal porque recientemente se está integrando y desea seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Victoria is part of the “Palatinas Al Progreso” communal bank in the Tarica district of the Huaraz province in the Ancash department. She is 68 years old, has seven children and lives with her partner, who is a bricklayer. Her main difficulty is her ,aching bones, which she feels when she walks a lot and when she stands for a long time. She says she has grown a lot because she has a candy store in the José Carlos Mariátegui de Paltay school, next to her daughter’s store. Although she finds the country more agreeable, she has decided to continue with the store because it is more straightforward. However, every morning she milks her cows and with the milk sales, she can support her children financially. With this S/.500 loan, which will be paid back in four quotas, she will invest in medicines for her cow, as it has been in an accident, and Victoria needs the cow to be in good condition to support her family. Additionally, she will purchase candy for her store. Victoria hopes to stay with her communal bank because she just recently joined and hopes to keep growing.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase medicine for her cow and purchase candy

loans.name: Benjamín Felix

texts.es: El Sr. Benjamin, es un hombre muy trabajador, que desde pequeño, demostró sus cualidades manuales, es así que aprendiendo de su madre aprende los oficios de la costura y el bordado, trabaja junto a su esposa quien le ayuda en la elaboración de ropa interior femenina en un pequeño taller ubicado en su casa, labor que realiza desde hace varios años de forma artesanal, y gracias a su trabajo mantiene a sus dos hijos, quienes tambien han demostrado habilidad para la costura y confección artesanal de ropa interior femenina, es así que toda la familia se dedica a la costura. Toda la familia trabaja muy duro con el sueño de hacer ampliar su pequeña casa para así tener un taller más amplio y vivir más comodamente.
texts.en:
Benjamin is a hard working man. Since a young age, he has demonstrated a talent for manual skills and was able to learn sewing and embroidering from his mother. He works with his wife, whom he helps making women’s interior garments in a small workshop in their house. He has been doing this work for many years and is thus able to support his two children, whom also have a talent for making women’s interior garments. Therefore, the entire family is dedicated to sewing. The family works very hard with the hope of expanding their small house to have a larger workshop and to live more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Flor Kantutita Group

texts.es:
La Sra. María es la fundadora y presidenta del grupo crediticio con garantía cruzada "FLOR KANTUTITA". Es una persoan muy responsable y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de El Alto, Bolivia junto a su esposo, quien trabaja en una imprenta muy distante a su hogar, es empleado y al igual que ella es un hombre muy trabajador. Maria elabora artesanalmente embutidos de res que porteriormente vende en la ciudad de La Paz ubicada a unos 50 Km de la ciudad de El Alto y los jueves y domingos vende sus productos en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Inmgreso con el cual ayuda a mantener a sus dos hijos. Es una  familia unida y dedicada, el dinero que reunen tendrá el fin de alquilar una casita, porque actualmente viven en la casa de los suegros.			
			
La Sra. Viviana pertenece al Grupo Solidario "FLOR KANTUTITA" . Es muy responsable y joven, vive con su esposo, un joven que trabaja como ayudante de bus y aporta con lo que puede a su hogar ya que su salario es muy bajo. Es asío que Sandra ayuda a la mantención del hogar mediante la venta de cinturones y otros accesorios en una calle de la ciudad de El Alto, labor que le permite mantener a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Maria is the founder and president of the communal bank “Flor Kantutita”. She is very responsible and hard-working. She lives in the city of El Alto, Bolivia with her husband, who works at a printing press that is quite far from their house. He is employed and like Maria, is a very hard worker. Maria makes meat sausages which she then sells in La Paz, which is approximately 50 kilometers from El Alto. Also, on Thursdays and Sundays, she sells her products in the El Alto market. This income allows her to support her two children. The family is united and dedicated. The money they make will allow them to rent a house, because they currently live in their in-laws’ house. Viviana is a member of the “Flor Kantutita” communal bank. She is very responsible and young. She lives with her husband, a young man who works on a bus and supports his household with what he can, as his salary is very low. Viviana helps maintain the household and her young son by selling belts and other accessories on the street in El Alto.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Asa

texts.en:
Asa E. currently sells clothes and sugar and is requesting a loan to buy more clothing to sell. Asa is 28 years old and married. Her husband works in agriculture. She has five children, who are all going to school. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay for the children's schooling.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ruslana

texts.en:
Ruslana is married and has one daughter. She owns a kiosk at the central market in Ivano-Frankivsk city. She sells  clothing for babies and children.  

Ruslana has been in this business for 10 years. She started her business after her daughter was born and the family needed more money. First, she worked for someone else selling clothing, but then her friend suggested that she start working for herself. Being a hard-working and determined person Ruslana has made this business a success. Now she plans to increase her business and open a second kiosk. This business is the only source of income for the family.

Rusland would like to get a loan for $875 to purchase children jackets, hats and other clothing. The additional inventory will help her to increase the variety of goods and serve to her clients even better. The income she earns would help her to pay for her daughter's school and fix up their house so they can have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase children's jackets, hats and other clothing for sale

loans.name: Angela Julia

texts.es: La señora Angela es una persona muy responsable, en todo el tiempo que trabaja con nosotros, no ha tenido dias de atraso , pagando sus cuotas siempre de manera puntual, Es una mujer divorciada del esposo, por lo que ella matiene a sus tres hijos, aportando con lo todo lo que puede a su hogar, ya que actualmente el esposo, no tiene trabajo, por lo que no puede agar la pensión de sus hijos. Angela se dedica a la venta de edredones que costura con mucha habilidad en la Feria 16 de Julio, una de las ferias más grandes del país. Trabaja con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación para darles mejores condiciones de vida a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Angela is a responsible person. In all the time she was worked with us, she has not been late on a single payment. She is divorced and raises her three children. She brings in all that she can, since her ex-husband is unemployed and cannot provide support for the children. Angela sells quilts, which she skillfully sews herself, in the 16 de Julio market, one of the biggest markets in the country. She works hard and with a lot of dedication to improve her children’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es: La señora Felicidad es una persona muy responsable, vive en condiciones muy humildes junto a sus esposo y sus pequeños hijos, en un pequeño cuarto en una casa familiar, pagan mes a mes su alquiler de manera muy responsable. Su esposo trabaja como ayudante de albañil y aporta a la mantención del hogar con lo poco que pueda. A su vez la señora Felicidad trabaja muy arduamente para ayudar a la mantención del hogar mediante la venta de herramientas y material de ferretería de manera ambulante en las ferias, mercados y calles de la ciudad de El Alto, Bolivia, con lo cual aporta tambien al hogar, es una señora muy dedicada a su familia y el dinero que reunan será destinado a comprar una casa propia.
texts.en:
Felicidad is a responsible person, who lives in humble conditions with her husband and small children. They live in a small room in a communal house and pay their monthly rent on time. Her husband works as a bricklayer and supports the family with what he can. At the same time, Felicidad works hard to help maintain the household by selling tools and hardware items at the fairs, markets and in the streets of El Alto, Bolivia. She is very dedicated to her family and the money she makes will be put towards purchasing their own home.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Valentin Felix

texts.es:
Valentin es artesano y confecciona sombreros para el sol, los comercializa por docena a los puestos de venta donde venden por detalle; también comercializa en el interior (Santa Cruz y Cochabamba). Esta actividad es su fuente de ingreso con  que cubre la manutención de su pequeño hijo y su madre. Valentín vive en la casa de su hermana ubicado en la Zona 16 de febrero – Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de materia prima (tela) con que podrá satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene en su mercado.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica favorablemente la aprobación del préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Valentin is a craftsman and makes sun hats, which he sells by the dozen at retail stalls; he also sells inland (Santa Cruz and Cochabamba). This trade is the source of income with which he keeps his young son and mother. Valentin lives at his sister’s house in the 16 de febrero area of Rio Seco, in the city of El Alto.

He will use the loan to buy raw materials (fabric) with which he can meet market demand.

He has been approved by evaluation to receive his first requested loan with Impro.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: RAW MATERIALS (FABRIC)

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela es productora de leche de vaca y pequeña agricultora, cultiva papa y chuño (que es un derivado de la papa); el esposo trabaja como albañil y así complementan sus fuentes de ingreso con que cubren los gastos familiares. Tiene su casa propia en el área rural ubicada en la comunidad Ninachiri Provincia los Andes a una hora y media de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana  calidad, que le ayudara para obtener una mayor producción de leche.
 
Es su tercer crédito con Impro, su buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Marcela is a cow milk producer and small farmer who grows potatoes and produces potato flour (which comes from potatoes); she and her husband, a builder by trade, supplement their income by these means to cover family expenses. She has her own house in the rural area of the Ninachiri Provincia los Andes community, an hour and a half from the city of El Alto.

She will use the loan to buy a medium dairy cow to help her increase milk production.

This is her third loan with Impro, for which she has been approved on account of her good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: MEDIUM DAIRY COW (TO INCREASE MILK PRODUCTION)

loans.name: Anabel Gregoria

texts.es:
Anabel trabaja en una microempresa como auxiliar contable y es estudiante de la Universidad Publica El Alto en la carrera de Contaduría Publica; con el ingreso de su sueldo ayuda a su familia para la alimentación de sus hermanos menores. Vive en la Zona Villa Ingenio  de la Ciudad de El Alto.


Actualmente esta viviendo en la casa de sus padres, pero por la distancia a su fuente de trabajo está buscando un cuarto en anticrético más cerca de su trabajo, lo cual le ayudará a generar un ahorro en tiempo y económicamente.

El crédito solicitado será utilizado para pagar el anticrético de la habitación donde pretende vivir. (Anticrético es una forma legal de contrato por dos años, donde el dueño de casa permite vivir a una persona o familia en una habitación o un departamento completo por una cantidad de dinero que se paga por adelantado, la cual deberá ser devuelta al inquilino al cabo del contrato).
 
Es primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Anabel works at a small company as an accounts assistant, and is studying Public Accountancy at the Universidad Publica El Alto (El Alto Public University). She uses her income to help her family to feed her younger siblings. She lives in the Villa Ingenio area of El Alto city.

She is currently living with her parents but is looking for an "anticrético" room (see below for a definition of "anticrético") nearer her work, as this is some distance from her parents' house, to help her save both time and money.

She will use the requested loan to pay the rent on the room where she hopes to live. ("Anticrético" is a legally binding contract of two years' duration, in which the landlord allows an individual or family to live in a room or whole apartment for a sum of money paid in advance, which will be returned to the tenant at the end of the contract.)

This is the first loan she has requested from Impro, which has been assessed favorably.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: RENT PAYMENT

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Doña Rosa tiene 53 años de edad, casada y con tres hermosos hijos que están estudiando sus edades son 12, 15,20 años de edad, su esposo la apoya en el trabajo como sus dos hijos mayores, después que llegan de clase, su negocio es la elaboración de tazas, platos vasos, y similares de plásticos, inicio hace quince años, con dinero prestado en financieras, hace poco con un incendio que hubo en el mercado que vende tuvo muchas dificultades para recuperar el dinero, ya que los comerciante que resultaron perjudicados  no le pagaron, con este préstamo es la tercera solicitud en Afodenic, lo cual es de gran beneficios para sus interese bajos y por la oportunidad que le brindan, va invertir en infraestructura en el techado del local donde trabaja para mejorar las condiciones laborales ya que esta comenzando de cero otra vez, a largo plazo es poder producir  mucho y obtener los resultados, a si como seguir agrandando el local.
texts.en:
Rosa is 53 years old, married, and has three beautiful children, aged 12, 15, and 20 years old, who attend school. Her husband and two eldest children help her in her work after class. She makes cups, plates glasses, and similar items out of plastic. She started this business 15 years ago with a loan. Recently, there was a fire in the market where many of her clients sell and she has had difficulties recovering her losses as the shopkeepers who were injured have been unable to pay her. Due to these circumstances, she is asking for this, her third loan request to Afodenic as they offer low interest rates and provide opportunities. She will invest the loan in the infrastructure of her workplace, specifically in extending the roof, in order to improve working conditions. As she is starting from nothing once again, in the long term she plans to be able to produce many more items and obtain better results by enlarging her premises.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials and extend the roof

payments.comment: correction due to overpayment for business 77694

loans.name: Miramar Femenina Group

texts.en:
Zunilda J., one of the members of the group, came to Esperanza International with almost nothing, just a desire to work hard as a means of changing her life and the life of her children. Zunilda is the mother of three children: two who are young and one who is 35 years old. She said she had a hard time raising the eldest child because money was scarce and she did not have a steady income. With her two young children, she wants to give them the best possible future and put them both in school.

She opened a salon with her first loan and is now trying to increase the size of the business. This has been the first steady income in her life, and finally she is starting to feel like a proper provider for her children. She has never been so happy! She is excited that her children are in school and preparing for a better future. She dreams of sending those children to college, and would also love to travel someday. She knows that she is going to continue growing and become a real success story!

Zunilda is part of a "Bank of Hope," and in conjuction with the other members of her group she will repay this loan over the coming months.

loans.use: To buy products for the salon

loans.name: Fatima De Jesus

texts.es: La Sra. Fátima tiene 27 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama Sabana Grande en la capital de Managua, tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad, su esposo trabaja en mecánica por  cuenta propia, el negocio de doña Fátima es la venta de fritanga toda la semana por las tardes, empezó hace ocho años, lo mas difícil fue hacer la clientela, la experiencia en la elaboración y servicio al cliente lo aprendió de su mama ya que ella también vendía comida para subsistir con la familia, con la solicitud de crédito va invertir en materia prima, para comprar mas productos para la venta de fritanga y así poder ofertar mas sus ricos platillos a sus clientes, a largo `plazo es poder acondicionar el local donde vende, y poder crecer cada día mas para obtener mejores resultados, uno de sus mas anhelado sueños es poder tener su casa propia ya que actualmente habita donde sus suegros.
texts.en:
Fátima is 27 years old and lives in a neighbourhood called Sabana Grande in the capital of Managua. She has a five-year old son and her husband is self-employed as a mechanic. Fátima sells fried foods weekday evenings. She started her business eight years ago. The most difficult was building a clientele, gaining experience with food preparation and customer service, which she learnt from her Mom since she also sold food to support her family. She will invest the loan in raw materials, to buy more products for frying and thus offer more of her delicious dishes to her clients. Her long-term goal is to install an air conditioner where she sell, and to be able to grow her business every day to get better results. One of her most cherished dreams is to have her own house as she is currently living with her in-laws.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for her fried dishes

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Luchadoras” está actualmente en su 1º ciclo se formó gracias a la invitación de otras emprendedoras que ya están trabajando en sus respectivos grupos.
Estas mujeres poseen una actividad comercial diferente cada una, con lo que logran generar ingresos principalmente para el sustento de sus familias.
Estas mujeres y sus respectivas actividades son:
 Andresa C.	Artesanía
Julia Elena M. M.	Despensa
Agustina L. C.	Vta de ensalada de frutas
F. Patricia B. R.	Vta de cosméticos
Herminia B. R.	Vta de artesanias
Maria Carolina B. R.	Vta de artesania
Veronica Liliana G. B.  	Vta de bijouterie
Luz Marina B. R. 	Vta de artesania
Jorgelina M. P.	Vta de comestibles
Analia Roxana B.	Vta de merceria
Nery R. B.	Vta de Chipas
Gladys Martina P. de Zárate	Vta de comestibles
Rosa Maria P. C.	Vta de ropas
Marciana B. de Ramos	Vta de chipas
Maria Valeria U. de Campos	Fabricación y venta de productos de limpieza

Todas ellas retiran un pequeño monto del préstamo total para poder invertirlo en la compra de mercaderías, materias primas y/o materiales necesarios para sus respectivas actividades por ejemplo: compra de frutas, verduras, azúcar, huevos, aceite, carne y especias para aquellas que se dedican a la elaboración y venta de comestibles, así como también gaseosas, jugos, lácteos y agua mineral. Compra de hojas secas de palmas para elaborar artesanías, barro, compra de químicos para la elaboración de productos de limpieza y de detergentes. Compra de ropas para damas y caballeros, calzados, etc.
texts.en:
The "Women Fighters" committee is in it's 1st cycle and was started thanks to invitations by women who were already participating in other groups. Each of these women has a different business from which she earns an income, this income is mainly for the maintenance of the family.

The group comprises the following women: Andresa C., handicrafts Julia Elena M. M., grocery outlet Agustina L. C., fruit salad sales F. Patricia B. R., cosmetic sales Herminia B.
