Her son works in a cotton factory and her daughters embroider scarves. Razia baji and her husband M. N. make their living by growing crops from seed and then selling the crops at market for a profit. Razia baji is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds to expand their growing crop business.

Razia baji is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Shamim baji would like a loan to buy cosmetics for her cosmetics shop. Sugran baji would like a loan to buy wood for resale. Saghiran baji would like a loan to buy an ox cart for agriculture. Zubaida mai baji would like loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each others loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for the repayment of the entire loan.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her crops

loans.name: Khy

texts.en: Mrs. Khy Y. is a farmer in the Smaung village in Takeo Province. She owns a plot of land she uses to cultivate rice. She earns very little income to provide a high quality of life for her family. In order to improve her living conditions, she has decided to request a loan to buy eight piglets and pig foodto start a pig breeding business. Mrs. Khy Y. is 45 years old widow and the mother of two children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy eight piglets and pig food to start up a pig breeding business

loans.name: Meta

texts.en:
Meta lives in district 4 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is single and lives with her nuclear family. She has been involved in embroidery for more than 5 years. She got her first loan and spend it on embroidery. Now she wants to take her second loan.

She is applying for her second individual loan of 42000 Afghans with a term of 10 months to buy a new machine and to become more effective in her business and help her family better. She wants to say: "With the first loan I was able to continue my business; with the second I am sure that I will improve it even more than with the help of the first loan."

Meta is happy with this loan process. She wants to say: "This loan really helped me a lot and I have plans to continue my partnership with Ariana so as to have a big embroidery business in future to help my family better and make a better income in future."

loans.use: To buy a new embroidery machine

loans.name: Huot

texts.en: Mrs. Huot C. is a 37-year-old widow and lives in the Bakong Kang Koeut village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Huot C. has three children who are attending the local school. She is a chicken seller in the local market. Since the market is far from the house, she usually pays a good deal of money to commute via public transportation. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike so she can deliver her chickens to the market. She hopes to reduce her expenses and provide a better life for her children.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to deliver her chickens to the market.

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Mr. Thorn M. is a villager in the Kampong Chrey village in Takeo Province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land he uses to cultivate rice. 

His wife, Mrs. Mao Touch, owns a small restaurant where she sells rice to the villager and passengers. Even though they have different businesses, they earn too little income to provide a decent life for their household. In order to improve the living conditions, Mr. Thorn M. has decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets to start a pig breeding business. 

He is 55 years old and the father of six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another helps the mother;s business. The others are enrolled in the local school. His wife is also presented with him in the picture.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food to start a pig breeding business.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Mrs. Oun C. is 49 years old and lives in the Sromouch Hei village in Takeo Province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Suong Yuong, is a farmer who owns a piece of land he uses to cultivate rice. On his plantation, he usually pays a good deal of money to hire laborers with two oxen to plow the field. 

In order to reduce this expense, Mrs. Oun C. has decided to ask for a loan to buy two oxen to support the field. She has three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school. Her husband is presented in the picture on the right.

loans.use: To buy two oxen to support the field.

loans.name: Kory

texts.en:
Mr. Kory D. is a villager in the Trapaing Svay village in Takeo Province. He owns a rice mill in the local village. His wife, Mrs. Loeung Horn, is a farmer who owns a piece of land that she uses to cultivate rice. Even though they have different businesses, they still earn too little income to provide a better life for their family. 

Thus, Mr. Kory D. has decided to ask for a loan to purchase a motorbike to start a motorbike taxi business. He is 38 years old and the father of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is attending the local school. The other is too young to work or study. His wife is also presented with him in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to start a motorbike taxi business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a cow to start a cow breeding business.

loans.name: Normie

texts.en:
Normie lives in Barangay Lullutan Ilagan, Isabela, where the Lullutan River is located and where ferry boats are the only way to get to the other side of the river. Their village is small and the people’s primary source of income is rice and corn farming. She is married to a tricycle driver and blessed with three children. They hope that someday, through God’s grace, they will able to send their children to school and finish college.

They own one unit of a passenger tricycle, which provides the financial resources to cope with their growing needs. Her husband operates their passenger tricycle. To help him provide for the family, Normie is planning to open her own community-based village store, but she doesn't have enough money. Moreover, the tricycle needs an overhaul (repair) because it is old and earning less for the family. In order to fulfill her plans, she is asking for a loan of Php5,000.  She will then be able to support her husband. 

Normie and her husband believe in God’s promise that if they would abide in Him, God will give them whatever they ask for. She prays a lot and is very positive that in the coming days they will be able to overcome all challenges that will come their way.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more rice to keep in stock to re-sell later at a better price.

loans.name: Nul

texts.en:
Mr. Nul U. is a farmer in Trea village in Kandal Province. He owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Pen Touch, is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and re-sell later at a better price. In her business, she usually pays a lot of money for motorbike taxi transport. Thus, Mr. Nul U. decided to request a loan to buy a motorbike for his wife’s business as transport to buy rice from the villagers.

He is 29 years old and the father of foU. children, two of whom are attending the local school, while the others are too young to work or study. His wife is also present with him in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his wife’s business as transport to buy rice from the villagers.

loans.name: Saroen

texts.en: Mrs. Saroen R. is 24 years old and she lives in Kok Trorp village in Kandal Province. She is employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Kem Sokkorn, is a construction worker who makes a small income to support the household. Even though they have different businesses, they earn little income and they cannot provide a better life for their family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Saroen R. decided to ask for a loan to buy timbers to build a new house for her family. She has a child who is too young to work or study because that child is two years old. Her husband is present on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy timbers to build a new house for her family.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida R. has a community-based store in Lullutan Ilagan, Isabela. Their village is located beside the Cagayan River, the longest river in the Philippines. She is married and blessed with two children. Although her husband is locally employed, their present income is not sufficient to meet their needs.

The people in their community prefer to buy their basic needs in a the store instead of going to the market, because it is difficult to go to the urban areas. To meet the demands of her customers, she must purchase additional products. which will require additional capital of Php7,000. She believes that the increase in her products will bring her more profit, which will give her the chance to save more for her family's future.

Nida believes in the golden rule: “Do unto others what you would like them do unto you.” Thus, their family lives simply and maintains good relation with their neighbors.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Sanit

texts.en:
Mrs. Sanit H. is 45 years old and she now lives in Pour Duos village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer wH. owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She can gather only a little rice revenue, which cannot support the family well. She now wants to start a duck breeding business so she decided to ask for a loan to buy ducklings, duck food and medicine for her breeding business. She hopes to increase income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

Mrs. Sanit H. has six children, one of whom is a laborer while another owns a small restaurant, and the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband, Mr. Duk Koeun, is an ice cream seller. Her husband is present in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy ducklings, duck food and medicine for her breeding business.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Mrs. Oun S. is a farmer who lives in Andoung Samreth village in Takeo Province. She owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces some problems because her field is infertile and she does not have enough money to hire a laborer with two oxen for plowing the field. In order to resolve this, she decided to request for a loan for these.

Mrs. Oun S. is 40 years old and the mother of two children who are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Heng Makara, is a construction worker. Her husband is present on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to hire a laborer with two oxen for plowing the field.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.en: Bahodur is a 25-year-old young man who dedicates his time to driving a taxi and a microbus.  He currently relies on two vehicles for his public transport business, one of which he drives personally. He rents the microbus.  He has a wife and two children.  Bahodur has about two years of experience in the public transportation field, and the competition is rather high in this business since there are so many people who need it.  His current loan request is so he can maintain his vehicle, since this is the tool of his trade.  So now Bahodur is counting on your help and requesting a loan of 1500 Somoni ($ 450 USD) for the term of 5 months.  With the loan he’ll purchase the spare parts for his microbus.  With your support, Bahodur will continue to progress.

loans.use: To purchase the spare parts to repair his microbus.

loans.name: Nim

texts.en: Mrs. Nim K. is a villager in Trapaing Saum village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Tey Heang, are farmers who have a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. In these cultivations, they can gather only a little revenue and they cannot provide a better life for their family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Nim K. decided to ask for a loan to buy six piglets and pig food to start a pig breeding business. She is 54 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the other is a motorbike repairer. Her husband is present on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy six piglets and pig food to start a pig breeding business.

loans.name: Sa Rorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sa Rorn C. is 38 years old and she now lives in Pour Duos village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Mey Reth, is a construction worker. They both earn little income and they have difficulty in providing better conditions for their household. In order to improve this, Mrs. Sa Rorn C. decided to request a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business.

She has four children, one of whom is a window designer, while another two attend the local school, and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Mrs. Morn E. is a villager in Krodas Kor village in Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband, Mr. Van Voeun, are farmers who own a piece of land to cultivate rice to E. a living. In their plantation, they face a small problem because their field is infertile, which has a bad effect on their crop. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Morn E. decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive.

She is 58 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is a farmer, while another is employed in a garment factory. Another one is a computer teacher and the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is present with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. is a single parent with 4 dependents. She completed her education through junior high school. Grace sells bread that she bakes herself. For the past 12 years, she has also sold crates of eggs in Abura. Grace uses her income to take care of her children's financial needs. Grace will use the loan to purchase flour and other ingredients for baking bread, and also to increase her egg sales. Grace plans to reinvest the new profits into her expanded business, so she can increase her capital base and thus increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for baking bread, and to increase egg sales.

loans.name: Assana

texts.en: Assana A. is married and has 4 dependents. She completed her education through junior high school. Since 2000, Assana has sold groceries in Abura. Her husband is a teacher. Assana uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the family's financial needs. Assana will use the loan to increase her stock of groceries for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Assana plans to save toward building a family house with her husband.

loans.use: Assana will use the loan to increase her stock of groceries for sale.

loans.name: Soliman

texts.en: Soliman lives in district 16 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 29 years old and is married with two children who are enrolled in school. He has got a catering shop through which he earns money and supports his family. He wants to expand his work to have good income,so he has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afs to buy more materials. He is happy with this process which helps all Afghan entrepreneurs.

loans.use: buying more materials for his business

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en: S. Saodat is 39 years old and lives in Khujand. She operates a clothing trade outlet at the local bazar, and boasts a wide variety of clothing. She has built a loyal network of repeat customers. S. Saodat became first joined the local bank in 2007 and has been a model client. She repays her loans on time, and never has problems with loan procedure.  Now mrs. S. Saodat is applying for a KIVA business support loan of 4000 STJ for 3 months to increase volume of imports of seasonal winter wear.

loans.use: importing winter clothing

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia A. is married and has 3 dependents. Since 1997, she has been selling used clothing in Abura. Felicia has completed her education through senior high school.  Her husband is a mechanic. She is responsible for assisting her husband in meeting the family's financial needs. Her loan will be used to buy an increased amount and variety of used clothing to sell. She hopes to reinvest her profits into the business to improve her capital base.

loans.use: To buy an increased amount and variety of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Azamjon

texts.en: B. Azamjon has been a client of MicroInvest since 2008. He is applying for a loan with the intention of improving his livestock business. Mr. B. Azamjon raises his livestock himself and sells livestock for profit. With the money he earns, he has purchased more livestock in the neighboring Kyrgyzstan. He dreams of having a larger flock so he wants to build a big cowshed. Mr. B. Azamjon thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: to build a cowshed to house livestock

loans.name: Saidiat

texts.en: Saidiat is 60 years old and married with 6 children. Saidiat sells flashlights and batteries. She has been in this business for a long time. Saidiat needs the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more flashlights and batteries to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more flashlights and batteries to sell

loans.name: Kafayat

texts.en:
Kafayat sells underwear, bags, and drinks in her shop. Kafayat is 22 years old and married with 2 children. Kafayat lives in Shibiri, Lagos State, Nigeria.

Kafayat needs the loan amount of N30,000 to purchase more underwear and bags to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more underwear and bags to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy D. is unmarried with no children. She completed her education through senior high school. Lucy sells bags of rice and jugs of cooking oil in Abura, which she began just this year. Lucy uses her income to pay her utility bills and other expenses. Lucy will use the loan to buy more bags of rice and jugs of cooking oil to sell.  Lucy plans to reinvest her profits into the business to improve her capital base.

loans.use: To buy more rice and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Amaka

texts.en:
Amaka sells bags that she designs herself. She also sells materials for producing bags. Amaka is 23 years old and married with a child. She is a LAPO client. She is happy because the demand for her bags will increase during this festive season.

Amaka lives in Ajamgbadi, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is requesting the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more materials to make bags to sell.

loans.use: To purchase materials to produce more bags to sell

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina R. is requesting a loan to purchase materials to start a business selling bread. Rina is 28 years old and married. Her husband is a policeman. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to continue to pay to send the children to school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to start a business selling bread.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria sells underwear and sarongs. Maria travels to Togo to purchase underwear and sarongs to sell in Lagos State. Maria is 46 years old and married with 6 children. She is a LAPO client.

Maria needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more underwear and sarongs to sell. She hopes to meet the demands of her customers during and after the festive season. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more underwear and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Tawa

texts.en:
Tawa lives in Ilogbo, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells plastic items such as plates, cups, and coolers. Tawa is 40 years old and married with 5 children. She hopes to expand her business by purchasing more plastic items to sell.

Tawa is a LAPO client. She needs the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more plastic articles to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more plastic articles to sell

loans.name: Dustmatov

texts.en: Dustmatov E. is 45 years old, and lives in the Gafurov region in Tajikistan. He currently works at a building company, which provides the majority of his income while also raising livestock. Dustmatov began his career working with his father at home, caring for the family business. As the livestock business began to progress, he began planning a trade outlet where he could expand his customer base. Dustmatov is currently requesting a loan to purchase a pedigree bull to improve his livestock business.

loans.use: To purchase a pedigree bull

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose Z. sells vegetables and is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetables. Rose is 28 years old and married. Her husband is a policeman. She has three children and they all go to school. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to continue to send her children to school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad Nazir

texts.en: M. Nazir lives in district one of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 50 years old and is married with 7 children. He owns land and cultivates it with a lot of hard work to earn money and cover the daily requirements of his big family. He needs some tools for collecting the harvest, so he wants to take an individual loan of 50000 Afs. He is very glad to have the opportunity to improve his living standard.

loans.use: buying tools to collect the harvest

loans.name: Solidah

texts.en:
Solidah B. sells vegetables and is requesting a loan to purchase more tomatoes. Solidah is 29 years old and married. Her husband is a policeman. She has six children and they all go to school. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Javlonbek

texts.en: Javlonbek A. lives in Istaravshan, Tajikistan where he was born in 1975.  With God's help he has become an excellent supplier of vegetables for his community.  He is responsible for four people (a wife and three children) and earns his family's living with his farming.  He knows all the ins and outs of this business, in which he has 5 years of experience.  His great trump is his production of vegetables in the off-season; however, in order to accomplish this, he needs investment for purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 1500 Somoni ($450 USD) so as to supply enough to meet the demand.  This will allow him to better provide for his family.  Let's help Javlonbek as he works hard to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: To purchase the seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables.

loans.name: Nuriniso

texts.en: S. Nuriniso has been an active client of Microfinance since 2003 and is married and has 4 children. She lives in Khujand and is very engaged in trading in her town. She has been trading for many years near the local bazaar. S. started her business many years ago and has learned many sophisticated business skills over the years. Today she has a trade outlet and a good assortment of products that she brings from Istaravshan. Now S. is applying to KIVA with the request for a business support loan of $450 for 1 months in order to widen her assortment of new seasonal wear.

loans.use: new seasonal wear.

loans.name: Celementine

texts.en:
Celementine L. sells food and is requesting a loan to purchase more stock. Celementine is 29 years old and married. Her husband is a business man. She has four children and they all go to school. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a permanent shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a permanent shop to sell food.

loans.name: Abduzohid

texts.en: Abduzohid B. is 34 years old.  He is married and the father of three children who are all in primary school.  At a young age and because of lack of financial resources, he began to work with land growing different kinds of vegetables, which has allowed him to support his family, but with difficulty.  He took out a first loan of $600 USD to get this business off the ground and managed to reimburse the loan in a timely fashion.  Ambitious and intent on getting out from under the burden of his difficult financial situation, Abduzohid is now requesting a second loan of $300 USD, this time to enlarge his business and purchase seeds and fertilizer for sowing potatoes.  This should allow him to satisfy the needs of his customers and improve socioeconomic conditions for his family and himself.

loans.use: To purchase the seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort D. is married and has 2 children. She completed senior high school. Comfort sells pharmaceuticals at Abandze near Abura, which she has done since 1997. Her husband is a pharmacist. Comfort uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the family's financial needs. Comfort will use the loan to buy more, better-quality products to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to invest in their children's education.

loans.use: To buy more, better-quality products to sell.

loans.name: Muhitdin

texts.en: Farming requires a lot of effort, which is why from a young age Muhitdin D. has dedicated himself to this business and today is seeking a way to expand his efforts in order to support his family, which consists of his wife and two children.  The problem he faces today is the lack of capital financing for the production of vegetables like potatoes. For this reason, he trustfully approached IMON to ask for a loan for farming to continue supporting his humble home and develop his profession economically.

loans.use: To purchase the seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Monikatu

texts.en:
Monikatu owns a restaurant where she sells cooked foods. She prepares the food in large quantities and and good quality. (See picture.) Monikatu has 5 salesgirls that assist her in sales.

Monikatu is 50 years old and married with 7 children. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell. Monikatu is very grateful for the financial assistance rendered to her by Kiva lenders through LAPO Microfinance.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary E. sells goods and is requesting a loan to purchase more stock. Mary is 32 years old and married. Her husband is a businessman. She has six children and they all go to school. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to continue to send the children to school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en: Shavkat G. is 29 years old, married, and the father of three children.  Shavkat resides in Shahristan, Tajikistan.  He cultivates vegetables such as: potatoes, onions and carrots, which he resells after harvesting them.  Since the income generated by his work is always meager, he would like to use this opportunity from Kiva to increase the size of his business in terms of more significant production, allowing for a better return.  The profits derived from his business will enable him to take on part of his household needs. Shavkat and his family sincerely thank you for you support and encouragement.

loans.use: To purchase the seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred O. is married and has 4 dependents. He completed senior high school. Since 2000, Alfred has sold groceries and general merchandise in Abakrampa, near Abura. His wife is a trader. Alfred uses his income to pay for his children's school fees, utility bills, and other expenses. Alfred will use the loan to purchase more travelling bags to sell, since sales of the bags are doing well. He also wants to invest in his groceries. Alfred plans to reinvest his profits into the business to improve his capital base.

loans.use: To purchase more travelling bags to sell.

loans.name: Favor

texts.en:
Favor is happily married with a child. She is 28 years old. Favor sells foodstuffs like rice, beans, and corn. She travels to Edo and Ogun States to purchase foodstuffs to sell in Lagos State.

Favor lives in Igbede, Lagos State, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Juliet Uche

texts.en:
Juliet has a restaurant business where she sells drinks, pepper soup, fried meat, and cooked foods. Juliet has been in this business for a long time. She is 35 years old and married with 3 children.

Juliet needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more drinks, juice, and foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She is indeed grateful to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, juice, and foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en: O. Mavjuda lives in Khujand. She is married and has one child. Mrs. O. Mavjuda has been engaged in the commercial service and trade industry for a long time. She has experience in business and understands how the market works. Now Mrs. O. Mavjuda sells men’s and women’s jackets that she imports from Istaravshan. Mrs. O. Mavjuda is applying for a loan of 1000 STJ for 1 month to import new seasonal goods.

loans.use: new seasonal good importing

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.en: Khurshed H. is 33 years old.  He is married and has four children.  Khurshed has been working in agriculture for 12 years, since he was a young.  Khurshed works hard to cultivate his products such as potatoes, onions, carrots and other vegetables.  He works from early morning till late night hoping to have a rich harvest.  Khurshed sells his vegetables in the market where they are always in high demand due to their good quality. His works fills him with great optimism and allows him to help his beloved children.  His goal is to improve the quality of his agricultural products even more and to grow his business.  For this reason, he has applied to IMON for a loan that will allow him to purchase greater quantities of seeds and fertilizer for sowing more vegetables. Your support will really help him.

loans.use: To purchase the seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi Y. is married and has 2 children. She completed senior high school. Since 2006, Esi has sold pharmaceuticals in Abakrampa, near Abura. Her husband is a pharmacist. Esi uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the family's financial needs. Esi will use the loan to buy more, better-quality products to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to invest in their children's education.

loans.use: To buy more, better-quality products to sell.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: Dilorom O., who grew up in a home where the principal work was and is agriculture, learned how to do this work when she was very young from working with her parents.  This has become her principal source of income, and she dedicates most of her time to the attention and care of her agricultural products.  Through her daily work, she looks to give her family security and economic reliability.  However, due to unexpected difficulties, she cannot cover all of her expenses, and she needs a loan to improve her products and increase her sales with the objective of constructing her house on land that she acquired a little while ago.  All of this can be possible with your help.

loans.use: To purchase the seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing sells palm oil wholesale and retail. She travels to Anambra and Imo State to purchase palm oil to sell in Lagos State. Blessing says that her customers prefer palm oil from Anambra and Imo State because the palm oil from these states tastes good.

Blessing is 38 years old and married with 4 children. She has been in this business for the past 5 years. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more palm oil to sell. She says thank you to Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance for their kind financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Mery

texts.en: Mery O. is married and has 6 dependents. She has received no formal education. Since 1993, Mery has sold beans and gari. Gari is made of cassava. The cassava is milled and the starch is extracted. The milled cassava is then fried to make gari. This business is located in Abakrampa, near Abura. Her husband is a trader. Mery uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the family's financial needs. Mery will use the loan to purchase more bags of beans to sell, and more cassava to make gari. Mery plans to reinvest her new profits into the business to improve her capital base.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of beans, and more cassava to make gari to sell.

loans.name: Rajabmurod

texts.en: Rajabmurod K. is an entrepreneur.  He is married with three children.  Nineteen years ago, he decided to start his own business processing wheat and making flour.  He has his own mill.  He started out of necessity to give him the funds to support his family, especially his children's education.  The business he started with few resources has grown, and now Rajabmurod works with his brothers and elder son.  The desire to move up in the world has motivated Rajabmurod to continue growing his business.  Currently, he needs a loan of 2000 Somoni ($600 USD) to buy supplies and ingredients so he can continue to offer a good product to his customers.  He plans to repay it within 12 months. Your support can help improve the quality of life of Rajabmurod and his family and help him reach his dreams of providing all of his children with their own home. He is grateful for your help.

loans.use: To purchase wheat to process and sell.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas sells clothes and sarongs. Dorcas has been in this business for a long time. She travels to Cotonou to purchase clothes and sarongs to sell in Lagos State. Dorcas has her shop open daily from 7am to 7pm. She and her family live in Benomoja, Lagos State, Nigeria.

Dorcas is 45 years old and married with 6 children. Dorcas needs the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more clothes and sarongs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase trade area

loans.name: Shamsullo

texts.en: Shamsullo S. is 36 years old. He is married and has three children. His mother and father are living with him, and he is responsible for their living expenses. He has a butcher shop and has been running a meat selling business for six years. He provides the markets with meat and his family with the necessary food. Now Shamsullo is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni ($900 USD) and plans to pay off them within 12 months. Due to the profitability of his business, his determination, and his experience in the business, this customer is qualified to receive this loan. Shamsullo is counting on your help. Your support will really help him.

loans.use: To purchase meat to expand his business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth sells drinks, juice, and cooked food in her shop. She has been in this business for the past 8 years. Elizabeth opens her shop by 6am and she closes by 11pm daily.

Elizabeth is 56 years old and married with 4 children. Elizabeth is a LAPO client. She needs the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more drinks and juice to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and juice to sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Since 2006, Comfort M. has sold dried fish in Abakrampa near Abura. Comfort received a primary education. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a trader. Comfort is responsible for assisting her husband in meeting the family's financial needs. Her loan will be used to buy more dried fish for sale. She hopes to reinvest her new profits into the business to improve her capital base.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish for sale.

loans.name: Ijeoma

texts.en: Ijeoma is a fashion designer, and she also sells clothes and tailoring materials. Ijeoma makes lovely Nigerian designs for her customers. Ijeoma is 35 years old and married with a child. Ijeoma lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She hopes to meet the demands of her customers during and after the festive holiday season. She needs the loan to purchase more clothes and tailoring materials to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Ergashali

texts.en:
Ergashali A. is 34 years old and lives with his wife and six children. He is a hard-working person, a fact he demonstrates each and every day as he carries out the arduous tasks of living in the countryside. Ergashali has been a farmer from the start, having inherited his lands – and the occupation – from his parents. With the passing of time, he has also implemented raising livestock into his enterprise. Each day, he takes his cows to graze in the far reaches of his fields.

With these activities, he earns income to support the living expenses of his family. He faces difficult times, however, when livestock prices go down and he is not able to earn enough. Ergashali, however, is learning every day how to run his business for the best end result. The constant motivation for his efforts is his family. He is accustomed to these tasks since he has carried them out as he himself grew up. Ergashali seeks a loan for working capital, specifically so he can buy cattle, especially considering that the prices for them are low now. He feels that this is the only way that will enable him to provide all of his children with a good education. Ergashali deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Uju

texts.en: Uju is a single parent. She is 35 years old and has 2 children that she takes care of by herself. Uju sells secondhand clothes. The demand for her clothing is high. Uju lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. Uju needs the loan to purchase more secondhand clothes to sell to her customers. She is very grateful to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Christy

texts.en: Christy is a widow, and she takes care of her child alone. She is 35 years old. Christy sells drinks, pepper soup and cooked food. Although she has been in this business for just a year, she has lots of customers patronizing her business. She hopes to retain her customers. She needs the loan to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin makes phone calls, sells rechargeable phone cards and sells dried fish. She says makes more profits from the sales of dried fish. The demands for her dried fish during this festive holiday season are high, and she hopes to make more profits from her sales. She needs the loan to purchase more dried fish to sell. Toyin is 36 years old and married with 3 children. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience A. is 41 years old, married, and has four children. Currently all the kids are in school. Patience has been a dealer and seller of timber products like plywood for the past twelve years. Selling plywood has been her major occupation and the main source of livelihood for her family. She owns a timber products shop where customers come to purchase wood.

She requests a loan to purchase additional wood like plywood and others to expand her operation. This she believes will increase her savings and help pay for her children's education costs. She belongs to the community group called “Macedonia” Trust Group. In this group, members serve as guarantees for one another to access and repay loans. Patience does not work on her meeting days.

loans.use: Buy additional wood for building

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en: Since 2000, Agatha O. has sold firewood to fishmongers in Abakrampa near Abura. Agatha received no formal education. She is married and has 9 dependents. Her husband is a trader. She is responsible for assisting her husband in meeting the family's financial needs. Her loan will be used to buy more firewood to sell. She hopes to invest the new profits from her business in their orange plantation.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John K. N. is a 56-year-old trader; he is married and has four children. Two children have completed senior high school. He is a very resourceful husband and father whose hard work brings livelihood to the family. John K. supports his wife and household through the sale of used clothing in Kantamato market in Accra. Selling used clothing is a very big market in Ghana because brand new clothes are very expensive for the economically-active poor. Selling used clothing has created a big market for many men and women. John K. requests a loan to buy more bales of used clothing and shoes to increase his inventory. He believes this loan would help him save for his children’s future education and also to rent a store in which to trade.  John K. is a member of the group called Macedonia. The members agree to serve as guarantees for each other to repay the loans. John K. said he would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: Buy more bales of used clothing and shoes

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice sells notebooks and textbooks. Alice is 44 years old and married with 6 children. Alice is determined to eradicate the poverty situation that has engulfed her family. Alice lives in Ibiye, Lagos state, Nigeria. She needs the loan to purchase more notebooks and textbooks to sell. She says thank you to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more textbooks and notebooks

loans.name: Scolastica

texts.en:
Scolastica J. is a business woman. She runs a shop at Machimbo, Vituka ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells varieties of items including cereals. She purchases some commodities from wholesale shops and others direct from producers and she then sells to customers.

Customer demand is high and Scolastica's business plan is to run a wholesale shop. She needs a loan of TZS 600,000 (US$500) to boost up the business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Uche

texts.en: Uche sells weavons and hair extensions. She is also a hair stylist. She 27 years old and married without children. Uche makes lovely hairstyles for her customers. She is happy because the demands for her weavons and hair extensions will increase during this festive holiday season. Uche is requesting for the loan to purchase more weavons and hair extensions to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more weavons and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana N. is 34 years old, married, and has two children who are currently in school. Diana has been a supplier and distributor of locally manufactured palm oil for two years. Palm oil is produced from palm nuts, while palm-kernel oil is produced from palm kernels, which are a by-product of palm oil. The palm-kernel oil is used to prepare many local dishes. Diana treks to Asamang in the Eastern region of Ghana to purchase the processed oil and then supplies it to food vendors to prepare meals.

She wants to use the loan to buy additional gallons of palm oil from the manufacturers, so she can better supply her customers who demand the product. She believes this will help expand her business and generate more income to support her family and finance her children’s education.

Diana belongs to the community group called “Mount Calvary” Trust Group where her picture was taken. In this group, members serve as guarantees for one another to access loans and to exert peer pressure to repay loans.

loans.use: Buy additional gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Nneka

texts.en: Nneka sells electrical materials such as fuses, switches, bulbs, wires and more. Nneka is 27 years old and married. Nneka lives in the state of Lagos, Nigeria. She needs a loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more electrical materials to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical materials to sell

loans.name: Revocatus

texts.en:
Revocatus N. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur man. He runs a business selling home utensils. He sometimes makes door-to-door sales.

Revocatus has been in the business for two years. The income he generates is used to meet the family daily demands and for business capitalization. His plan is to run a wholesale shop. He requests a loan of TZS 600,000 (US$500) to buy more stocks.

loans.use: To buy more utensils for sale.

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
Celina M. is married and the mother of two children. She is a 42-year-old trader, who has been selling women's slippers, shoes, and dressing bags for the past fifteen years. Celina's working capital was provided by family members and friends, but it is not adequate for her business needs. As a result, she can't purchase high quantity or quality products.

She believes that a loan will provide her with the resources needed to purchase good quality products for her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more women's slippers, shoes, and dressing bags. She belongs to the community group called ‘Mount Calvary Trust Group’. In this group, members serve as guarantees for one another to access loans and exert peer pressure to repay loans.

loans.use: Buy additional stock of ladies accessories

loans.name: Salomey

texts.en:
Salomey M. is 38 years old, married, and has one child who just completed senior high school. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies, and biscuits in the local market.

She wants to use the loan to buy these goods in bulk stock to expand her business. Salomey hopes to make a good income from the expanded business and hopes it will provide her child with a tertiary education. She belongs to the community group called ‘Mount Calvary’ Trust Group. The group members guarantee a loan through a repayment pledge and assist one another to repay loans.

loans.use: Buy bulk supplies of grocery goods

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is a 48-year-old woman, married, and has four kids. Two of the kids are currently in school. Hilda is a resourceful mother. Her daily dream is to work hard, so she can provide her kids with a quality education. She believes a quality education will provide her children with better careers that will help sustain all of them in the future. She owns and operates a grocery shop in one of the busy local markets and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, evaporated milk and palm oil.

With the loan, Mary A. wants to buy these goods in bulk quantity to increase her stock. She hopes this will allow her to save more money to pay for her children's school fees. She is a member of a community group called 'Mount Calvary' Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: Buy grocery goods in bulk stock

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus N. is an ex-soldier from the national army. After retirement, he decided to buy taxi car to provide transport service and he is now three years in the business. He derives income from the business for survival. His plan is to own minibuses from which he can derive enough income.

Titus needs a loan of TZS 600,000 (US$500) to expand the business and for spare parts.

loans.use: To buy some spare parts

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda A. is 37 years old and married with three children. Currently all her kids are in school. The responsibility for her children rests on her shoulders. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, and bottles of minerals. She thinks expanding her business to include other items frequently demanded by her customers presents a big opportunity.

She wants to use the loan to buy additional goods to increase her shop's inventory. She hopes improved sales will allow her to save more for her children’s education. Hilda belongs to the community group called ‘Nyame be ye’ (meaning God will do) Trust Group. In this group, members serve as social collateral to gain access to loans and support one another to repay loans.

loans.use: Buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana N. is a 38-year-old woman and married with four children in school. For the past four years, Juliana N. has been trading in palm oil. She treks to Asamang, a town in the Eastern region of Ghana, to purchase palm oil in bulk from the producers and then resells it to her customers. She says increased prices of rice and fuel have affected her working capital, and she can no longer buy enough quantity.

She hopes the loan will enable her to inject more capital into her business to meet the demands of the market. She wants to use the loan to buy bulk gallons of palm oil to avoid price hikes and frequent trips. She hopes to increase her savings to support her husband in paying the children’s school fees. She is a member of the group called 'Mount Calvary' Trust Group. Members agree to serve as social collateral by guarantying repayment of the loans.

loans.use: Buy bulk gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane M. is a Tanzania small business woman. She runs a kiosk at Vituka Dar es Salaam just a few kilometers from Kariakoo city business center. She sells varieties of items including soft drinks. She manages to meet her family's daily demands from the business income.

Jane requests a loan of TZS 600,000 (USD$500) to increase her stocks to meet the customers' demand.

loans.use: To expand her kiosk inventory.

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en:
Nizami M. is a married 42-year-old man with two children who has raised sheep and sold meat and wool to local people and livestock bazaars for the past eight years. The difficult circumstances and hardships in his life made Nizami recognize from a very young age the value of work, so every morning he arises early to feed his calves and cow with the goal of selling them at the best price in the local market when they have grown. Raising sheep is the main source of income for his family.

Nizami's primary goal is to provide an education for his children. With this purpose in mind, he has applied for a loan of $1200 to buy more sheep in order to expand his business. Let's support this hard-working man and hold our hands out to help him!

loans.use: To purchase 20 sheep.

loans.name: Askinaz

texts.en:
Askinaz S., the mother of six children, fled to the safety of the Bilasuvar Internally Displaced Settlement in 1993 during the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict. Five years later, she began a business raising livestock, and although she started with just one cow, she now has many. Every morning Askinaz arises early to allow her beloved cows to graze among the hills all day in hopes that they will return happy and satisfied.

Assisted by her children and husband, she is highly motivated to continue in this arduous work, as the resulting income allows her and her family to sustain themselves, a source of great satisfaction for Askinaz. She is now requesting a loan that will enable her to purchase more livestock to expand her business. With your support, Askinaz will be able to accomplish her business goals and eventually fund the education of all her children.

loans.use: To purchase four calves.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys O. is a 56-year-old widow. Her husband died after a prolonged sickness. She has three children. One child has completed senior high school, and the rest are still in school.

She has been sewing for three years. She is highly skilled, and her speciality is designing and sewing classy clothing for women. She sews various kinds of styles that give her customers a new look, like kaba and slit, wedding dresses, and funeral clothes.

She wants to use the loan to buy more sewing materials like linen, thread, and thimbles to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to increase her savings to provide her children with a quality education. She is a member of the community group called Omega Group. In this group, members serve as social collateral for one another to access and repay loans.

loans.use: Buy more sewing supplies

loans.name: Tofiq

texts.en:
At 44 years of age, Tofiq A. is married and lives with his wife, daughter and pensioned parents. His principal work is the buying and selling of cattle, a business requiring costly travel as he goes to remote areas where these animals cost less. While the enterprise is very profitable, Tofiq’s lack of capital makes his income insignificant, and living conditions remain difficult in his household.

In order to strengthen his business, Tofiq is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy more cattle to expand his business. This will allow him to effectively meet the needs of his household.

loans.use: To purchase four calves.

loans.name: Solmaz

texts.en:
Solmaz A. is a very hardworking woman and knows that each day she has to give her best effort and all her courage. Married and the mother of two children who she is lovingly dedicated to rearing, she raises and feeds animals with the goal of later selling them. Because it allows her to provide for a considerable amount of the household income, this business affords her a great deal of satisfaction. As a result of the good care she provides her livestock, their numbers have grown significantly.

Because she wants to improve her business and produce more wool and meat in a quantity sufficient for commercial sales, Solmaz is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy 15 sheep and fodder for her animals.

Please support this woman who is determined to change the course of her life with dedication and hard work.

loans.use: To purchase 15 sheep and fodder.

loans.name: Shahmurad

texts.en:
In 1993 Shahmurad H., a hard-working person who makes an effort to give his two beloved children the best, fled to the Bilasuvar Internally Displaced Settlement during the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict. The government then granted him land which he subsequently cultivated and developed and upon which he feeds his animals. He also works as a policeman in the local police department, earning about $150 per month, an amount insufficient to cover family needs.

Through his business, he has been able to educate his children up to the secondary school level. He would now like to extend his animal business and so is requesting a loan of $1200. He plans to increase the number of animals he raises. Shahmurad thanks you very much for your kindness to others.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen K. is an entrepreneur Tanzanian woman. She runs a business selling charcoal and selling traditional clothes, known as batik, to customers. She has been in the business for three years now. She purchases the charcoal bags wholesale direct from producers and transports direct to her store where she sells to customers.

Helen needs a loan of TZS 600,000 (USD$500) to buy more charcoal bags.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Nobar

texts.en:
Nobar I., who lives with her husband and four children, manages the shop she opened three years ago selling home supplies to contribute to her family's income and standard of living. Her husband works as a labourer in their village.

She now sees the potential for a significant business expansion by purchasing additional inventories of kitchen supplies and so is requesting a loan of $1200. The resulting increase in profits will allow her to start saving money for her children's education. Nobar thanks you for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for her store.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is married. She sells clothing at a market located close to Simferopol railway station. Her gross monthly income is 20,000 UAH.

Marina has been in this business for 15 years already. She opened it when the Soviet Union fell apart. Her kiosk is located at a very good spot in the market, where many people come by. It makes her business very sustainable. Marina is a simple, honest, and sensitive person. She likes her business because she provides people who come to their city with good clothing according to the season.

Marina would like to get a loan of 5,000 UAH. This would help her to purchase more inventory and increase her profit. She hopes to make enough money in order to fix up her apartment.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her little kiosk

loans.name: Ulviyya

texts.en:
Ulviyya V. lives in the Bilasuvar Internally Displaced Settlement to which she and her family fled during the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict in 1993. A young and ambitious single woman of 24 caring for her pensioned parents, she operates a business selling wedding dresses. The enterprise is going very well due to the advice that she renders to clients plus the fact that it is the only shop offering such products for many kilometers.

Now Ulviyya would now like to further develop her business and is therefore requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase wedding accessories to offer for sale in her shop. Let’s help this young girl in her small business!

loans.use: To purchase bridal accessories for her store.

loans.name: Javanshir

texts.en:
Javanshir M., a married 40-year-old retailer with two sons and both sets of parents living with him, is working hard to achieve a better lifestyle and rise out of poverty. Since 1996, he has been engaged in the sale of spare car parts, offering the parts for a variety of automobiles from a stall he operates in the local market As a result of the success of his business, Javanshir has gradually improved the living conditions of his family and is doing his best to meet all the needs of his dearest sons.

Javanshir now wishes to increase his stock of inventory in order to increase sales volume and so is requesting a loan of $1200 with which he plans to purchase spare parts for cars including Mercedes, Opel, and Volkswagen. With your help this will be possible. Be an important part of the growth of Javanshir’s business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for cars.

loans.name: Hilary

texts.en:
Hilary T. is a Tanzania small entrepreneur man. He runs a shop at Buza, Makangarawe in Dar es Salaam. He has been in the business for three years. He sells varieties of commodities including cereals, purchasing from the wholesalers and selling in his retail shop.

The customers' demand is higher than his supplies and so Hilary needs a loan of TZS 600,000 (USD$500) to buy more stocks to meet the customers' demand.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for his shop.

loans.name: Suelem

texts.es: Suelem, de 25 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 2 añitos de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos desde hace un año, su esposo, quien es trabajador independiente la apoya mucho en su negocio. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es levantarse muy temprano a preparar todo para luego llevar a vender sus prendas de vestir por los diferentes lugares de su zona, ya que vende de manera ambulante. Le es rentable porque ya cuenta con una clientela selecta y le va muy bien. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y ha sido puntual en sus cuotas anteriores. El dinero solicitado será invertido en la comprar de más ropa, posteriormente poner en su propia casa su tienda, ya que se encuentra en una zona adecuada.
texts.en:
Suelem is 25 years old and lives with her husband and two year old son. She has sold clothes and shoes for a year. Her husband, who is self-employed, supports her in her business. What she likes about her job is getting up very early to prepare everything to sell her articles of clothing in different places in her area as a traveling salesperson. It is profitable for her because she has a select clientele and she is doing very well. This is her second loan with MFP and she has been punctual with her previous payments. The money she is requesting will be invested in buying more clothes and then to put a store in her own house because it is in a good area.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of clothes that she sells

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela es madre soltera, vive junto con sus hijos y las familias de ellos, quienes le hacen compañía y apoyan en todo. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad desde hace 3 años, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es conocer mucha gente y dar un trato amable al momento de vender. Le es rentable porque gracias a este negocio y a su carisma al atender, cuenta con una gran clientela. Lo difícil para ella es no contar con un local adecuado para la venta de sus productos. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP. Su propósito para invertir este dinero es ampliar y construir un kiosco para su negocio, comprar más productos y surtirlo adecuadamente.
texts.en:
Adela is a single mother who lives with her children and their families, who keep her company and support her in everything. She has sold groceries and essential goods for 3 years and what she likes about her job is meeting a lot of people and being friendly while she is selling to them. This business is profitable thanks to her charm in dealing with the clients. The difficult thing for her is not having a suitable place to sell her products. This is her second loan with MFP. The purpose of this loan is to expand and build a kiosk for her business, to buy more products and display them properly.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a kiosk to sell her products.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma I. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur woman. She runs a general shop at Machimbo, Vituka. She sells varieties of items which she purchases from the wholesale shops and from Kariakoo City market in Dar es Salaam. She faces a little business competition due to similar businesses in the area, though customer demand is high.

Fatuma requests a loan of TZS 600,000 (USD$500) to buy more items to meet the business demand.

loans.use: To buy more stocks for her shop.

loans.name: Cinthya

texts.es: Cinthya, de 26 años de edad, es madre de una pequeña de 2 añitos, vive junto a su conviviente, quien siempre le da la mano en sus objetivos. Ella es propietaria de un motocarro, el mismo que es manejado por su pareja, quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace 2 años. Esta actividad es de gran beneficio para sus gastos diarios familiares. Le es rentable, ya que ella es la encargada de administrar las ganancias diarias que recibe. Por la gran proliferación de estos vehículos en la selva, tiene que poner mayor esfuerzo para vencer a la competencia. Es la 4ta vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, demostrando ser puntual con sus créditos anteriores. Cinthya quiere mandar a construir un pequeño garaje para guardar su motocarro, para una mayor seguridad, además mandarlo a reparar para que esté en óptimas  condiciones.
texts.en:
Cinthya is 26 years old and is the mother of a 2 year old little girl. She lives with her partner who always helps her in her objectives. She is the owner of a 3 wheel vehicle, driven by her partner, which they have been using to transport people for the past two years. This activity is of great benefit to their daily household expenses. It is profitable and she is responsible for managing the money they receive daily. Because of the proliferation of this type of business, she has to put in more effort to beat the competition. This is her 4th loan with MFP, and she has shown that she is punctual in making her payments. Cinthya wants to build a small garage for the vehicle for greater security and to perform maintenance on it so that it will be in optimal condition.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a garage to protect her motorcycle.

loans.name: Geiter

texts.es: Geiter tiene 54 años de edad, es padre soltero, vive con sus dos hijos que estudian y lo apoyan mucho. El se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace 6 años, a causa de quedarse sin empleo en una constructora en donde trabajaba. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene contacto directo con sus clientes y sobre todo dar un buen trato y confianza es lo principal, nos menciona. Le es rentable, ya que el mismo es el chofer de su motocarro y las ganancias son sólo para él. Le va muy bien. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. Con la cantidad mencionada quiere mandar a reparar su vehículo para trabajar  sin inconvenientes, además quiere arreglar la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Geiter is 54 years old, a single father, and lives with his two children who are students and support him a great deal. He has dedicated himself to transporting passengers for six years, having been left unemployed by a construction company he worked for. What he likes about his work is that he has direct contact with his customers and, most of all he can provide quality service and confidence which are key to his business he tells us. It is profitable for him, since he himself is the driver of his motorcar and his earnings go directly to him. It has been going very well. This is the second time he requests a loan with MFP. With the quantity mentioned, he would like to send his vehicle for repairs so he can work without inconveniences. Additionally, he would like to make repairs to the infrastructure of his home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make repairs to his motocar.

loans.name: Gina

texts.es: Gina, de 53 años, es madre 9 hijos, viviendo en la actualidad con dos de ellos y su esposo, quien la apoya en todos sus propósitos. Su dedicación a dar una buena atención, es la actividad diaria que tiene la señora Gina, tiene su pequeña bodega en las instalaciones de su casa, el negocio de la venta de abarrotes y bebidas lo viene realizando desde hace un año, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es los intercambios de ideas que tiene con sus clientes y conoce mucha gente. Le es rentable, ya que no tiene competencia, sólo ella vende estos productos de primera necesidad dentro de su zona y le va excelente. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP, ha sido puntual en sus pagos anteriores. Ahora con el dinero solicitado quiere mandar ampliar su negocio y desde luego comprar más productos para implementarlo.
texts.en:
Gina, fifty-three, is the mother of nine children, currently living with two of them and her husband, who supports her in all her endeavors. She has her small grocery store in her house and is always committed to giving good service. She sells groceries and drinks. She started her business a year ago. What she likes about her work is the exchange of ideas that she has with her customers and she knows a lot of people. The business makes profit, and she still has no competition – she is the only one in her area who sells those products of basic necessity. It is going exceptionally well for her. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She has been punctual in making her previous payments. With the money she requests now, she wants to be in charge of expanding her business and of course buy more products to add to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding her business and increasing merchandise

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella J. sells beer and is requesting a loan to buying more stock. Stella is 28 years old and married. Her husband is a government worker. She has three children and they all go to school. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more beer to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.es: Gina de 27 años de edad, tiene un hijo y vive junto a su conviviente quien le apoya en lo posible. Ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y cervezas desde hace ya 2 años atrás, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es atender con amabilidad a sus clientes y sobre todo dar lo necesario a su hijo que es la luz por la cual trabaja cada día, porque desea verlo en un momento dado hecho todo un profesional. Le es muy rentable su negocio porque sus productos a vender son de consumo diario y se encuentra en una buena zona, la cual es muy transitada. Le va muy bien. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP, por lo que ha demostrado ser una persona responsable en sus pagos. Gina quiere mandar a construir un kiosco para vender con mayor comodidad, además de incrementar la cantidad de sus bebidas, motivo por el cual solicita la cantidad mencionada.
texts.en:
Gina is 27-years old and has one son and lives with someone who supports her as much as possible. For the last 2-years, she has dedicated herself to selling sodas and beers. She likes her job as she responds with kindness toward her clients and wants to give her son all that is necessary as he is the light for which she works each day. She desires to see him become a great professional. Her business is very profitable because the products she sells are consumed daily and she’s located in a well trafficked area.

Things are going good. This is the 5th loan with MFP as she has demonstrated herself to be very responsible with her dues. Gina wants to build a kiosk to sell more goods, as well as, to increase her stock of soft drinks and it’s for this reason she asks for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct a kiosk to sell soft drinks

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma Abraham is a Tanzanian business woman who runs a food shop at Kigamboni Island in Dar es Salaam. She sells varieties of items including cereals. She purchases the items from Kariakoo market and other wholesale shops and sells them retail. Customer demand is higher than the supply.

Fatuma needs a loan of TZS 800,000 (USD$650) to buy more stock to meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis tiene 27 años de edad, es padre de una pequeña de 6 meses y vive junto a su conviviente. Él se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace 3 años, a razón de ser propietario de un motocarro. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce mucha gente con quien comparte ideas y sobre todo dar un trato amable a sus clientes. Le es rentable, ya que él mismo se encarga de administrar sus ganancias diarias, aunque últimamente existe mucha competencia, entonces esporádicamente toma trabajos temporales como mozo en restaurantes o vende ropa para obtener ingresos extras. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP. El dinero que solicita ahora es para mandar a reparar su motocarro y también para arreglar algunas imperfecciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Luis is 27-years old and is the father of a 6-month old baby girl. For the last 3-years, he has been transporting passengers around and hopes to own his own motor cab. He likes his job because he gets to meet many people with whom he can share ideas with. Above all he treats his clients with courtesy.

His business is very profitable and he is responsible for managing the daily earnings. Although, lately there has been much competition, and sporadically he has to take on temporary work as a waiter in a restaurant, or sell clothes to earn extra income. This is the 3rd loan with MFP and the funds will be used this time to repair the motor cab and also to take care of some imperfections on his home.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make repairs on his motor cab

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos que la apoyan en todo. Ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos desde hace 8 años, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar adecuadamente a sus pollos y que los mismos estén al gusto del cliente. Le es rentable porque es algo muy productivo, ya que cada 45 días ella empieza a vender sus aves a los compradores de su zona. Lo difícil es no contar con un galpón adecuado, ya que desde siempre los ha criado dentro de su casa. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP. Luz necesita ampliar su galpón, comprar más pollos bebes y lo necesario en alimentos para su respectiva crianza.
texts.en:
Luz is 46-years old and lives with her husband and two children which she supports. For the last 8-years, she has dedicated herself to breeding chickens. She enjoys her job because she adequately cares for her chickens and enjoys assisting her clients. The business is very profitable as she is very productive; every 45 days she starts selling the chickens to buyers in the market.

The hard part is not having and adequate barn as she is rearing the young chicken around her house. This is the second loan with MFP for which Luz needs to expand her barn, buy more breeding chickens and chicks, as well as some much needed chicken feed to properly raise her animals.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her barn and purchase more poultry

loans.name: Las Rositas Group

texts.en: Sandra A. is a perfect example of the effects of micro-credit. Sandra came to Esperanza International with no income and three kids to feed with her husband's tiny income. She came hoping to receive a loan and start her own business. She received a small loan of 5,000 pesos which is approximately 150 USD. She took that loan and started a small business selling used clothing. Due to her hard work, she increased her business and paid back the loan in its entirety. Today she is hoping to receive her fifth loan for 18,000 pesos (or about 530 USD). Sandra is now able to provide for her children and put them through school. She said that she is happy for the first time and feels like she has something of her own and something to wake up for each day. She is excited about the future, and feels like this next loan will just continue to grow her business. She is very grateful for this opportunity and challenge.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 34 años, es madre soltera, vive con sus dos hijos, que son sus ganas de seguir adelante. Se dedica, desde hace 5 años, a la venta de productos de belleza como perfumes, talcos, lápices labiales, etc., ya que es una mujer muy activa y con deseos de superación. Para su labor, le gusta buscar la forma de convencer a sus clientes para vender sus productos, además dar una muy buena atención es lo primordial, nos dice. Le es rentable porque ha ganado una gran gama de clientes, por lo que le va muy bien. Es su 2do préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado quiere comprar una vitrina para exhibir sus productos y para que estén más seguros.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 34 year old single mother. She lives with her two children, who motivate her to keep working. Rosa has been working for five years selling beauty products, such as perfumes, powders, lip pens, etc. She's a very active woman, and wants to get ahead. She tells us that she likes to find ways to convince her clients to sell her products, and pays attention to the fundamentals. Rosa has earned a large group of clients and her business is going well.
