This is her second loan with MFP. Rosa wants to use the money to buy a display case for her products so that they are more secure.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a display case for her products

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose Z. sells beer and is requesting a loan to buying more stock. Rose is 28 years old and married. Her husband is a casual worker. She has three children and they all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to continue to pay their school fees. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more beer to sell.

loans.name: Roy

texts.es: Roy tiene 29 años, vive junto a su conviviente, con quien también trabaja, juntos tienen 2 hijos que están estudiando y son su mayor tesoro. Se dedica a la venta abarrotes, los lleva a vender por los distintos caseríos del río Ucayali, este trabajo lo viene realizando desde hace 2 años, lo que le gusta es que conoce muchos lugares y muchas personas. Le es rentable, ya que cuando lleva estos productos, salen como pan caliente. Lo dificultoso son los viajes, ya que tiene que salir para los caseríos de 3 a 7 días y tiene que dejar a su familia. Ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos, por lo que está en el 3er préstamo con MFP. El dinero solicitado será invertido en la construcción de un kiosco en las afueras de su casa, para así tener su negocio estable y estar al pendiente de su familia.
texts.en:
Roy is 29 years old, has a partner with whom he lives and works, and together they have two children who are studying and who are their greatest treasure. He sells groceries, selling them in various farmhouses along the Ucayali river. He has been doing this work for 2 years, and what he enjoys the most is going to many places and meeting many people. The difficult things are the trips themselves, as he has to leave his family for 3 to 7 days. He has demonstrated being punctual in his payments, as this is the third loan with MFP. The money will be used in the construction of a kiosk on the outside of his home, thereby having a stable business and be attentive to the needs of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a kiosk to establish his business in a steady locale

loans.name: Estella

texts.en:
Estella L. sells vegetables and is requesting a loan to buy charcoal. Estella is 23 years old and married. Her husband works with the Ministry of Education. She has one child, who does not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a television.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding stock of charcoal.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John I. is 31 years old and married with two children. He sells vegetables, such as cabbages, green beans, legumes, watermelon, carrots and cucumbers. 

His wife is a student studying Environmental Health. He travels to Jos to purchase vegetables to sell in Benin City. 

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 140,000 local currency to purchase more vegetables to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
Eveline K. is an entrepreneur woman. She runs a grocery store and sells chips in Mwinyi Road Street in Dar es Salaam city center. The business requires big capital because demand is high due to the store's central location.

Eveline requests a loan of TZS 800,000 (USD$650) to buy more stock to meet the customers' demand.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her store.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah S. is married and has 6 dependents. She completed senior high school. Since 2004, Hannah has sold a local meal known as 'Kenkey', which is made out of corn. It is one of the most commonly eaten foods in the country and it is normally eaten with hot sauce and fried fish. Her husband is a trader. Hannah uses her income to take care of her children's financial needs. Hannah will use the loan to purchase more maize, fresh fish and other ingredients so she can prepare more food for sale. Hannah plans to reinvest her new profits into the business to improve her capital base.

In the picture is a sample of the local 'Fante Kenkey'.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients in order to prepare more food for sale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es comerciante de revistas para colorear y pequeños libros para niños de 3 a 7 años de edad; tiene su puesto en la Ceja de El Alto. Esta actividad es su fuente de ingreso con la que cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos que depende de ella y la mayor de 15 años ayuda con otro puesto de venta en la misma ciudad de El Alto. La familia vive en casa alquilada ubicada en la Zona Loreto de la Misma Ciudad.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra más revistas y libros durante las fiestas de fin de año y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica a María para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Maria sells coloring books and small books for children between 3 and 7 years old at her stall in La Ceja, El Alto. This is the source of income with which she keeps her three dependent sons, the oldest of whom at age 15 helps with another stall, also in El Alto. The family lives in a rented house in the Loreto area of the city.

She will use the loan to buy more coloring and children's books at the end-of-year fair to increase her income.

This is Maria's first loan with Impro, which she has been approved to receive.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of more coloring and children's books for her business

loans.name: Eklas

texts.en:
Eklas J. sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to buy more stock. Eklas is 29 years old and married. Her husband is a soldier. She has four children and they all go to school. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to create a steady source of income. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To increase her stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Since 2006, Georgina K. has sold building materials in Abakrampa, near Abura. Georgina completed senior high school.  She is married and has 3 dependents. Her husband is a trader.  Georgina is responsible for taking care of her children's financial needs. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of cement and other building materials to sell. She hopes to invest her new profits in her children's education.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cement and other building materials to sell.

loans.name: Mihriam

texts.es:
Mihriam es artesana y confecciona busitos y chompitas de lana a maquina para niños de dos a cinco años de edad. Dicha mercadería la comercializa por docenas en las ferias populares de la ciudad de El Alto; los fines de semanas trabaja como empleada de limpieza en un local de eventos sociales. De estas dos actividades  provienen los ingresos económicos para la manutención de sus dos hijos que depende de ella, su domicilio esta ubicada en la Zona 16 de febrero de la Misma Ciudad.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de materia prima (lana) para poder satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene por estas temporadas.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Mihriam.
texts.en:
Mihriam is a craftswoman who produces machine-made woolen jackets and sweaters for children aged between 2 and 5 years. She puts them up for sale by the dozen at the El Alto city fairs; at weekends, she works as a cleaner at a social center. These two jobs provide the income with which she maintains her two dependent children. She lives in the 16 de febrero area of El Alto.

She will use the loan to buy raw materials (wool) in order to meet seasonal demand.

This is Mihriam's first loan with Impro, which she has been approved to receive.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool for business purposes (making children's jackets and sweaters)

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris E. is 46 years old and married with five children. She and her family live in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs and she also grinds pepper and other food. 

She hopes to meet the demands of her customers, so she needs an additional grinding machine. She is requesting a  loan amount of 100,000 to purchase one grinding machine and more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase one grinding machine

loans.name: Firmes Y Bendecidos #1 Group

texts.en: Dienona Y. is one of the hardest working women we have met, not the least reason is she's the proud mother to 12 children! However, having 12 children brings a lot of expenses, and when you are living in extreme poverty it is very difficult to pay all those expenses. Dienona came to Esperanza International in need of help, hoping to receive a loan to help start her own business. With her first loan she started a small school in her area and received enough students to pay back all her loans and also start educating her kids. Since that first loan, she has taken out three other loans and is now seeking her fifth. She has increased the size of her school and can now afford to start saving money while also helping many kids get a quality education. The best part is she is able to teach all her children, and hopefully help them have a better future and get out of their poverty. She is very happy with what she does and wants to keep increasing the size of her school. She dreams of having a giant school teaching thousands of kids and hiring more teachers. She is excited about this next loan and knows it will help her continue reaching her dreams!

loans.use: To purchase materials for her school

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei is married and has two children. He owns a small store and sales Christian books, cards, and souvenirs. His business is unique in the city. There is no other Christian bookstore.

Andrei has been in this business for 3 years. The business has been successful due to growing number of Christians in the city. Andrei believes that this business can also help him to promote Christian values in his city.

Andrei would like to get a loan of 5,000 UAH to go to Kiev Christian book sale and purchase more books. This would help him to increase the variety of books at his store. Andrei has a dream of buying a house for his family. He believes that his business can finally grow large enough to enable him to fulfill his dream.

loans.use: to purchase Christian books in Kiev for re-sale in his town

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace O. sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to buy more products to sell, like sugar and beans. Grace is 31 years old and married. Her husband is retired. She has five children and they all go to school. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct another house that she would rent. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her inventory with products like sugar and beans.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa A. is unmarried and has no children. She has received no formal education.  Since 2006, Adjoa has sold a local meal popularly known as 'Kenkey', which is made out of corn. It is one of the most commonly eaten foods in the country and it is normally eaten with hot sauce and fried fish. Adjoa uses her income to pay her utility bills and other financial expenses. Adjoa will use the loan to purchase more ingredients, so she can prepare more food for sale. Adjoa plans to reinvest her new profits into the business to improve her capital base.

In the picture, she is standing with the leaves she uses to wrap the kenkey.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients in order to prepare more food for sale.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira trabaja como comerciante de comida de lunes a viernes y los fines de semana comercializa partes de movilidades a medio uso (llantas, faroles, guiñadores y retrovisores); tiene un puesto en la zona 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto;  el esposo es chofer asalariado y de estas tres actividades derivan sus ingresos con los que cubren la manutención de sus tres hijos que dependen de ellos. Su domicilio esta ubicada en la Zona Ballivian de la Misma Ciudad.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de mercadería (llantas, faroles y otros) para poder incrementar sus ingresos económicos y continuar con esta actividad.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Elvira.
texts.en:
Elvira sells foodstuffs from Monday to Friday and at weekends sells second-hand vehicle parts (tires, headlamps, indicators and rear-view mirrors); she has a stall in the 16 de julio area of El Alto city. Her husband earns his salary as a chauffeur. These three jobs provide the income with which they keep their three dependent children. She lives in the Ballivian area of El Alto.

She will use the loan to buy merchandise (tires, headlamps and other such items) to increase her income and continue trading.

This is Elvira's first loan with Impro, which she has been approved to receive.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of second-hand vehicle parts, such as tires, headlamps, indicators, etc., for selling purposes

loans.name: Abad

texts.es:
Abad tiene su salón de peluquería ubicado en la Zona 16 de julio de la Ciudad de El Alto, el cual es su fuente de ingresos con los que cubre la manutención de su pequeño hijo  y esposa. Vive en alquiler en una casa en la Zona Ballivian de la misma ciudad.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de una maquina de cortar cabello con que podrá facilitar su trabajo y prestar mejor servicio a sus clientes.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica a Abad para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Abad has a hairdressing salon in the July 16 area of the city of El Alto, which is his source of income for supporting his son and his wife. He rents a house in the Ballivian area in the same city. This loan will be used to buy a machine to cut hair that will facilitate his work and provide better service to his clients. This is his first loan with Impro and his application qualifies him for the loan he seeks.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a machine to cut hair for his beauty salon.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica J. is 55 years old and married with four children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. Her husband works in a hotel. 

She sells foodstuffs in a busy market situated in Benin City. She is requesting a loan amount of 50,000 local currency to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth N. is married and has 2 children. She completed senior high school. Elizabeth sells groceries in Abakrampa, near Abura, which she has done since 2005. Her husband is a trader. Elizabeth uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the family's financial needs. Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell. Elizabeth plans to reinvest her new profits into the business to improve her capital base.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Firmes Y Bendecidos #3 Group

texts.en: Francisca A. is a hardworking mother of seven children. She has to work hard just to feed those seven children, which can be challenging at times because she never learned to read. She came to Esperanza International with no job and no education and needed help. She took out a small loan and started a small business selling bread in her area. She has since grown her business and is hoping to receive her fifth loan! She now sells other types of baked goods and is finally starting to earn a good income. She can afford to feed her children each day and is so excited to have something of her own. It's her business! She wakes up each day with purpose, and for the first time in her life is starting to imagine a better future for herself and her family. She wants to go back to school someday and turn her business into a thriving bakery! She is a hardworking women and knows that she is going to reach her dreams someday.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her bakery

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina S. operates a local restaurant which is popularly known here as a "chop bar", where a variety of local dishes such as "fufu" (made out of cassava and plantain pounded together) and others are served. She also sells jeans and shoes at Abakrampa near Abura.

Regina has received no formal education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a businessman. Regina has been operating this local restaurant and also selling Jeans and shoes since 2004. She is responsible for assisting her husband in meeting the family's financial needs. Her loan will be used to buy more ingredients to increase her food production at her "chop bar" and also increase her inventory of clothing and footwear. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest towards further educating their children and also improving their living conditions.

Regina had closed for the day at the time this picture was taken, so she was asked to stand by some of the things she uses in the food preparation. Those stick leaning against the wall are used for pounding the local food popularly known as 'fufu'

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to increase her food production, etc.

loans.name: Santos Domingo

texts.es: El señor Santos Domingo Hernández tiene la edad de 53 años de edad, habita en el barrio Palestina ubicado en municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa la cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que ella vende frutas y verduras en el oriental, ellos tiene  a su cargo tres hijos, los planes de don Santos es mejorar los cultivo para tener mayor productividad. El tiene veintiocho  años trabajando como agricultor con sus propios esfuerzo y el de su esposa han logrado mantener los cultivos  piña, con la solicitud del préstamo la quiere para invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como abonos y venenos para los cultivos de piña
texts.en:
Mr. Santos Domingo H. is 53 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Palestina located in the municipality of Ticuantepe. He works with his wife to pay the household expenses. She sells fruits and vegetables in the east. Together they care for their 3 children. Mr. Santos plans to improve their crops to have higher productivity. He has been working as a farmer for 28 years and with his own effort he and his wife have maintained a pineapple crop. With the loan he wants to invest in agricultural supplies such as fertilizer and pesticides for the pineapple crops.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer and pesticides for his crops.

loans.name: Carmelon

texts.es: Carmelon tiene 58 años, está separado de su pareja, pero vive con sus cuatro hijos, menores de edad. Se dedica al cultivo de café, lo cual desarrolla desde que era niño, desde siempre le agradó trabajar en la chacra y estar mayor tiempo posible en el campo, le gusta limpiar sus terrenos de cultivo para que pueda producir adecuadamente. La venta de café, desde su juventud, ha sido un negocio rentable, debido a que su zona es reconocida por producir café de muy buena calidad, pero de la misma manera es costoso y trabajoso, por todo el proceso que este conlleva, como el afán de secar los granos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Carmelon desea invertir en la compra de plantas de café y abonos para los terrenos.
texts.en:
Carmelon is 58 years old, separated from his wife, but lives with his four children who are all minors. He grows coffee, a profession he has had since he was a young boy. He has always like working on the ranch and being in the countryside as much time as possible. He likes to prepare his fields so that they can produce adequately. Selling coffee, since his youth, has been a profitable business, as their area is known for producing a high quality coffee. However, it is also expensive and labor intensive, for the processes involved such as efforts involved in drying the beans. This is his first loan with MFP. Carmelon wishes to invest in buy coffee plants and fertilizer for his land.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy coffee plants and fertilizer

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret E. sells fish which she buys from the fishermen. She brings them home for processing and preservation, and then she sends them to the market for sale at Ayisa near Elmina. She also keeps some of the fresh fish in her cold storage for re-sale.

Margaret has received senior high education. She is a single parent and has 2 children. Margaret has been selling fish since 2000. She is responsible for taking care of her children's financial needs. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to saving towards building a family house she has planned and will also reinvest part of it into her business.

loans.use: to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale

loans.name: Massile

texts.fr:
Madame P. Massile est née le 11 juin 1974 à Badou, ville située au centre ouest du Togo. Elle est célibataire et elle n’a pas d’enfant. 
Elle a pour activité la vente des casseroles, plastique et pagnes dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord de Lomé. Elle est une vendeuse ambulante et elle vend aussi ses produits à domicile. Elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 2002.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 20 casseroles et 10 pièces de pagnes. Avec ce nouveau stock elle pourra mieux vendre et réaliser beaucoup de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mrs. Massile P. was born on June 11, 1974 in Badou, a town located in the central west part of Togo. She is single and has no children.

Her business is selling pans, plastic-ware, and "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African cloth) in the neighborhood of Agoè, north of Lomé. She sells her wares from door to door and out of her home. She began this business in 2002.

This first loan that she is requesting will permit her to buy 20 pans and 10 lengths of "pagne". With this new stock, she will be able to make more sales and bring in more profit.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of pans, plastic-ware, and "pagnes"

loans.name: Firmes Y Bendecidos #5 Group

texts.en: Iris A. is a Haitian women living in the Dominican Republic trying to better her life. She has one young child who she loves more than anything in the world. She came to Esperanza International without a job and without a way to provide for the child. She only has a middle school education and wanted to find a way out of poverty. She took out a small loan and received some help to start a small salon in her house. She since then has taken out three other loans and is now seeking her fifth! She has been growing her business steadily ever since her first loan. She said that she feels like she finally has purpose and can improve her situation, and most importantly feels like she can provide for her child. She wants her child to go to school, and hopefully someday go to college and live a great life. She someday hopes to have a big beauty salon from which she can generate a lot of money. She is excited about the future!

loans.use: To buy products for the salon

loans.name: Cleny

texts.es: Cleny tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Tiene una pequeña tienda en la cual se ocupa gran parte del día, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace un año, gracias al esfuerzo que puso en el cultivo de sus tierras pudo abrir una bodeguita, que ahora le ayuda a aumentar los ingresos  dentro de su hogar. A Cleny le agrada  vender sus productos a sus vecinos y ayudar a los pobladores de su comunidad a satisfacer sus necesidades de alimentación. En este negocio lo difícil es conseguir productos de muy buena calidad, pero de  precios módicos, que estén al alcance de todos sus clientes. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Cleny tiene pensado invertir 800 soles en la compra de mercadería para su tiendita y el resto en sus campos de cultivo.
texts.en:
Cleny is 32 years old, lives with her husband the three children. She has a small store which keeps her busy for most of the day. She has worked in her store for a year. Thanks to her efforts growing crops she was able to open a small store that now helps her increase her household income. Cleny enjoys selling products to her neighbors and helping the members of her community meet their basic food needs. In this business it is difficult to get high quality yet reasonably priced products so that they are within reach of her customers. This is her first loan with MFP. Cleny plans to invest 800 soles in purchasing merchandise for her little store and the rest in her farming.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store and invest in her farming

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel tiene 30 años, es soltero y vive con sus padres. Se dedica a la producción de plátanos, actividad que realiza desde hace 5 años,  gracias al apoyo de sus padres, siendo una labor que le agrada realizar, debe seguir de cerca el proceso de maduración, para luego comercializarlos en la ciudad, lo cual es rentable, porque el plátano es una fruta que demandan constantemente y las cosechas son quincenales. Lo difícil es sembrar y limpiar las hectáreas de terrenos para que las plantas produzcan adecuadamente. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Daniel invertirá el dinero en la compra de plantas de plátano.
texts.en:
Daniel is 30 years old, single, and lives with his parents. He has been growing bananas for 5 years, thanks to the support of his parents, this is a job that he enjoys doing. He closely follows the maturation process and then sells the bananas in the city and it is profitable, because banana is a fruit that is in constant demand and the harvests are bimonthly. The difficulty lies in sewing and cleaning the hectares of land so that the plants produce adequately. This is his first loan with MFP. Daniel will invest the money in purchasing banana plants.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy banana plants

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca E. is married and has 1 child. She has received schooling through senior high. Rebecca operates a hair dressing salon at Brofobubaho near Elmina, which she has done since 2006. Her husband is a mechanic.

Rebecca uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the family's financial needs. Rebecca will use the loan as additional capital to buy more hair extensions, artificial wigs, and other hair-dressing materials and creams to improve her services. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rebecca plans to save towards getting a piece of land to build a house for the family.

loans.use: to buy more mesh, artificial wigs, and other hair dressing materials, etc.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 23 años, es soltera y vive con sus padres. Se dedica al cultivo de café, actividad que desarrolla por 5 años, siendo la cosecha lo que más le agrada realizar por los frutos que puede ver de su trabajo. Gracias a que este producto es solicitado en diversos lugares de su país puede  tener la tranquilidad de siempre tener buena venta. Lo difícil es sembrar adecuadamente  sus plantaciones, ya que el trabajo de preparado y abonado es muy cansado. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Elena invertirá el dinero en la compra de abonos y más plantas de café, por lo que calcula le costará un promedio de 1000 soles, monto que supera a lo solicitado.
texts.en:
Elena is 23 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She has been growing coffee for 5 years, and this is the crop that she likes to grow the most as she can see the fruits of her labor. Thankfully this product is in demand in different places in her county so she can be assured of always having good sales. What is difficult is adequately sowing her crops, as preparing the ground and fertilizing is very tiring. This is her first loan with MFP. Elena will invest the money in purchasing fertilizer and more coffee plants, which she calculates will cost 1000 soles, an amount beyond what she is soliciting.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for her plants

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer T. is in the communications business on Liverpool Street in Elmina. Jennifer has received senior high education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a teacher.

Jennifer has been in the communications business since 2004. She is responsible for paying utility bills and other financial expense. Her loan will be used to buy more phone credit cards and phone accessories. She hopes to use the new profits from her business as savings towards building the family house she has planned with her husband.

loans.use: buy more phone credit cards and phone accessories for re-sale

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es: Eulogia tiene 60 años, es viuda, vive con su último hijo de 23 años. Se dedica al cultivo de café y de plátano, actividad que realiza desde joven y le ha ayudado a educar y mantener su hogar, sobre todo desde que enviudo. La siembra de café es lo que más le agrada realizar, debido al cuidado que realiza con sus plantaciones. Además, es rentable, porque es un producto que tiene un mayor valor mayor que los demás, sobre todo por temporadas, siendo lo difícil, tener que abrir y adecuar los pozos donde se siembran las plantas, y abonarlos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Eulogia invertirá el dinero en la compra de abonos y pago de mano de obra para ampliar sus terrenos de cultivo.
texts.en:
Eulogia is a 60-year-old widow who lives with her youngest son who is 23 years old. She works in coffee and plantain cultivation, a practice she has been involved with since her youth. It has helped her raise her family and maintain her home, even more so after she became a widow. Harvesting coffee is what she likes to do most because of the care she gives to her plantations. In addition, it is profitable, because it is a product that has a greater value than others, above all by seasons, as it is difficult to have to drill and prepare the wells where the plants are sowed and fertilize them. This is her first loan with MFP. Eulogia will use the money to buy fertilizer and to pay workers in order to expand the land she cultivates.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and workers who will prepare the land

loans.name: Anacleto

texts.es:
Anacleto es productor de leche de vaca; como artesano confecciona chamarras y es también transportista inter provincial. Las tres actividades generan su  ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de sus cinco hijos y esposa. Vive en la comunidad Villandrani Provincia murillo a una hora y media de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para incrementar a un dinero que tiene y  comprar  una vaca lechera de mediana  calidad, misma que le ayudará para producir mayor volumen de leche, venderla e incrementar sus ingresos.
 
Este es el segundo crédito con Impro y el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Anacleto is a cow’s milk producer, and he designs and makes jackets like an artisan. He is also an inter-provincial carrier of goods. These three activities generate his income with which he covers the maintenance of his five children and wife. He lives in the community Villandrani, of the Province Murillo, an hour and a half of the city El Alto. He will use the loan to increase the amount of money he has and to buy a milk cow of average quality, which will help him produce a greater volume of milk, to sell and increase his income. This is the second loan with Impro, and his good payment behavior will legitimize the approval of the loan he is currently asking for.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He will buy a milk cow to increase his production of milk and increase the size of his business.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: Felicitas tienes 32 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Se dedica al cultivo de café, actividad que desarrolla por más de 10 años, con la cual puede ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de su hogar. De la misma forma, le agrada trabajar en el secado de sus granos de café para luego venderlos a los comerciantes que visitan su zona. Gracias a que este producto es rentable por su gran demanda en la capital y en las diversas ciudades altamente comerciales, Felicitas puede obtener ganancias que le permiten sostener su familia. Lo difícil es ubicar a los mejores postores, ya que  hay campañas en que los precios son muy  variados y es más difícil conseguir un buen precio que costee los gastos de inversión. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Felicita invertirá el dinero en la ampliación de sus terrenos de producción, cuya inversión promedio será de 1000 soles.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a 32-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and their two children. She works growing coffee, a business she has been involved with for more than 10 years, and because of which she has been able to help her husband with their home expenses. In the same way, she likes to work drying coffee beans so she can sell them later to merchants who visit her area. Thanks to this product, which is profitable due to a high demand in the capital and in the various cities that are highly commercial, Felicitas can make a profit that will allow her to provide for her family. The difficult part is locating the best bidders, since there are companies whose prices vary a lot and it is harder to get a good price that finances the investment costs. This is her first loan with MFP. Felicitas will use the money to invest in land for production, and the average investment will be 1000 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand land to grow coffee

loans.name: Feliza

texts.es: Feliza, de 35 años, es casada, tiene cuatro hijos y su esposo con el cual vive desde hace más de 10 años. Se dedica al cultivo de plátanos y frutas diversas por temporada, esta actividad la acompaña también por más de 10 años, y la desarrolla junto a su pareja. Lo que más le agrada es que puede trabajar y cuidar a sus hijos al mismo tiempo, ya que éstos, después de clases, la ayudan en sus terrenos de cultivo. Además, esta actividad le da la posibilidad de tener ingresos económicos altos por temporadas, como por ejemplo, el cultivo de café, aunque es lo más difícil de cultivar por los diversos procesos que necesita. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Feliza tiene proyectado invertir lo solicitado en la compra de plantas de café y de plátano.
texts.en:
Feliza, 35, is married, has four children. She has lived with her husband for more than ten years. She cultivates plantains and a diversity of other fruits seasonally. This activity has also accompanied her for more than ten years, and the development together of her relationship. What pleases her most is that she can work, and at once take care of her children, who already help her in cultivating her fields, after classes. Furthermore, activities such as the cultivation of coffee, although it is more difficult to cultivate because of the diverse processes that it requires, allow her to have high seasonal incomes. This is her first loan with MFP. Feliza projects to invest the loan she is asking for to buy coffee plants and plantain trees.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plantain trees and coffee plants.

loans.name: Firmes Y Bendecidos #6 Group

texts.en: Miguelina S. has a small business selling clothing. She is hoping to receive her third loan and continue growing her business. She came to Esperanza International about a year ago hoping for some help out of her situation. She is a single mother who was living in extreme poverty. Before she started her small business she had no form of income and was barely able to feed her child. She felt alone, as if she had no purpose. Once she started her business selling clothes she was able to provide for her child, and for the first time felt like she had a purpose each morning. She has been growing the business since that first loan and has plans for further expansion. She dreams of being able to send her child to a university someday. She now feels like she is going to reach that dream someday, and is ready to work to get there!

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 50 años, convive con su pareja por más de 20 años, con la cual tiene  tres hijos. Se dedica al cultivo de plátanos y café, actividad que desarrolla más de 30 años, siendo esta labor muy agradable para él, sobre todo en el tiempo de cosecha, debido a la cantidad de producción que resulta de su esfuerzo. Además, esta actividad es rentable, debido a que los comerciantes llegan a su zona demandando grandes cantidades de café  para llevarlos a la capital, siendo complicado buscar un comprador que pague un buen precio que le resulte beneficioso. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Juan esta dispuesto a incrementar su producción y poder llevar sus productos a los mercados de las ciudades cercanas, es así que para aumentar sus hectáreas de terreno requiere de 1000 soles.
texts.en:
Juan is 50 years old, and has lived together with his partner for more than 20 years, with whom he has three children. He cultivates plantains and coffee, an activity that he has developed for more than 30 years, and that is very gratifying for him, above all others in the area of cultivation, due to the quality of production that results from his effort. Furthermore, this activity is profitable due to the fact that many traders come to his region demanding large quantities of coffee to bring to the capital, given that it is complicated to go and look for a buyer that will pay a good price that will prove beneficial. This is his first loan with MFP. Juan is ready to increase his production and to be able to bring his products to the markets of the nearby cities. In order to do so he needs 1000 soles in order to increase the number of hectares of crops that he has.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his agricultural production.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Don Santos tiene 63 años, vive con su esposa y sus hijos. Es agricultor desde hace 50 años, y le sigue agradando trabajar en sus terrenos  donde produce frutos cítricos, plátanos, y ahora está incursionando en el cultivo de  arroz, siendo el proceso de siembra lo que más le agrada realizar dentro de sus diversas actividades. Gracias a que la cosecha de plátanos es quincenal, puede comercializarlos frecuentemente, y esto le favorece, además, que este producto es constantemente demandado por los comerciantes, aunque lo difícil sea trasladar sus productos a los depósitos de fruta donde revenden sus productos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Don Santos está dispuesto a invertir en lo que ahora es su prioridad, el arroz, por ello requiere que su terreno esté debidamente cuidado y abonado.
texts.en:
Don Santos is 63 years old, and lives with his wife and his children. He has been a farmer for 50 years, and he continues to enjoy working in his fields where he produces citric fruit, plantains, and now is exploring the cultivation of rice, the process of seeding being the most gratifying to realize among his other diverse activities. Thanks to the fact that plantain crops are bi-monthly, he can commercialize them frequently. This is favorable, furthermore, because this product is in constant demand by traders, and it is very difficult to transport his products to fruit depots where they resell them. This is his first loan with MFP. Don Santos is ready to invest in what is now his priority, rice, for this requires that his land is properly cared for and fertilized.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To prepare his land for the cultivation of rice.

loans.name: Yuseff

texts.es: Yuseff tiene 30 años, es soltero y vive solo. Se dedica al cultivo de café y de plátanos, actividad que realiza desde hace 10 años, siendo la siembra lo que más le agrada dentro de todas sus actividades agrícolas. La venta de café es algo rentable, por la calidad de producto que se produce en la zona, la cual es de mayor demanda en el mercado, auque lo difícil es sembrarlas y secar los granos de café para luego ser comercializados. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Yuseff tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de abonos para que sus plantaciones puedan producir mayor cantidad y con mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Yuseff is 30 years old, he is single and lives alone. He cultivates coffe and plantains, an activity that he has realized for 10 years, seeding being the the activity that he likes the most among all of his other agricultural actities. The sale of coffee is profitable, because of the quality of product that is produced in the region. It is of the highest demand in the market, although it is difficult to sow coffee plants and dry the beans so that later they can be commercialized. This is his first loan with MFP. Yuseff is thinking of investing the money he is asking for to buy fertilizers so that his plantations will be able to produce greater quantities, of better quality as well.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to increase the size and quality of his crops.

loans.name: Edmy

texts.es:
Edmy se dedica a la comercialización de vajilla ( en ingles “china”) en general y los vende a crédito como también tiene una pequeña tienda de dulces y refrescos en una cancha de wally (deporte parecido al volley ball) que es de su propiedad en su mismo domicilio.
Vive en la zona de Pampahasi de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene dos hijos en edad universitaria que solo se dedican a estudiar y dependen de ella. El crédito será destinado a la compra de mercadería y tener un buen stock para las fiestas de navidad.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, sus ganas de superarse y de trabajar le dan la oportunidad para obtener este crédito.
texts.en:
Edmy sells china in general, which she sells on credit. She also has a small stand of sweets and refreshments on a “wally” court (wally is a sport similar to volley ball) that is on the property on which she also lives. She lives in the zone Pampahasi of the city La Paz. She has two children of college age that strictly dedicate themselves to studying and depend on her. The loan will be used to buy merchandise and to have a good stock for Christmas festivities. This is the first time that she is asking for a loan with Impro. Her desire to better herself and to work legitimize granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy china for her sale during the Christmas season and the New Year.

loans.name: Safizetou

texts.fr:
Madame A. Safizetou est née le 19 novembre 1970 à Sokodé, localité située à 400 km au nord de Lomé. Elle s’est mariée avec un chauffeur et elle est mère de cinq (5) enfants. Depuis 2004, elle exerce le commerce de pagnes, en achetant son stock dans le grand marché de Lomé et vend aux clients à Agoè, un quartier situé au nord de la ville.
Avec le revenu de cette activité, elle aide son mari dans les dépenses de la famille.
Actuellement son stock est épuisé et elle désire s’approvisionner. A cet effet elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 9 pièces de pagnes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Safizetou A. was born on November 19, 1970 in Sokodé, which is located 400 km north of Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is married to a chauffeur and is the mother of 5 children. Since 2004 she has been selling "pagnes" (brightly colored African cloth, sold in lengths) buying her inventory in the big open-air market of Lomé and selling to customers in Agoè, a neighborhood situated north of the city.

With the income from her business, she helps her husband cover family expenses. Presently, her inventory is sold out and she would like to replenish it. For this reason, she is asking for her first loan to buy 9 lengths of "pagne".

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes" for re-sale

loans.name: Firmes Y Bendecidos # 4 Group

texts.en: Sosiana M. is married with five children who was living in extreme poverty until she started a small business a while ago that has been growing since. When she came to Esperanza International she was living only off her husband's salary which was not much. She and her husband could barely feed such a large family, and she said she felt like she was not helping. She took out a small loan and started a business selling flowers and now wants to take out her sixth loan! She has always paid each of her loan payments on time, and has slowly grown her business with each loan. She now earns enough money to take care of her children and have them all in school. She also feels useful to her husband and knows that she has a purpose each day. She is so happy with the way her business is going and loves having something of her own. She and her husband are living more comfortably and finally can save some money to send their children to college. They pray that someday their children will have a good, comfortable life. Sosiana is ready for this next loan, and very excited about the next stage of her business and her life!

loans.use: To purchase flowers for resale

loans.name: Ima Sumac Suncco Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal "IMA SUMAC SUNCCO", se fundo en noviembre del 2008, esta conformada por 16 socias, D. los cuales 14 son mujeres y 2 varones, suncco en el idioma quechua significa corazon, la comunidad se encuentra en la zona rural del distrito D. Cusco a 30 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco.
Las socias son mujeres campesinas que se dedican al comercio D. productos agropecuarios, que consta en el acopio D. productos (maiz, papa, habas)y animales menores (cuyes, gallinas, cerdos). los mismos que son vendidos en los mercados urbanos del distrito D. San Jeronimo y la ciudad del Cusco, obteniendo margenes D. ganancia que les permita devolver el credito.
las socias del banco comunal, les permite incrmentar el capital D. trabajo para poder acopiar mayor cantidad D. productos y poder obtener mayores margenes D. ganancia.
Las socias obtienen por primera vez un credito a traves D. la Unidad D. Microfinanzas Arariwa, lo que significa un hecho importante, el acceso a servicios financieros. la Unidad D. Microfinanzas les da la posibilidad D.  ser bancables y poder acceder a fuentes alternativas D. financiemiento.
texts.en:
"IMA SUMAC SUNCCO" Communal Bank was founded in November of 2008. It is maD. up of 16 members, 14 of whom are women and 2 are men. Sunnco means "heart" in Quechua. The community is located in the rural zone of the Cusco district and is 30 minutes away from the city of Cusco. The members are countrywomen who work in the business of agricultural product, which consists of stocking up products (corn, potatoes, beans) and smaller animals (guinea pigs, chickens, pigs). These are sold in urban markets in the San Jeronimo district and in the city of Cusco, and they obtain profit margins that enable them to repay the loan.. The members of the communal bank are permitted to increase work capital in order to gather together a larger number of products and be able to get higher profit margins. The members The members are getting credit for the first time through the Arariwa microfinance bank, which indicates an important act--access to financial services. The microfinance bank gives them the possibility to be take out loans and to be able to access alternate financing sources.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on agricultural products and small animals, which will be sold in the main markets to obtain profit margins of 10% on average.

loans.name: Adjoui K.

texts.fr:
Madame A. Adjoui K. est née le 28 mars 1955 à Atakpame, et elle est nommée comme sa ville de naissance. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants qui sont tous scolarisés, et son mari est un employé de banque. Elle a pour activité, la vente de pagnes, mèches et produits de beauté dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord de la ville de Lomé. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2005.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de d’acheter 73 pièces de pagne.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adjoui K. A. was born on March 28, 1955 in Atakpame, she is named after the town she was born in. She is married and the mother of four (04) children all attending school. Her husband is a bank employee. Her business is the sale of pagnes (traditional wrap around fabric), hair extensions and beauty products in the neighborhood of Agoè north of the town of Lomé. She started this activity in 2005. This first loan would allow her to purchase 73 pieces of pagnes.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pagnes

loans.name: Erede

texts.en: Erede U. is 53 years old and married with 8 children. She is an LAPO client. She sells food spices like ginger, pepper, onions, etc. The demand for her food spices is high. She is requesting the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more food spices to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food spices to sell

loans.name: Komla Delali

texts.fr:
Né en 1964 à Badou dans la préfecture de Wawa au centre du Togo, monsieur NOMAYO Komla Delali s’est marié avec une revendeuse et il est père de cinq (5) enfants. Il y a dix ans qu’il a crée une quincaillerie dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé.  Avec beaucoup d’expérience, il est bien expérimente et connaît bien ce commerce.
Il n’a jamais bénéficié du crédit au près de WAGES, et ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 30 tuiles, 10 tuyaux, 12 scies, et 4 boites de peintures.
texts.en:
Born in 1964 in Badou in the prefecture of Wawa in the center of Togo, Mr. Koma Delali Nomayo is married to a merchant and is the father of 5 children. 10 years ago, he opened a little hardware store in the Agoè neighborhood in Lomé. With lots of experience, he is quite knowledgeable in his business.

He has never before received a loan from WAGES, and this first loan that he is requesting will permit him to buy 30 tiles, 10 hoses, 12 saws, and 4 boxes of paint.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of hardware items for re-sale

loans.name: Pat

texts.en: Pat O. is 37 years old and married with 5 children. She sells provisions and her husband is a commercial driver. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell and to add cloth business

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline E. is 40 years old and married with 7 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks and her husband is a commercial driver. She is requesting this loan to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Lucky

texts.en: Lucky E. is a motorcycle mechanic. He also sells motorcycle spare parts to his customers. He wishes to pull his family out of poverty. He is requesting this loan to purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Firmes Y Bendecidos #2 Group

texts.en: Cecilla L. is a Esperanza International borrower who is hoping to receive her seventh loan. She has a small business selling her artwork, being a very talented painter. She has two young children and lives in an extremely poor area in Seybo, Dominican Republic. Before she began this business selling her artwork, Cecilla had a really hard time providing for her children. She did not have a steady income and her family were living day to day. Since Cecilla took out her first loan she has been growing her business, and now she can finally provide the basic comforts for her family. She wants to continue growing her business and dreams of having both her children attend a university and better their lives. She is loving what she does and is happy that she can call her business her own. She is excited about her next loan, and can't wait to see what the future holds for her and her family!

loans.use: To buy materials for painting

loans.name: Alex

texts.es: Alex tiene 25 años, vive solo en un cuarto que alquiló. Se dedica a la venta de artefactos de segundo uso, hace ya10 años, para solventar los gastos que implica vivir solo, el aún no ha conformado una familia, ya que primero quiere forjarse un futuro y disponer de una buena estabilidad económica para poder brindarle a su familia un buen porvenir. Alex siempre ha trabajado desde muy joven, y además de trabajar con al venta de artefactos también le dedica tiempo a un equipo de fútbol con el cual adquiere algunos ingresos. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Alex is 25 years old, and he lives alone in a room that he rented. He has been involved in the business of selling second-hand goods for 10 years now in order to offset the expenses that come with living alone. He still has not started a family, since he wants to forge a future first and have good economic stability in order to give his family a good future. Alex has always worked ever since he was very young, and besides his work with selling goods, he devotes his time to a football team, which supplements his income. This is his first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. With the money requested, he will buy a greater amount of merchandise in order to increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the amount of merchandise he sells

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Carlos R., se dedica desde hace 6 años, al rubro del Servicio de Alquiler de camión para distintos usos, entre ellos: para traslados de muebles, traslado de mercadería, traslado de materiales de construcción, etc. Nació en la ciudad de Tarija, Bolivia y vive desde hace 10 años en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, Bolivia, vive en el Barrio Las Misiones, junto a su esposa y sus hijos, en una pequeña casa propia. Este crédito será destinado para la reparacion del motor del camión, y para el mantenimiento en general.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Carlos R. has been working for 6 years in the business of renting trucks for various uses, such as moving furniture, merchandise, construction materials, etc. He was born in the city of Tarija, Bolivia, and has lived with his wife and children in a small house of their own for 10 years in the city of Santa Cruz, Bolivia, in the Las Misiones neighborhood. This loan will be put toward repairing the truck motor and for maintenance in general.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the truck

loans.name: Esther Lourdes

texts.es: La Sra. Esther Lourdes F. Z.  trabaja desde hace 2 años en el rubro de la venta de abarrotes en una tienda general, nació en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, Bolivia, el año 1982 y actualmente  vive en el Barrio San Jorge de la zona Los Pocitos, en su propio domicilio. Nesecitaba un credito para su incremento de capital de trabajo y se entero de EMPRENDER por referencias de una socia de un banco de emprendimiento, es de esa manera que solicitó el crédito. Actualmente no cuenta con deudas en ninguna otra institucion financiera.  Esther, con los ingresos que percibe de su negocio cubre los gastos de su pequeño hijo, es madre soltera y paralelamente estudia en la universidad, es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Mrs. Esther Lourdes F. Z. has worked for 2 years in the business of selling groceries in a general store. She was born in the city of Santa Cruz, Bolivia, in 1982 and currently lives in a house of her own in the San Jorge neighborhood in the Los Pocitos area. She needs a loan to increase her work capital and she found out about EMPRENDER through a member of an entrepreneurship bank and requested a loan through them. Currently, she has no debts with any other financial institution. Esther will cover the expenses of caring for her young child with the income that she receives from her business. She is a single mother and is studying at the unviersity. She is a very responsible and hard-working woman. .

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es: Candelaria tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo José Luis D. 43 años, el cual es chofer, y sus hijos Jeaneth D. 19, Mariela D. 16 y Karen D. 7 años. Los esposos José Luis y Candelaria son un verdadero equipo, mientras Candelaria cocina los alimentos que ofrecerán, José Luis atienD. a los comensales, haciendo que su pequeño negocio resulte muy atractivo al público, quien ya prefiere la sazón D. Candelaria. El negocio va muy bien y creciendo en clientela, a ellos siempre les ha gustado la cocina y piensan que en este rubro, en el cual ya están 7 años, será su ventana para lograr el éxito. Candelaria se encuentra en el segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero comprará sillas, algunas mesas y accesorios para mejorar su negocio, además D. ingredientes para preparar sus ricos platos.
texts.en:
Candelaria is 41 years old. She lives with her husband, José Luis, who is 43 and a driver, and her children Jeaneth 19, Mariela 16 and Karen 7 years old. José Luis and Candelaria are a real team. While Candelaria makes the meals that they offer, José Luis attends to the diners, making their small business very attractive to the public who prefer Candelaria´s cooking. The business is going well and growing in clientele. They have always like cooking and think that this line of work, which they have been in for 7 years, will be their window to success. Candelaria is now in her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With this money she will buy chairs, some tables and accesories to improve the business as well as ingredients to prepare her delicious meals.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy some furniture and ingredients to prepare meals.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: Cesar tiene 56 años, es natural de la ciudad de Lima, convive con su pareja Celestina en una casa que alquilan. El se dedica a la atención de su locutorio (centro de llamadas), el cual puso con gran esfuerzo, migrando de la capital D. país hasta la ciudad de Puno, donde reside en la actualidad, atraído por la calma y tranquilidad que se vive en esta zona D. país. Lo que le gusta a Cesar es que puede realizar su trabajo desde su casa, lo cual le permite compartir con su esposa y vivir tranquilamente. Los clientes son asiduos al locutorio de Cesar, teniendo buena cantidad de clientela, gracias a la alegría y buena atención que les presta, es por eso que quiere expandir el negocio. Cesar se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado implementará una nueva cabina en su locutorio, para así abastecer a los asiduos clientes que concurren a su negocio.
texts.en:
Cesar is 56 years old and a native of Lima. He lives with his partner Celestina in a house which they rent. He attends to a call center which with great effort he started up after moving from the country´s capital to the city of Puno where he currently lives. He was attracted to Puno for its calm and tranquil atmosphere. What Cesar likes is that he can work from home, which allows him to share with his wife and live peacefully. His clients are regulars at Cesar´s call center and he has a good number of customers thanks to the friendly and good attention he gives. For this reason he would like to grow the business. Cesar is in his first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money he requests he will install a new phone booth in his call center so that he can take care of the clients that come to his business.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a new phone booth in his call center

loans.name: Demetria

texts.es: Demetria tiene 44 años, vive sola en la casa que le dejaron sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de productos andinos como quinua, cañihua, cebada, etc., en uno de los mercados más conocidos de la ciudad de Juliaca. Demetria ha venido trabajando en este negocio desde hace 22 años, al no tener pareja ni hijos, se dedica netamente a su trabajo para cubrir ese espacio vacío, pero ella ha sabido lidiar con eso y se siente muy optimista en realizar todas sus metas, ya que el negocio va muy bien las ventas son buenas y espera hacerlo crecer aún mas, sabiendo que los productos que ofrece son naturales y le hacen muy bien a las personas que los consumen. Demetria se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de productos para comercializarlos y así lograr mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Demetria is 44 years old and lives alone in the house which her parents left to her. She sells products from the Andean region -such as quinoa, cañihua (a high-protein grain similar to quinoa) and barley- in one of the best known markets in the city of Juliaca. Demetria has worked in this line of business for the past 22 years. Since she has no husband or children, she is completely dedicated to her work to fill this void. However, she has learned how to deal with this and feels very optimistic about reaching all her goals. The business is going well, sales are good and she hopes to be able to grow even more as her products are natural and very good for those who consume them. Demetria is currently in her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and has been very punctual with her payments. With the money she requests she will buy greater quantities of the products she sells so as to achieve greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of products she sells

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: El Sr. Ramiro I. trabaja desde hace 5 años en el rubro llantero, dedicandosé al inflado parchado y colocado de llantas pinchadas y desinfladas, trabajo que realiza laboriosamente desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, hasta altas horas de la noche, atendiendo principalmente a transportistas públicos, debido a que su negocio se encuentra en la ruta de varias líneas de buses. Vive junto a su esposa en una humilde casa ubicada en uno de los barrios más pobres de la ciudad, y aunque su hogar es muy pequeño y humilde, procura de llevar siempre el día a día con una gran sonrisa. En esta ocasión solicita el crédito, para la compra de un compresor de aire, que le servirá para trabajar con mayor facilidad.
texts.en:
Ramiro I. has worked in the tire business for the past 5 years; he repairs and patches punctured or deflated tires. He works hard at this starting early in the morning until late at night, mostly attending customers in public transportation since his business is located along one of the routes used by several bus companies. He lives with his wife in a humble house located in one of the poorer neighborhoods in the city. Although is home is small and humble, he tries to approach every day with a smile. He is requesting a loan to buy an air compressor, which will allow him to work more easily.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy an air compressor

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: Dolores tiene 30 años, es madre soltera de una pequeña llamada Ciely. Se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles en su pequeña tienda ubicada en el distrito de Cabana, donde trabaja usualmente desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Ella realiza este trabajo desde hace 6 años, en los cuales ha aprendido mucho de la venta, siendo ella más alegre a la hora de atender a la clientela y sus dones naturales para la venta hacen que su trabajo le resulte muy agradable. Dolores ha pasado muchos problemas a causa del papá de su hija, volcándose en trabajar muy duro para brindarle un futuro mejor. Se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de productos para aumentar la venta en su tienda y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hija.
texts.en:
Dolores is 30 years old and a single mother to a little girl named Ciely. She sells groceries in a small store located in the district of Cabana, usually working from 6 in the morning until 10 at night. She has been doing this work for the past 6 years, during which time she has learned a lot about selling. Because she is cheerful when attending to her customers and because of her gift for selling, the work is very agreeable. Dolores has had a lot of problems because of her daughter´s father and turned to working hard in order to provide her with a better future. She is currently in her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she requests she will buy a greater quantity of products so she can increase sales at her store, and in this way be able to improve her standard of living and that of her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise in her store

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora tiene 47 años, es casada, vive con su esposo Victoriano de 49 años, quien es obrero. Desde hace 30 años se dedica a comprar y vender ganado, fiel al negocio familiar, ya que sus padres también se dedicaban a lo mismo, con el pasar de los años también decidió incursionar en este negocio para ganarse la vida. El negocio es muy rentable, pero el tener que viajar trasladando el ganado se le hace muy cansado y dificultoso, pero no la detiene, ya que ella sabe que gracias a él puede pensar en un futuro mejor. Dora se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de ganado.
texts.en:
Dora is 47; is married; and lives with her husband, Victoriano, who is 49 and a worker. For 30 years, she has bought and sold livestock, staying loyal to the family business, since her parents also did this work. As years passed, she also decided to do this work to earn a living. Her business is very profitable, but traveling to transport the livestock is very tiring and problematic. This doesn't stop her, though, because she knows that thanks to this work, she can think about a better future. This is Dora's first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she is requesting, she will purchase a larger quantity of livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of livestock she has

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin tiene 20 años, vive en casa de su familia. Es un joven muy maduro para su edad, se toma muy en serio su trabajo y sabe que si en un futuro quiere progresar tiene que trabajar mucho ahora en su juventud, el viaja constantemente a la Mina la Rinconada llevando ropa para vender. El negocio le resulta muy favorable, pero el tener que viajar constantemente a la mina y trabajar con el intenso frío que caracteriza a la zona se le hace un poco dificultoso, pero a Edwin estas cosas le resultan mínimas, quiere seguir trabajando en busca de un mejor porvenir. Edwin se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de ropa para llevar a la Mina y así lograr mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Edwin is 20 years old and lives in his family’s home. He is very mature for his age and takes his work very seriously. He knows that if he is to make progress in the future, he must work hard now while he is young, so he travels frequently to Mina la Rinconada, bringing clothing to sell. The business is going well, but he has to travel often to the town and working in the intense cold which is the norm for the area is difficult. Despite this, Edwin doesn’t think this problem is a very big deal, and he wants to keep working toward a better future. This is Edwin’s first loan with Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. With this loan he will buy more clothing to bring to Mina la Rinconada, and thus make more income.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Loma Linda Group

texts.es:
El Banco de Emprendimiento Loma Linda, está integrado por socias que viven en el barrio Loma Linda de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, Bolivia. Actualmente esta en su 3 er cilco de crédito y está compuesto por 15 personas, Se fundo el 05 de Diciembre del 2007, a iniciativa de un grupo de señoras,como presidenta tenemos a la señora Lidia M. R., la tesorera es la Sr Angelica L. Mejia y la Secretaria es la Sra. Adriana Apiransay S.; en el grupo hay señoras que se dedican a la venta de Cosmeticos, Comida, Abarrote, Panaderia, y la mayoría tiene su tienda general. Las reuniones se llevan acabo los dias viernes a horas 15:00 PM en la Agencia Sur de Emprender. Las señoras estan conformes de trabajar con Emprender por que aprendieron a ahorrar y a compartir con sus amigas cada 14 dias. El grupo en sus inicios Se conformo con con 12 personas de las cuales 2 se retiraron por motivos personales e ingresaron otras 5 nuevas y el grupo hasta la fecha ha sido muy cumplido.

La Sra Lidia M. R. es la Presidenta del grupo, se dedica a la elaboracion de pan casero, lleva 3 años con esa actividad; le dedica 8 horas al dia a su trabajo, tiene 3 hijos pequeños que todavia estan en la escuela. La Sra es muy responsable y cumplida en el grupo, ella es unas de las fundadoras y lider del grupo.

La Sra Angelica L. Mejia es la Tesorera del B.E. Tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio y vende Ropa, tiene 4 años de antiguedad en este rubro, trabaja 6 dias a la semana y 8 horas al dia ,su trabajo es realizado en su domicilio. La Sra es muy responsable y cumplida en el grupo. Tiene domicilio propio y vive hace 4 años en la zona, tiene 3 hijas que ya estan en la universidad y con los ingresos que percibe ayuda en sustento del hogar.

La Sta. Adriana A. es la Secretaria, tiene una pequeña tienda en su domicilio y tambien se dedica a la elaboracion de pan casero su trabajo es mayormente en su domicilio, vive en alquiler y tambien se dedica a estudiar en la universidad.
texts.en:
The Banco de Emprendimiento Loma Linda (“Loma Linda Undertakings Bank”) consists of members who live in the Loma Linda neighborhood of the city of Santa Cruz, Bolivia. They are currently in their third loan cycle and have 15 members. The bank was founded on December 5, 2007 by a group of women which included the president, Mrs. Lidia M. R., the treasurer Mrs. Angelica L. Mejia, and the secretary Ms. Adriana A. S.. The women in the group work selling cosmetics, food, groceries and bread, and most of them have general stores. They meet on Fridays at 3:00pm at the Emprender South Agency. The women are happy to work with Emprender because they have learned to save money and are able to get together with their friends every two weeks. When the group was started, there were 12 people. Two of the members left for personal reasons, and then 5 more members joined, and the group until now has been fulfilled.

Mrs. Lidia M. R. is the president of the group, and works making homemade bread. She has done this work for three years and works 8 hours a day. She has 3 children who are all still in school. She is a very responsible woman and is fulfilled in the group, and she is one of the founders and the leader of the group.

Mrs. Angelica L. Mejia is the treasurer of the Banco de Emprendimiento. She has a grocery store in her home and sells clothing. She has 4 years of experience in this trade and works 6 days a week and 8 hours a day from her home. She is also very responsible and fulfilled in the group. She has her own home and has lived in the neighborhood for 4 years. She has three children who are studying at the university and the income she receives helps maintain her household.

Ms. Adriana A. is the secretary and has a small store in her home. She makes homemade bread and for the most part works from home. She rents her home and also studies at the university.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es: La señora Petronila tiene la edad de 59 años de edad,  habita en el barrio Buenos Aires ubicado  en el municipio de Ticuantepe, juntos a sus hijos ya que ella es viuda  y la única ayuda es su negocio y sus hijos que le aportan para los gastos del hogar. Esta señora le a costado mucho mantener su pulpería ya que la mayor dificultad es la falta de financiamiento, desde hace ocho años tiene su negocio y no ha podido aumentar su inventario, con el interés de progresar ha tomado la decisión que solo con prestamos puede invertir en su negocio, y esta es su primer solicitud en Afodenic y espera que sea de gran beneficios para aumentar su negocio y brindarle un servicio mejor a sus clientes
texts.en:
Petronila is 59 years old and lives in the Buenos Aires neighborhood, located in the county of Ticuantepe. She lives with her children as she is a widow and the only help she gets is from her business and her children who assist her with the household expenses. It has been difficult for her to maintain her convenience store because of the lack of financing. Ever since she started the business 8 years ago, she has not been able to increase her inventory. With the goal of making progress, she decided that the only way to invest in her business would be to take out a loan. This is the first loan she has requested from Kiva partner Afodenic, and she hopes that it will be a great help so she can expand her business and give her customers better customer service.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products for her convenience store

loans.name: Hannz Eliazer

texts.es: El señor Hannz Eliazer Bellanger, tiene la edad  25 años  de edad, habita en el kilómetro cinco y medio carretera a Masaya, junto a su esposa y hijos, la señora trabaja para poder aportar con los gastos de la casa; ya que ellos tiene  a su cargo dos pequeños unos de los niños estudia su tercer grado y el otro pequeñito tiene dos años. El señor Hannz tiene su propio negocio ya que el se dedica al destace de cerdo y a la crianza del mismo animal. La mayor dificulta que tiene es la falta de financiamiento. Los sueños de don Hannz es llegar a darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia ya que ellos no pasan mucho tiempo con sus pequeños, para poder salir adelante. Con esta solicitud va a comprar mas cerdos para ampliar la venta de ellos mismos y así obtener mejores ganancias
texts.en:
Mr. Hannz Eliazer Bellanger is 25 years old and lives at kilometer 5.5 on the Masaya highway along with his wife and children. His wife works to contribute to the household expenses, as they have two children, one in third grade and the other who is 2 years old. Hannz has his own business raising and cutting up pigs. The greatest difficulty he has is finding financing. Hannz dreams of getting ahead and giving his family a better standard of living, as he and his wife aren’t able to spend much time with their children. He will buy more pigs with this loan to later sell them, and earn more money.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more pigs to expand his business

loans.name: Senovia Antonia

texts.es: La señora Senovia R. tiene la edad  de 36 años,  habita en el barrio Medardo Andino ubicado en municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo y hija, el esposo trabaja como gestor de cobro, para ayudarle con los gastos de la casa, la señora trabaja como analista en la DGI, desde hace ochos años, la mayor dificultad que ha tendido es la falta de recurso para poder mejorar su casa, ya que ella vive en un cuarto que le dio su mamá. Los sueños de doña Senovia es llegar a terminar su casa. Con el préstamo va invertir en infraestructura en la compra de materiales como piedra, cemento, arena, hierro, para comenzar la construccion.
texts.en:
Mrs. Senovia R. is 36 years old and lives in the Medardo Andino neighborhood in the city of Ticuantepe with her husband and their daughter. Her husband works for a collection agency. In order to help him with the family's expenses, she has worked as an analyst in the DGI for the past 8 years. The biggest difficulty the family has had is earning enough to improve their home since Senovia lives in a small room that her mother offered her. Senovia's dream is to finish the construction of her home. With this loan, she will invest in materials to finish her home such as stone, cement, sand, and iron.
