Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to finish construction of her home

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es: Eufemia tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo Cléber, el cual se dedica a ser chofer, y sus tres hijos Lucero de 12, Fernando de 9 y Anali de 3. En bienestar de su familia y de aportar a su hogar, optó por alquilar su patio como cochera, obteniendo buenos ingresos y pudiéndolo realizar desde su casa mientras cuida de sus pequeños. El espacio va quedando chico, ya que Eufemia guarda muchos carros, es así que quiere ampliar su patio, para lo cual recurre a nuestra ayuda para hacer de sus sueños una realidad. Eufemia se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado expandirá su patio para albergar mayor cantidad de coches.
texts.en:
Eufemia is 32 years old and lives with her husband Cléber, who works as a chauffer, and their three children, Lucero, age 12, Fernando, age 9, and Anali, age 3. For the wellbeing of her family and to support her household, Eufemia chose to rent her patio out as a parking lot, which allows her to make money from her home while caring for her children. The space is small, and many cars park in the lot, so she would like to expand the patio. She has appealed to us for our help in making her dreams reality. This is Eufemia’s first loan through Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. With the loan she will expand her patio in order to park more cars.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her patio, which she uses as a parking lot

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco tiene 59 años, está casado con Damiana, con la cual tuvo 7 hijos, viviendo ahora sólo con una, la menor, Catalina de 17 años. El se dedica a la atención de su pequeño restaurante, negocio con el cual sobrevive desde hace 30 años. Su establecimiento es muy concurrido, gracias a la gran sazón de su esposa Damiana y su hija Catalina, las cuales preparan gran variedad de platos para ofrecer a la clientela. Lo que más le gusta a Francisco es poder trabajar al lado de su familia y apoyarse los unos en los otros, él sabe que no estará siempre para cuidar a su hija, es por eso que quiere expandir su negocio y así poder heredarle el negocio. Francisco se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará utensilios de cocina, como ollas, tenedores, cucharas, etc., y también productos para cocinar más variedad de platos y hacer que su negocio sea mucho más concurrido.
texts.en:
Francisco is 59 years old and married to Damiana with whom he has 7 children. Only their youngest daughter, Catalina, who is 17 years old, still lives with them. Francisco has worked for the past 30 years running his own small restaurant. His restaurant stays very busy thanks to the great cooking of his wife Damiana and their daughter Catalina who prepare a large variety of dishes to offer their clientele. Francisco enjoys working side by side with his family where they can mutually support each other. He knows that he won't always be around to take care of his daughter which is why he would like to expand his business to eventually leave it to her as an inheritance. This is the first loan that Francisco has requested from Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money, he will purchase kitchen utensils like pots and pans, forks, spoons, etc. and products to increase the variety of dishes they offer so they can attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of kitchen utensils and ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Guido

texts.es: Guido tiene 21 años, convive con su pareja, Pamela de 17 años, con la cual tiene un bebe de una semana de nacido llamado Andy. El se dedica a trabajar en el negocio, que asociado con sus hermanos, puso hace ya 2 años. Atiende eventos, brindando servicio de decoración de los ambientes, el alquiler de vajilla, comida, etc. El negocio va prosperando y Guido se siente muy  inspirado con el nacimiento de su bebé, y quiere hacer crecer su negocio para brindarle a su hijo una buena educación y darle a su esposa las mejores comodidades. La dificultad de su trabajo reside en que tiene que renovar los bienes que salen afectados en las fiestas, como la ruptura de vasos, manchado de telas, etc, teniendo que renovarlas haciendo que el gasto sea mayor. Guido se encuentra en su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará nuevas telas, vajilla, etc., para renovar su negocio y poder brindarles a sus clientes el mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Guido is 21 years old and lives with his significant other, Pamela, who is 17 years old, with whom he has a small baby boy named Andy who was born a week ago. He works in partnership with his brothers running an event rental and planning business that they started two years ago. They offer services including room decorations, china/tableware rental, food, etc. Their business continues growing and prospering and Guido feels very inspired by the birth of his son. He would like to grow the business more in order to offer his son a good education and provide a more comfortable life for his wife. The difficulty they encounter in their business is that they have to constantly repair or repurchase the assets that are damaged during the parties/events such as broken glasses, stained tablecloths, etc.; having to repair or repurchase them makes their expenses much greater. This is the first loan that Guido has requested from Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money, he will purchase new tableclothes, glasses, etc. to renew his business and offer better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new tablecloths and tableware

loans.name: Clara Sabina

texts.es:
La señora Clara Sabina tiene 23 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Poder y vive en la calle José de la Riva Agüero 267 del distrito El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa, pero no pudo continuar con sus estudios debido a la falta de recursos económicos. Se casó y tiene un hijo de 5 años que es estudiante.
Su negocio consiste en la compra de verduras y pescado, los cuales luego vende en la zona de la sierra. Con el primer crédito de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas lo invirtió en comprar verduras y pescado.
Con este crédito de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, lo invertirá en verduras y muy posible en fruta.
Clara sueña con tener una tienda en su zona.
texts.en:
Clara Sabina is 23 years old and married. She has a 5 year old who is in school. She herself finished high school, but could not continue her education due to a lack of resources. She is a member of the Banco Comunal Mujeres al Poder and lives on José de la Riva Agüero Street in the El Porvenir district, in the province of Trujillo, in the region of La Libertad, Peru. Clara's runs a business buying vegetables and fish and reselling them in the region. With her first loan of 300 soles, paid back in 4 installments, Clara bought vegetables and fish. With this next loan of 500 soles, which she will also pay back in 4 installments, she will purchase more vegetables and probably some fruit. Clara's dream is to set up a store in her region.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Inés tiene 46 años, es casada, vive con sus hijos, los cuales son su adoración. Se dedica a la venta D. comestibles en su pequeña tienda D. abarrotes, optó por este negocio porque le permite trabajar desD. su casa y velar por el bienestar D. sus pequeños hijos. Las ventas son buenas, ya que es la única tienda en toda la cuadra, logrando tener muchos clientes. Lo más difícil D. su trabajo es tener que permanecer desD. las 6 D. la mañana hasta las 9 D. la noche aproximadamente, pero cuenta con la ayuda D. sus hijos, los cuales la apoyan cada vez que les es posible, ya que ellos estudian y esa es su labor fundamental. Inés se encuentra en su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado implementará mejor tiendita para colmar las necesidades D. su clientela y así obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Inés is 46 years old and married. She lives with her children who are the light of her life. She dedicates herself to the sale of groceries from her little store, a business she chose because it allows her to work from home while caring for her children. Her sales are good because hers is the only store in the neighbourhood, giving her lots of clients. The hardest part of her work is that she must run the store from 6 in the morning until 9 at night, but she does get a lot of help from her children. They help out whenever they can, keeping in mind that their studies are the most important work they do. This will be Inés' first loan from Microfinanzas Prismas, and she will make her payments punctually. With the loan, she will increase the range of products that she offers at her store so that she may better fulfill the needs of her clients and thus, increase her revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Cristina Haydee

texts.es:
La señora Cristina Haydee tiene 47 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Poder y vive en la calle Mariano Melgar 115 del distrito de El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta primero de secundaria, pero prefirió trabajar y aprender costura y no continuó estudiando secundaria.  Se casó a los 29 años, tiene un hijo de 7 años y una hija de 18 años, los cuales son estudiantes.
Su negocio consiste en la venta de comida; desayuno, almuerzo y cena, que lo elabora para repartir de casa en casa con previo pedido. Con el primer crédito de S/. 300 que canceló en 4 cuotas, invirtió en insumos para la venta de comidas.
Con este crédito de S/ 300 el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas invertirá en la compra de gaseosa, jugos y arreglará su refrigeradora.
Cristina sueña con tener un restaurant muy grande.
texts.en:
Cristina Haydee is 47 years old and married. She got married when she was 29 years old and has a 7 year old son and an 18 year old daughter who are in school . She is a member of the Banco Comunal Mujeres al Poder, and lives on Mariano Melgar Street, in the district of El Porvenir, in the province of Trujillo, in the region of La Libertad, Peru. She began high school but did not complete it, deciding at the time that she would rather learn to sew and begin work. Today, she runs a business selling meals: breakfasts, lunches and dinners which she prepares for home delivery. With her first loan of 300 soles, which she paid back in 4 installments, Cristina bought ingredients for her meals. With this next loan of 300 soles, which will also be paid back in 4 installments, she will buy soft drinks and juices, and she will fix her refrigerator. Cristina's dream is to have her own restaurant

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for drinks and repairs

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es: Juliana tiene 25 años, vive sola, ya que aún es soltera. Se dedica a la venta de objetos de segundo uso, como bicicletas, carteras, ropa, etc. se ha dedicado a esta labor desde hace 10 años, que fue cuando incursionó en este negocio. Las ventas son muy buenas, el trabajo es muy sacrificado, ya que tiene que vender de 6 de la mañana hasta las 5 o 6 de la tarde que es cuando no hay mucha iluminación y debe recoger el negocio, ya que vende de forma ambulante. Afortunadamente Juliana está muy dedicada al negocio, haciendo que éste de muy buenos frutos, y piensa que si sigue como hasta ahora, en un futuro podrá expandir su negocio. Se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para poder aumentar la venta y por ende sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Juliana is 25 years old and lives on her own because she is still single. She sells secondhand items, such as bicycles, handbags, clothing, etc. She has been involved in this line of work for 10 years, which was when she started this business. Sales are good, but her job is arduous because she works from 6 in the morning to 5 or 6 in the evening, when there is not much light and she has to pack away her business; she is a street vendor. Fortunately, Juliana is very dedicated to her business, which gives her profits. She plans on continuing as she has until now so that she can expand her business in the future. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is very punctual with her payments. With this loan, she will purchase a greater amount of merchandise so that she can boost both sales and profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Edita Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Edita Graciela tiene 60 años de edad, pertenece al Banco comunal Bellavista II y vive en la calle Los Angeles 861, distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Es autodidacta, sola aprendió a leer y escribir ya que por falta de apoyo no fue nunca a la escuela. Decidió vivir con el compañero de su vida desde la edad de 20 años y ahora tiene un hijo.
Edita tiene un puesto en el mercado de su calle, lugar donde vende artículos de primera necesidad y también comida. Con el primer crédito de S/. 300, cancelado en 4 cuotas lo invirtió en arreglar su puesto, le colocó techo.
Con este crédito de S/. 1,200, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, invertirá en comprar panetones para las fiestas navideñas.
Edita sueña con tener una tienda grande.
texts.en:
Ms. Edita Graciela is 60 years old and lives on 861 Los Angeles Street, district of La Esperanza, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Perú. She is a member of the Bellavista II microfinance institute.

She is an autodidact, which means that she learned how to read and write on her own because she did not attend school due to a lack of support. She decided to live with her domestic partner at the age of 20, and they now have a son.

Edita has a stand at the market on her street, where she sells basic need items and food. She invested her first 300.00 PEN loan, which was repaid in 4 monthly installments, in fixing up her stand—she added a roof to it. With this 1,200.00 loan, which will be repaid in 6 monthly installments, she will purchase panetones (Peruvian holiday fruitcake) for the Christmas festivities.

Edita dreams of owning a large store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Peruvian holiday fruitcakes

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es: Leticia tiene 54 años, es madre soltera, vive son su hija y el esposo de esta. Se dedica a la venta de manualidades por campaña, realiza cadenillas, rosones de cintas para los adornos de las empresas cuando están de aniversario, coronas, muñecos navideños, etc. para venderlos cuando es su temporada. El negocio es rentable porque gracias a los 20 años de experiencia, Leticia se ha hecho conocida en el medio y recibe grandes pedidos, lo cual hace que siempre se mantenga ocupada. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es que con los varios pedidos que recibe, a veces no se abastece para poder cumplirlos todos, además que a su edad, su vista no funciona tan bien como antes, pero gracias a su empeño y al apoyo de su hija, Leticia piensa seguir hacia delante a cumplir todas sus metas. Se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de material para realizar manualidades navideñas, ahora que la navidad esta tan próxima.
texts.en:
Leticia is a 54-year-old single mother who lives with her daughter and son-in-law. She makes seasonal handicrafts—such as decorative paper chains, gift wrap bows as ornaments for company celebrations, wreaths, Christmas dolls, etc.—which she sells according to the season. Her business is lucrative because thanks to her 20 years of experience, Leticia has made a name for herself in this trade. She receives big orders, which means that she is always kept busy. The most difficult aspect of her job is filling all the orders. Furthermore, at her age, her sight is not what it used to be, but thanks to her dedication and to her daughter's support, Leticia plans on moving ahead and reaching all her goals. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She has been very punctual with her payments. With the loan being requested, she will purchase a greater quantity of supplies to make Christmas handicrafts now that the holidays are approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies to make handicrafts

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 21 años, es soltera y vive sola. Se dedica a la venta ambulante de chicharrón, este rico plato elaborado en base a carne de cerdo y productos de la región, en la plaza de armas del Distrito de Cabana, al ser una zona céntrica, la venta es muy buena logrando que María se sienta muy optimista en mejorar su negocio. A ella siempre le ha gustado cocinar y cree que con su sazón deleita los paladares de todos sus asiduos clientes, lo más dificultoso es adquirir la carne de cerdo, ya que los precios están aumentando, lo cual afecta a su negocio. María se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado quiere comprar más carne de cerdo para cocinar mayor cantidad de platos y además comprar bancas para poder ofrecerles mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria is 21 years old, single, and lives alone. She is engaged in the mobile sale of chicharron - this rich dish is prepared using pork and regional products. She sells it in the Plaza de Armas in the Cabana District, which is centrally located. Her sales are very good, so Maria feels very optomistic about improving her business. She has always liked to cook and she believes with her flavors she delights the palates of all of her regular customers. The most difficult thing is acquiring pork, as prices are increasing, which affects her business. This is Maria's first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money requested, she wants to buy more pork to cook a larger quantity of dishes and moreover to buy benches to be able to offer greater comfort to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of more ingredients to prepare the food that she sells.

loans.name: Migdonia

texts.es: Migdonia tiene 44 años, es viuda, vive con sus dos hijos, Henry de 19 años y Yenny de 17. Se dedica a la venta de golosinas, detergentes, aceites, etc., además, de variedad de productos comestibles, ella vende en la Mina la Rinconada, donde lleva sus productos, trabajando desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde aproximadamente, ya que también debe dedicarle tiempo a sus hijos, los cuales se encuentran en edades muy difíciles requiriendo de su guía. El negocio es rentable, lo más difícil es tener que trabajar en el inclemente frío de la zona. Migdonia se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de productos para comercializar y así aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Migdonia is 44 years old, widowed, and lives with her two children, Henry who is 19 years old and Yenny who is 17. She sells candy, detergents, oils, etc, as well as a variety of food products. She sells these in the Rinconada mine, where she brings her products, working from 8 in the morning until approximately 3 in the afternoon. She must also devote time to her children, who are at a difficult age and require her guidance. Her business is profitable; the most difficult thing is that she has to work in the inclement cold of the region. This is Migdonia’s first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money requested, she will buy a large quantity of products to market and in this way increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the merchandise in her store.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora Elena tiene 27 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Bella Vista II y vive en la calle Los Ángeles 772 del distrito La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta segundo año de secundaria y no continuó por falta de recursos económicos. Se casó a los 22 años y tiene 2 hijos, una niña de 7 años que su abuela la tiene viviendo en la sierra y un niño de 2 años que vive con ella.
Elena se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, el cual lo realiza desde tempranas horas ofreciendo sus productos de casa en casa. Con el primer crédito de S/. 300 que canceló en 4 cuotas, compró productos de la línea UNIQUE.
Con este crédito de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en stock de otras líneas de belleza también.
Elena sueña con tener un negocio propio.
texts.en:
Elena is 27 years old and is a member of the Comunal Bank Bella Vista II. She lives at 772 Los Angeles Street in the La Esperanza district in Trujillo province in the La Libertad department of Peru.

She left high school without finishing for lack of financial resources. She married at 22 years of age and has 2 children; Elena lives with her 2-year-old son and her 7-year-old daughter lives with her grandmother in the mountains.

Elena sells beauty products door to door starting out in the early morning. With her first loan of 300 soles (1 $US = 3 soles), which she repaid in 4 instalments, she bought items from the UNIQUE product line. With this loan of 500 soles, which she will repay in 4 instalments, she'll invest in other beauty lines as well. Elena dreams of owning her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Julia Magaly

texts.es:
La señora Julia Magaly tiene 39 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Nueva Esperanza II y vive en la calle San Lucas 702 sector Jerusalén, distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Terminó secundaria completa y continuó estudiando dos años de cosmetología. Se casó a la edad de 17 años y tiene 2 hijos que aún son estudiantes.
Su negocio consiste en la venta de ropa y juguetes, los cuales lleva a diferentes partes de la sierra liberteña y vende en ferias y mercados. Actualmente está arreglando su casa para instalar una tienda y poder exhibir su mercadería.
El primer crédito de S/. 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas, lo invirtió en ropa para vender.
Con este crédito de S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, invertirá en ropa, golosinas y juguetes.
Julia sueña con tener su propia empresa y poner una tienda para su hija.
texts.en:
Julia Magaly is 39 years old is part of the Communal Bank Nueva Esperanza II. She lives at 702 San Lucas Street of the Jerusalem sector in La Esperanza district, in the province of Trujillo in La Libertad department of Peru.

She finished high school and went on to study 2 years of cosmetology. She married at 17 years of age and has two children, both are students. Her business comprises the sale of clothing and toys, which she takes to different parts of the mountains and sells at fairs and markets.

She is currently fixing up her house to instal a store where she can display her merchandise.

With her 1st loan of 300 soles (1 $US = 3 soles), which she repaid in 4 instalments, she invested in clothing to sell. With this loan of 1000 soles, which she will repay in 6 instalments, she will invest in clothing, candy and toys. Julia dreams of owning her own business and having a store for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing, candy and toys.

loans.name: Karen Yessenia

texts.es:
La señora Karen Yessenia tiene 19 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Poder y vive en la calle José de la Riva Agüero 261 del distrito El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa y ahora estudia manualidades. Vive con su pareja con el cual tiene un hijo de 11 meses.
Su negocio consiste en la elaboración de trabajos manuales junto con su cuñada. También alquila disfraces. Con su primer crédito de S/. 300 que canceló en 4 cuotas, lo invirtió en comprar materiales para sus trabajos.
Con este crédito de S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, lo invertirá en material de disfraces.
Karen sueña con tener un día una gran tienda de disfraces y adornos manuales.
texts.en:
Karen Yessenia is 19 years old and is a member of the Communal Bank "Women in Power". She lives at 261 José de la Riva Agüero of the El Porvenir district, Trujillo province, in the department of La Libertad, Peru.

She graduated from high school and is now learning how to make handicrafts. She lives with her partner and their 11-month-old baby. Her business entails the making of arts and crafts with her mother-in-law. She also rents costumes.

With her 1st loan of 300 soles, which she repaid in 4 instalments, she invested in materials for her crafts. With this loan of 300 soles, which she'll repay in 4 instalments, she'll invest in materials for costume-making. Karen dreams of one day owning a big costume and arts and crafts store.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material for costume-making.

loans.name: Lucia Yuri

texts.es:
La señora Lucia Yuri tiene 23 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Bellavista II y vive en la calle Los Ángeles 845 del distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió primaria completa, pero no continuó estudiando por razones económicas. Se casó a los 17 años y tiene una hija de 5 años que  depende económicamente de Lucia.
Su negocio consiste en la venta de bebidas, vende cerveza y gaseosa. Con el primer crédito de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró cerveza.
Con este crédito de S/. 700 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas,  invertirá en  gaseosa.
Lucia sueña con tener su casa propia y un negocio..
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucia Yuri is 23 years old, she belongs to "Banco Comunal Bellavista II" and lives in the street named Los Ángeles 845 of the district of La Esperanza, province of Trujillo, department La Liberetad, Peru. She finished her elementary school studies but did not continue studying for economic reasons. She married when she was 17 and has a 5 year-old daughter that depends economically on Lucia.

She sells beverages; beer and soft drinks. With the first credit of S/.300, repaid in 4 payments, she bought beer. With this credit of S/.700 soles, to be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy soft drinks. It is Lucía's dream to have her own house and a business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of soft drinks

loans.name: María Emilia

texts.es:
L. señora María Emilia tiene 80 años D. edad y vive en L. calle José D. L. Riva Agüero 267, distrito D. El Porvenir, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. L. Libertad, Perú.
Estudió el primer año D. educación primaria, pero no continuó estudiando por el bajo nivel económico. Se casó a los 20 años y tuvo tres hijos, pero uno falleció.
María trabaja comprando y vendiendo verdura, elL. compra toda clase D. verdura en Trujillo y L. venD. en L. sierra, aprovechando un carro que tiene una hija.
El primer crédito fue D. S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas lo que invirtió en verduras.
Con este crédito D. S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, lo invertirá en verduras.
María Emilia sueña con tener una vida tranquiL. y una jubilación.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Emilia is 80 years old and lives in José D. L. Riva Agüero No. 267, district of El Porvenir, province of Trujillo, department of L. Libertad, Peru. She studied first graD., elementary, but did not continue her studies due to her low financial level. She married when she was 20 years old and had three children, but one passed away.

María works buying and selling vegetables, she buys all kinds of vegetables in Trujillo and sells them in the mountains, using her daughter's vehicle. The first loan of S/.300, repaid in 4 payments, was invested in vegetables. With this loan of S/.500, to be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy vegetables. María Emilia dreams of living a quiet life and a retirement plan.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of vegetables

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La señora María Teresa tiene 61 años D. edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Bellavista II y vive en la calle Los Ángeles 799, distrito La Esperanza, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió 3 años D. Enfermería Técnica, lo que en su tiempo se llamaba Auxiliar D. Enfermería, pero no tuvo oportunidad D. trabajar en su profesión. Tiene una hija D. 42 años, que siempre la alegra con sus visitas y las D. sus nietos.
María tiene una bodega donD. venD. artículos D. primera necesidad y donD. venD. tejidos y bordados en cinta que ella misma confecciona. El negocio lo realiza en su casa y también D. manera ambulante, porque ofrece sus tejidos en las calles.
Con el primer crédito D. S/. 300 que canceló en 4 cuotas, compró hilos para los tejidos.
Con este crédito D. S/, 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en insumos para la bodega.
María sueña con tener una tienda D. artesanía en el centro D. la ciudad.
texts.en:
Doña María Teresa is 61 years old, she belongs to "Banco Comunal Bellavista II" and lives in Los Angeles No. 799, district La Esperanza, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. She studied technical nursing, then it was called assistant nursing, but never had a chance to work. She has a 42 year-old daughter who always brightens up her day visiting her with her grandchildren.

María has a general store where she sells groceries as well as fabrics, knitted and embroidered by herself. The business is located at her house and she also offers her fabrics in the streets. With the first loan of S/.300, repaid in 4 payments, she bought knitting yarn. With this credit of S/.500, to be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy products for her general store. It is María's dream to have a crafts store in the center of the town.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for general store.

loans.name: Marina Deysi

texts.es:
La señora Marina Deysi tiene 57 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Nueva Esperanza II y vive en la calle San Pablo 535 sector Jerusalén, distrito La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Terminó primaria y ya no continuó estudiando porque no contaba con apoyo económico, pero como es una mujer emprendedora es autodidacta, lee mucho. Al conversar con ella se descubre su formación como mujer y como líder que en algún momento fue en su comunidad. Se unió a su pareja a los 27 años y tienen 5 hijos, uno falleció con neumonía cuando era un bebé. Actualmente depende de la pareja un hijo que aún es estudiante.
Marina se dedica al cultivo y venta de plantas, flores, humus, tierra de jardín, etc. Lo realiza en un puesto del mercado de su sector y en forma ambulante en un triciclo.
Con el primer crédito que fue de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas lo invirtió en la compra de nueva variedad de plantas.
Con este crédito de  S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de humus y variedad de flores.
Marina sueña con ser mayorista en la venta de flores, tener un gran jardín donde pueda cosechar y exportar.
texts.en:
Ms. Marina Deysi is 57 years old and lives on 535 San Pablo Street, Jerusalén sector, district of La Esperanza, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Perú. She is a member of the Nueva Esperanza II (New Hope II) microfinance institute.

She completed elementary school, but was unable to continue with her studies because she did not have financial support. However, because she is an enterprising, self-taught woman, she reads a lot. Upon conversing with her, one can observe her upbringing as a woman and as a community leader, as she once was. She got together with her partner 27 years ago, and they have 5 children, one of whom died of pneumonia during infancy. They currently have one dependent, school age son.

Marina cultivates and sells plants, flowers, compost, potting soil, etc. She sells her products both in a stand at her local market, and as a street vendor on an urban delivery tricycle.

She invested her first 300.00 PEN loan, which was repaid in 4 monthly installments, in purchasing a new variety of plants.

She will invest this 300.00 PEN loan, which will also be repaid in 4 monthly installments, in purchasing compost and a variety of flowers.

Marina dreams of becoming a flower wholesaler and having a large nursery in which she can grow and export plants.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost and flowers

loans.name: Mayra Delia

texts.es:
La señora Mayra Delia tiene 23 años años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Poder y vive en la calle José de la Riva Agüero 261 B, distrito El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa y continuó estudios de Computación, pero ahora vive con su pareja y aún no tiene niños.
Su negocio consiste en la elaboración de manualidades, en sociedad con su cuñada,  elabora sorpresas para cumpleaños y para el colegio.
Con este crédito de S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará materiales como pegamento, corrospun, tela de seda, etc.
Mayra sueña con tener un gran taller que abastezca la venta de sus materiales que confecciona.
texts.en:
Mayra Delia is 23 years old and is a member of the Communal Bank "Women In Power". She lives at 261 B José de la Riva Agüero of the El Porvenir district, Trujillo province, in the department of La Libertad, Peru.

She graduated from high school and then studied computers. She now lives with her partner and don't yet have children. Her business entails making arts and crafts with her mother-in-law. She makes birthday gifts and items for school.

With this loan of 300 Soles (1 $US = 3 Soles), which she will repay in 4 instalments, she'll buy materials such as glue, corrospun (sheets of plastic), silk, etc. Mayra dreams of owning her own workshop where she can sell the arts and crafts she makes.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy glue, corrospun (plastic sheets), silk, etc.

loans.name: Roger Antonio

texts.es: El señor Roger Antonio L. Arias  tiene la edad de 41  años, habita en el barrio san Ignacio junto a su esposa y hijos don Ignacio  trabaja como agricultor desde hace mas de quince años , su esposa es comerciante y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar . La mayor dificultad es la falta de financiamiento.  Pero don Ignacio se siente muy contento por que con la ayuda que le ha brindado AFODENIC ha logrado establecer una manzana de pitahaya. Los sueños de este señor es darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia. con este préstamo es para invertir en materiales de insumos para mejorar la produccion
texts.en:
Roger Antonio L. Arias is 41 yeas old and lives in the San Ignacio neighborhood with his wife and children. Ignacio has worked as a farmer for more than fifteen years, and his wife works as a merchant and helps with the household expenses. The biggest difficulty is lack of financing. However, Ignacio feels very happy because with the help provided by AFODENIC he has managed to establish a block of dragon fruit. This man dreams of providing a better standard of living for his family. This loan is to invest in products to improve his production.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies for cultivation of his crops.

loans.name: Nereida Elena

texts.es:
La señora Nereida Elena tiene 63 años D. edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Nueva Esperanza II y vive en la calle Aviación 1198 sector Jerusalén, distrito D. La Esperanza, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió primaria completa, pero no continuó estudiando porque forzosamente tuvo que trabajar desD. muy niña. Se casó a los 20 años y tiene 5 hijos, que ya están casados.
Nereida tiene una bodega en la cual trabaja diariamente y D. la cual vive. AtienD. a sus clientes con mucha alegría, lo que le ayuda a obtener mayor clientela.
Con su primer crédito D. S/. 300 que canceló en 4 cuotas, invirtió en compra D. abarrotes para ampliar su bodega.
Con este crédito D. S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, invertirá en arroz, azúcar, gaseosa.
Nereida sueña con tener un mini mercado por su zona.
texts.en:
Nereida Elena is 63 years old and is a member of the Communal Bank "Nueva Esperanza II". She lives at 1198 Aviación Street in the Jerusalén sector of the distrito of La Esperanza, in the province of Trujillo, in the La Libertad department of Peru.

She finished elementary school but didn't continue on because she was forced to get a job at a very young age. She married at 20 and has 5 children who are all now married. Nereida owns a small grocery outlet that she works in every day and that supports her. She attends her customers with a big smile which helps her build a customer base.

With her 1st loan of 300 Soles (1 $US = 3 Soles), which she repaid in 4 instalments, she invested in grocery items to expand her store. With this loan of 1000 Soles, which she will repay in 6 instalments, she will invest in rice, sugar and soda. Nereida dreams of owning a mini market in her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa tiene 49 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Bellavista II y vive en la calle Los Ángeles 918, del distrito La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa pero no continuó estudios superiores debido a que se casó a los 17 años. Actualmente tiene 5 hijos, todos casados y tiene 2 nietos que dependen de ella.
Su negocio consiste en la venta de productos lácteos, sale por las mañanas y reparte manjar, queso y rosquitas de manteca.
Con el primer crédito de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró yogur, queso y manjar.
Con este crédito de S/. 800, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, invertirá en productos lácteos como manjar, queso, yogurt y mermeladas.
Rosa sueña con producir sus propios insumos para vender.
texts.en:
Rosa is 49 years old and is a member of the Communal Bank "Bellavista II". She lives at 918 Los Angeles Street in the district of La Esperanza in the province of Trujillo, in the La Libertad department of Peru.

She finished high school but didn't continue on as she was married at 17 years old. She has 5 children who are all married and 2 grandchildren who depend on her. She owns a dairy business in which she goes out in the morning to sell manjar (sweet filling made of condensed milk), cheese and rosquitas de manteca (baked cookies and/or doughnuts).

With her first loan of 300 Soles (1 $US = 3 Soles), which she repaid in 4 instalments, she bought yogurt, cheese and manjar. With this loan of 800 Soles, which she will repay in 6 instalments, she will invest in dairy products such as manjar, cheese, yogurt and marmalades.

Rosa dreams of producing her own products to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dairy products such as manjar, cheese, yogurt and marmalade.

loans.name: Rosery Lizet

texts.es:
La señora Rosmery Lizet tiene 30 años de edad. pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Poder y vive en el pasaje San Felipe 140, distrito El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió primaria completa, pero no continuó estudiando por falta de apoyo familiar y luego cuando alcanzó la mayoría de edad se casó. Actualmente tiene un hijo y una hija que aún son estudiantes.
La señora Rosmery trabaja vendiendo ropa de temporada y además perfila calzado, lo que es de mayor apoyo económico.
Con su primer crédito de S/. 300 que canceló en 4 cuotas, lo invirtió en comida que en ese tiempo vendía.
Con este crédito de S/. 900, el cual  será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá para la campaña ñavideña.
Rosmery sueña con tener una tienda muy grande.
texts.en:
Rosmery Lizet is 30 years old. She is a member of the Mujeres al Poder Community Bank and lives in the El Porvenir District, Trujillo Province, La Libertad Department, Peru.

She completed primary school, but did not continue studying due to lack of family support and then when she reached adulthood, she got married. She currently has a son and a daughter who are still students.

Rosmery sells clothes and makes footwear, which provides greater economic support.

With her first loan of 300 soles, she completed repayment in 4 payments. She invested it in food, which at that time she sold.

With this loan for 900 soles, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will invest for the Christmas season. Rosmery dreams of having a very large store.

Translated from Spanish by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest for the Christmas season

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: Teofila tiene 53 años, es natural del pueblito de Pusi, vive sola, ya que no tuvo esposo ni hijos. Reside en la ciudad de Juliaca hace 32 años, saliendo de su pueblito natal en busca de un mejor porvenir, se dedica a la venta de golosinas de forma ambulatoria hace 6 años después de haber realizado todo tipo de negocios. La venta de golosinas es muy rentable y gracias a ello obtiene buenos ingresos, lo más difícil es tener que enfrentarse sola al trabajo, ya que pasa largas horas atendiendo su pequeño puesto, lo bueno de esto es que ha ganado muy buenos amigos gracias a su cordialidad y alegría, lo cual hace que los clientes sean muy asiduos a su puestito. Teofila se encuentra en segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de golosinas para poder comercializar, es por eso que recurre a nuestra ayuda para hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Teofila is 53 years old and is originally from the town of Pusi. She lives alone, and has never been married or had any children. She has been living in the city of Juliaca for 32 years, leaving the town she was born in to find a better future. She has been selling sweets as a street vendor for 6 years, after having tried all types of jobs. Sweets sales is very profitable and thanks to that she has obtained a good income. The most difficult aspect of this job is working alone and she must pass long hours attending her small stand. The great thing is that she has gained many good friends thanks to her warmth and cheerfulness, making many of the clients regulars of her little stand. Teofila is asking for her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, following very punctual payments on her first loan. With the money that is lent, she will buy the more sweets to sell. For this, she is asking again for our help to build her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christina Stoddard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the number of sweets she can sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 31 años, es soltera y vive en casa de su familia. Desde hace 8 años se dedica al negocio de la artesanía, teje variedad de prendas con ayuda de sus hermanos, quienes trabajan con ella produciendo las prendas. A Elizabeth le gusta el tejido y ve en él una herramienta muy útil para lograr todas sus aspiraciones, además el negocio va muy bien y cada vez arroja mejores ingresos, pero como en todo trabajo también se tienen algunos problemas, en el caso de Elizabeth la dificultad radica en cumplir con todos los pedidos que tiene que entregar, para lo cual muchas veces tiene que trabajar durante todo el día. Se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de lana para tejer muchas más prendas y así lograr más ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 31 years old, single and lives with her family. Eight years ago, she began working in arts and crafts, weaving a variety of garments with the help of her brothers, who work with her to produce the clothing. Elizabeth likes weaving and sees it as a useful tool to achieve her aspirations. The business is going very well and every time she yields more income, but like in all work, she also has some problems. In Elizabeth’s case, the difficulty lies in having to live up to all the orders that she has to deliver, which often times requires he to work all day long. She is asking for her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she receives, she will buy more yarn to weave more clothing in order to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Christina Stoddard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more yarn to increase her clothing sales

loans.name: Pak

texts.en: Mrs. Pak T., 27, is a resident of the Progel Commune in Pursat Province. She makes a living growing rice and vegetables. She is the mother of five children, three of whom are single. Her husband, Mr. Khoeun Bunthorn, 35, is a carpenter. He makes furniture such as chairs, tables, windows, and beds. This provides the main source for income for his family. Pak requests a loan of 1,000,000 Riel ($250) to purchase wood for her husband to produce more furniture.

loans.use: to purchase a  wood to make furniture

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoeurn N. is 34 years old and she lives in Krodas Kor village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a pig breeder. Since her pigs are getting bigger and bigger, she does not have enough money to support her breeding. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food for her business.

Mrs. Yoeurn N. has six children, one of whom uses an electric plow to plow fields for villagers for an income, while another one is a pig breeder who helps in their mother’s business. The others are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Phai Ren, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband is present with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy pig food for her pig breeding business.

loans.name: Srey Na

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Na C. is a 31-year-old widow and lives in Doun Taur village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a tailor in the local village. Aside from this business, she is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil which has a bad effect on her crop. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Srey Na C. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en: Mrs. Sokheng Y. is 27 years old and she lives in Trea village in Kandal Province. She is employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Nut Piny, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Since they cannot support their household well, Mrs. Sokheng Y. decided to request a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to start as a motorbike taxi driver. She hopes to increase their income and improve her family's living conditions. She has two children who are attending the local school. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to start as a motorbike taxi driver.

loans.name: Sai

texts.en: Mr. Sai S. lives in Doun Taur village in Kampong Cham Province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Sin Nai, is a duck breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it; thus, Mr. Sai S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks for breeding. He hopes to increase income and improve their living conditions with this loan. He is 55 years old and the father of six children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the others are enrolled in the local school. Her wife is present on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more ducks for breeding.

loans.name: Hing's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The group is comprised of three people. The borrowers live in Knasondaiy Commune in Siem Reap Province.

Mrs. Hing E., 30, runs a store in her home selling rice. Her profits are the main source of income for her family. She has been in this business for a year. She also takes care of four children, all of whom are single and live at home. Her husband, Mr. Pot Chanty, 37, is in the Cambodian military and receives a salary of $50 per month. To expand the business, Hing is applying for a $400 loan to order more rice to store and sell.

Mrs. Chin P., 29, a widow, is a local grocery seller. She needs a $400 loan to buy mores groceries to sell.

Mrs. Chen P., 33, makes a living selling fish at the local market. Chen is requesting a loan of $200 to buy a motorcycle to make transportation easier.

Mrs. E., Mrs. P.'s husband, and Mrs. P. are pictured.

loans.use: to order more rice to store and resell

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim C., 40, a widow, is a resident of Svaypleung Commune in Kompong Tom Province. She makes different kinds of food to sell on her bicycle. She has been operating this business since 2000 and earns approximately $3 per day. She now lives with her mother, Mrs. Bun Pheng, 65, a Khmer noodle seller. Her mother helps her care for CChenghieng's three young children. In order to earn additional income. C. is requesting a $500 loan to buy piglets and foods for them.

(Mrs. C.'s mother and her daughter are pictured because she was not available.)

loans.use: to buy the piglets and foods for them

loans.name: Kak

texts.en: Mr. Kak K., 26, is a resident of Kompong Tom Province. He is a motorcycle taxi (tuk tuk) driver; driving his passengers from place to place in his province. He can earn up to $6 each day. His wife, Mrs. Moal Srymao, 24, sells groceries and also takes care of one young child. K. seeks a $800 loan to buy a motorcycle taxi to replace his old one. The loan will make his family's living conditions better.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Mrs. Hun S., 30, lives in the Chroloung Commune in Kompong Tom Province. She raises pigs at her home, which she sells to the butcher after she has raised them for six months. She cares for a young child who is attending school. Her husband, Mr. Ven Sinat, 34, makes a living selling duck eggs. S. and her husband decided to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 Riel ($250) to purchase more food to fatten their poultry.

loans.use: to purchase more food for their poultry

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs. Chan C., 43, is the mother of four children. The two eldest are married. Her third child is construction worker and the youngest, a daughter, is a garment worker. C. makes a living growing vegetables, which she sells three months after planting. She has been engaging in this business since 2005. Her husband, Mr. Phin Sarin, 48, is a local teacher. C. is requesting a $500 loan to purchase a secondhand motorcycle for her husband to provide him with a means of transportation. The family lives in Pursat Province.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand motorcycle

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Chheng S., 25, has no children and lives in Kompong Tom Province. She makes a living by selling different kinds of the desserts at the local market and earns a profit of $4 per day. She is married to Mr. Tim Rosh, 27, a motorcycle taxi driver. He earns approximately $4 each day. S. is applying for a loan of $1,200 to buy two baby cows to raise and to replace the old motorcycle her husband uses. A new motorcycle will make her husband's work easier. The loan will help her family earn additional income.

S. is pictured with her husband.

loans.use: To buy two baby cows and replace a motorcycle

loans.name: Chhlea

texts.en: Mr. Chhlea K., 44, lives in the Treal Commune in Kompong Tom Province. He is married to Mrs. Mao Yon, 42, who is the mother of their five children.  One of their children is married.  The two who are employed earn approximately $4 a day. The couple make a living raising pigs and are widely known in their area as a skilled pigs farmers.  They have been engaged in this business since 2004. K. is requesting a loan of $400 to buy more piglets to raise and food to fatten them.

loans.use: to buy more piglets

loans.name: Min

texts.en:
Mrs. Min M. is a farmer in Kouk Doung village in Takeo Province. She owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In the plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field. In order to deal this problem, she decided to ask for a loan for plowing the field. She would use the rest of the money to buy fertilizer to support the field.

Mrs. Min M. is 51 years old and the mother of a child who is employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Mork Nhay, is a construction worker. Her husband is also present with her in the picture.

loans.use: To plow the field and buy fertilizer to support the field.

loans.name: Si

texts.en: Mrs. Si H. is a 30-year-old widow and is now living in Doun Taur village in Kampong Cham Province. She has a child who is too young to work or study. Mrs. Si H. is a duck breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more ducks and duck food for her duck breeding business. By expanding her poultry business, she hopes to earn additional income and to provide a better life for herself.

loans.use: To purchase more ducks and duck food for her duck breeding business.

loans.name: Soth

texts.en:
Mrs. Soth S. is a farmer in Boeng Veang village in Kampong Cham Province. She owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces a small problem because her field is infertile, which has a bad effect on her crop. In order to solve this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive.

Mrs. Soth S. is 57 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a construction worker, while the other is a farmer who helps on his mother's plantation. Her husband, Mr. Vorn Art, owns an electric plow which is hired by the other villagers to plow their fields. Her husband is present on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhom M. is a farmer in Put Sum village in Takeo Province. She owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Seim Saroeun, is a construction worker. Even though they have different business, they still earn little income to support their household. In order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. Sokhom M. decided to ask for a loan to buy ducklings to start a duck-breding business, and she also needs duck food for them. She is 37 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is employed in garment factory, while the others three are attending the local school. The youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy ducklings and duck food for them.

loans.name: Sith

texts.en: Mr. Sith S. lives in Boeng Veang village in Kampong Cham Province. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In the plantation, he faces a problem because his field is infertile. In order to solve this problem, he decided to request a loan to purchase fertilizer to make his crop more productive. His wife, Mrs. Chi Kiep, is a pig breeder. Mr. Sith S. is 35 years old and the father of three children who are attending the local school. His wife is also shown in the picture with him.

loans.use: To request for a loan to purchase fertilizer to make his crop more productive.

loans.name: Akouvi Apeafan

texts.fr:
Madame V. Akouvi Apeafan est née le 26 décembre 1985 à Lomé, le capital du Togo. Cette jeune fille est célibataire et elle n’a pas d’enfant.  Elle a pour activité la vente de chaussures et bijoux qu’elle achète à la grande marche de Lomé et qu’elle revend à la marche d’Agoè, un quartier au nord de la ville.  
Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit au près de WAGES et a bien remboursé.
Ce deuxième crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 25 pairs de chaussures et 20 chaines complets. Avec ce nouveau stock, elle pourra mieux vendre et réaliser beaucoup de bénéfice.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akouvi Apeafan V. was born on December 26, 1985 in Lomé, the capital of Togo. This young woman is still single and has no children. Her business is selling shoes and costume jewelry that she buys in the big open-air market in Lomé and re-sells in the market in Agoè, a neighborhood north of the city.

She has already had one loan from WAGES and she reimbursed it correctly. This second loan that she is requesting will allow her to buy 25 pairs of shoes and 20 necklaces. With this new stock she will be able to make more sales and make a lot of profit.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of shoes and costume jewelry

loans.name: Channy

texts.en: Mrs. Channy S. is a 29-year-old and she lives in Doun Taur village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a duck breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks, duck food, and medicine for breeding. She hopes to increase income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Thlork Kun, is a farmer who owns 1 hectare of land to cultivate rice. Aside from the plantation, he is a construction worker. Mrs. Channy S. has two children who are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more ducks, duck food, and medicine for her breeding.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Monsieur G. Kodjo est né le 31 décembre 1971 à Agoè, le quartier au nord de Lomé ou il habite toujours. Il est célibataire avec deux enfants et a pour activité la vente des pièces détachées dans son quartier. Il est un revendeur, et il achète ses produits à la grande marche de Lomé. 
Il a une fois bénéficié du crédit au près de WAGES et a bien remboursé.
Ce second crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 2 moteurs pour revendre et gagner un profit.
texts.en:
Mr. Kodjo G. was born on December 31, 1971 in Agoè, the neighborhood north of Lomé where he still lives. He is single raising two children, and his business is selling spare parts in his neighborhood. He buys the parts he re-sells in the big open-air market of Lomé.

He has received one loan from WAGES and reimbursed it correctly. This second loan that he is requesting will permit him to buy 2 motors to re-sell and make a profit from.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of spare parts

loans.name: Phen

texts.en: Mrs. Phen T. is a villager in Krodas Kor village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to make her crops more productive. Mrs. Phen T. is a 42-year-old widow without any children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to make her crops more productive.

loans.name: Kim Im

texts.en: Mrs. Kim Im L. is a villager in Prey Mei Khang Thboung village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She faces an obstacle because her field is infertile. Thus, she decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer to make her crops more productive. Her husband, Mr. Tuch Tom, is a motorbike taxi. Mrs. Kim Im L. is 25 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer make her crops more productive.

loans.name: Yawa Irène

texts.fr:
Né le 28 juin 1973 à Akata dans la préfecture de Kloto, située au centre du Togo, madame A. Yawa Irène est célibataire et mère de trois (3) enfants. Elle est une revendeuse des céréales dans son quartier. Pour conserver les céréales, elle les met dans les bidons jaunes qui sont normalement utilisés pour l'huile de palme. Avec sept ans d’expérience dans ce commerce, elle a beaucoup de clients et elle maitrise bien son travail.
Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 12 sacs de haricot et 10 sacs de maïs afin de reconstituer son stock et de pouvoir bien vendre pour gagner d’argent et soutenir ses enfants.
texts.en:
Born on June 28, 1973 in Akata in Kloto Prefecture, located in the middle of Togo, Ms. Yawa Irène A. is unmarried and the mother of three. She is a retailer of grains in her district. For safe-keeping, she puts the grain into yellow drums that are normally used for palm oil. With seven years of experience in this field of commerce, she has many customers and has a good command of her work. She is requesting this initial loan to buy 12 sacks of beans and 10 sacks of corn to replenish her stock and to do well in her sales. She can then earn money and care for her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grain

loans.name: Abidé

texts.fr:
Madame H. Abidé est né le 13 juin 1978 à Kadja dans la préfecture de la Kozah au Togo. Elle réside actuellement à Agoè et est marié à Monsieur EDAH-METO Dodji avec qui il a un enfant. H. Abidé exerce dans la vente de boissons depuis 2004. Elle vend ses boissons à la maison  et au marché local d’Assiyéyé. Elle a déjà obtenu un prêt de 400000F à WAGES qu’elle a remboursé sans difficultés. 
Ce deuxième crédit de 500000F lui permettra d’agrandir son commerce surtout en ces périodes de fête de fins d’année par l’acquisition de soixante cinq casiers (65) de bière, trente sept (37) casiers de sucrerie.
texts.en:
Ms. Abidé H. was born on June 14, 1978 in Kadja (Kozah Prefecture, Togo). She currently resides in Agoè and is marred to Mr. Dodji EDAH-METO, with whom she has a child. She has been selling beverages since 2004 out of her home and at the local marketplace of Assiyéyé. She has already obtained a loan of 400,000 francs from WAGES and repaid it without difficulty. This second loan, in the amount of 500,000 francs, will enable her to expand her commerce, especially for this year-end holiday season, through the purchase of 65 cases of beer and 37 cases of sweets.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages

loans.name: Mr. Vantha Meas Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-nine people who all live in Anlong Romeit Thbong village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan request, and they will use the loan they obtain in different purposes. 

Mr. VanT. M. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. He and his wife are farmers. It now is the time for harvesting; unfortunately, they do not have enough money to hire laborers to harvest the rice padD., so Mr. VanT. M. decided to ask for a loan to hire laborers for his purpose. He is 63 years old and the father of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factoR. while the other two are construction workers. The remaining three are attending the local school.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Six members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the veR. end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To hire laborers to harvest the rice paddy.

loans.name: Améza Mawussé

texts.fr:
Madame V. A. est née le 10 mars 1974 à Lomé. Elle vit dans le quartier d’Agoè Logogomé un quartier de lomé. Elle est divorcée de son mari Mr GUMEDZUE Kwaku Tovienyekpo qui est instituteur, ils ont deux (02) enfants. Madame V. A. a une boutique dans son quartier dans laquelle elle fait du commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, elle a démarré ce commerce depuis 1998.
Elle sollicite un crédit de 300000F pour pouvoir varier et agrandir son commerce avec dix (10) cartons de sardines, dix (10) cartons de riz GINO et six (06) cartons de savons.
texts.en:
Ms. V.-A., born on March 10, 1974 in Lomé, lives in the Agoè Logogomé district there. She is divorced from her husband Mr. Kwaku Tovienyekpo GUMEDZUE, a school teacher. They have two children. Since 1998, Ms. V.-A. has had a shop in the district where she does commerce in groceries. She is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to diversify and expand her commerce with 10 boxes of sardines, 10 boxes of GINO rice, and 6 boxes of soap.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Sékina

texts.fr:
Né le 01 janvier 1973 à Sokodé qui est une ville du Togo, madame O. A. Sékina est divorcé de son mari DASSAIDA yakoukou qui est coiffeur. Elle a actuellement deux (02) enfants à charge. Elle a pour activité génératrice de revenu la vente des récipients en plastiques qu’elle fait de façon ambulante dans le quartier Agoè Atsanvé. 
Elle voudrait agrandir son commerce pour pouvoir subvenir correctement et quotidiennement aux besoins de ses deux enfants. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de 100000F pour s’approvisionner avec vingt (20) bassins, vingt (20) sceaux, vingt quatre (24)  glacières et vingt quatre (24) gobelets.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sékina O. A. was born on January 1, 1973 in Sokodé a town in Togo. She is divorced from her husband Yakoukou DASSAIDA, a hairdresser. She is currently financially responsible for two (02) children. Her income producing business is the door to door sale of plastic containers that she does in the neighborhood of Agoè Atsanvé.

She would like to expand her business to be able to provide fully and daily for the needs of her two children. This is why she is requesting a loan of 100,000F to stock up on twenty (20) basins, twenty (20) buckets, twenty four (24) iceboxes, and twenty four (24) tumblers.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of plastic containers

loans.name: Eyavi Akpévi

texts.fr:
Madame  A. Eyavi est né le 28 août 1958 à tsévié (Togo). Elle habite le quartier d’Agoè et est  une revendeuse de tissus pagnes, elle divorcé de son mari Mr ADABRA joseph qui est un actuellement à la retraite. Ils ont eu ensemble quatre (04) enfants.
Madame ADABRA exerce son commerce au marché d’Agoè Assiyéyé. Elle demande un prêt  de 350000F pour agrandir son commerce de pagnes surtout en ces périodes de fêtes ou la demande est très élevée. Avec ce premier crédit elle voudrait acheter quatre vingt (80) pagnes BELLE DAME et vingt sept pagnes velours et le bénéfice tiré de ce commerce lui permettra d’assumer les charges familiaux.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eyavi Akpévi A. was born on August 28, 1958 in Tsévié (Togo). She lives in the Agoè neighborhood and sells "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth). She is divorced from her husband, Mr. Joseph Adabra who is presently retired. They have 4 children together.

Mrs. A. does her selling at the market in Agoè Assiyéyé. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 350,000 F to expand her "pagne" business, especially during this period of end-of-year festivities where demand is very high. With this first loan, she would like to buy 80 lengths of "pagne" of the Belle Dame brand and 27 "pagnes" in velveteen. The profit she makes from her business allows her to support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes" for re-sale

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Madame  M. Abla est née le 31 décembre 1957 à Vogan dans la préfecture de Vo au Togo. Elle a cinq (05) enfants et est divorcée de son mari GAVELO daniel. Elle fait le commerce de céréales et d’autres produits d’alimentation dans le quartier Agoè Fopadesc  et s’approvisionne à Anié et Adjengré. 
Elle sollicite un crédit de 400000F avec lequel elle projette acheter dix (10) sacs de maïs, quatre (04) sacs d’haricot et divers produits d’alimentation. Ce qui lui permettra  de pouvoir vivre convenablement avec sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Abla M. was born on December 31, 1957 in Vogan in the Vo prefecture in Togo. She has 5 children and is divorced from her husband, Daniel Gavelo. She sells cereals and other foodstuffs in the Agoè Fopadesc neighborhood and does her buying in Anié and Adjengré.

She is requesting a loan of 400,000F with which she plans to buy 10 sacks of maize (corn), 4 sacks of dried beans, and various other foodstuffs. This will allow her and her family an appropriate lifestyle.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of maize, dried beans, and other foodstuffs

loans.name: Hamdamov

texts.ru:
Машариф Хамдамов 1945 года рождения,  живет он  среди гор  Уткансоя в одном из кишлаков (деревня) сельского поселения. У него 8 детей. 2 сына уехали на заработки в Россию, но их жены остались. Машарифу приходиться обеспечивать свою семью и жен своих сыновей. Хотя сыновья присылают деньги на житье. Основная деятельность в  их кишлаке это фермерство где работает Машариф, но в конце осени он остается безработным.  Для этого в каждой семье, в том числе и Машариф  дома держит  скот, так как скот дает,  и пищу и тепло. Он держит коров которое дает молоко, а также делают др. молочные изделия, много коз и овец , которые дают шерсть. 
Зимой, когда скот дешевый он покупает коз или овец, но в этот раз  ему не хватило своего капитала для увеличения поголовья скота. Его родственники посоветовали обратиться в Микроинвест, так как сами имели опыт работы с кредитами.
Сейчас Машариф   получив необходимую сумму, на очередном  рынке приобрел овец и коз. Через 3-4 месяца молодняк подрастет и можно продать  дороже, погасить кредит и на остатки  купить другой скот.
texts.en:
Hamdamov M. was born in 1945 and lives in the Utanskoya mountains in a rural kishlak (village). He has eight children. Two of his sons have gone to work in Russia, but their wives remain. M. provides for his family and his daughters-in-law, even though his sons send money to live off of. The primary occupation in the village is farming. M. works in farming as well, but at the end of autumn, he is unemployed. Because of this, every family, including M.’s, raises livestock, since livestock provide both food and warmth. He keeps cows for milk and other dairy products, and he has a lot of goats and sheep who give wool. In the winter when livestock is cheap, he buys goats or sheep. However, this time he did not have enough money to increase his herds. His relatives advised him to go to MicroInvest, since they themselves had taken out loans in the past. Now, having received the necessary funds, M. will get sheep and goats at the next market. In three to four months, the lambs and kids will grow up, and he will be able to sell them for a profit in order to pay off the loan and buy more livestock.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is about 40 years old. She has got five children: two sons and three daughters, and her house is located in Nasaji Bagrami. During the war, her house collapsed and she could not repair it well, so she needs an individual loan of 30000 Afs to repair her house and buy construction materials. She is very pleased with this small loans procedure which supports her a lot.

loans.use: buying construction materials to repair her war-damaged house

loans.name: Meheza

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle N’GASSIBOU Meheza est né le 01 novembre 2008  à Lomé (Togo), elle réside à Avédji. Elle est célibataire mais elle a un enfant à sa charge, elle a une boutique "EVER GOOD FASHION" de vente de  vêtements, sacs et chaussures à Totsi. Elle exerce ce commerce depuis 2007.
Elle voudrait un crédit de 500000F avec lequel elle souhaitera s’approvisionner en vêtements (achat de quarante cinq tenues)
texts.en:
Ms. Meheza N’GASSIBOU was born on November 1, 2008 in Lomé (Togo) and resides in Avédji. She is unmarried but has a child in her care. The shop she has "EVER GOOD FASHION" sells clothing, bags, and shoes in Totsi. She has been in this business since 2007. She would like a loan of 500,000 francs CFA that she would like to use to get supplies of clothing (45 outfits).

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Mansur

texts.ru: Олимов Мансур 1959 г р., вдовец имеет троих детей, с ним живет младший сын. Зарабатывает Мансур, делая слепки зубов по заказу стоматологов, у него есть бормашина, которую он содержит  у своего знакомого стоматолога. Также он большой мастер ремонтных работ. Но основная его деятельность разведение крупно рогатого скота. Разведение  скота он начал в молодости. В своем коровнике  он содержит три бычка. Всё прошлое  лето он содержал 6 бычков, дочь приходила и ухаживала за скотом, так как она жила не далеко и помогала отцу. После откорма он продал 6 быков и купил на проданные деньги машину для сына. В конце осени скот подешевел поэтому,  обратившись в Микроинвест,  он планирует купить еще пару бычков, что бы откормить и продать во время сезона по хорошей цене.
texts.en:
Mansur O. was born in 1959, is a widower, and has three children. His youngest son lives with him. Mansur makes a living making dental molds for dentists. He has a drill which he keeps with a dentist he knows. He is also a master at doing repair work. However, his primary occupation is keeping cattle. He began raising cattle in his youth. His corral has three calves. All last summer it had six calves. His daughter, who does not live far away, came and looked after the calves to help her father. After fattening them, he sold the six bulls and used the money to buy a car for his son. At the end of autumn, the price for cattle has fallen. Therefore, he approached MicroInvest in order to buy another pair of calves to fatten and sell in season for a profit.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Fizétou

texts.fr:
Madame A. Fizétou est née en 1962 et réside dans le quartier d’Agoè dénakpoè situé dans la ville de Lomé (Togo), elle a trois (03) enfants et est divorcé de son mari Mr OURO BOUTCHO Tagba, officier de police. Elle fait le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2004 dans son quartier où elle a ouvert une boutique et s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Avec ce premier crédit de 450000F qu’elle sollicite, elle complètera son stock de marchandises avec dix (10) sacs de riz, dix (10) sacs d’huile, six (6) cartons de tomates et sept cartons de spaghettis. 
L’expansion de son commerce lui permettra de couvrir les charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Fizétou A., born in 1962, resides in the Agoè Dénakpoè disrict, located in the city of Lomé (Togo). She has three children and is divorced from her husband Mr. Tagba OURO BOUTCHO, a police officer. She has been trading in grocery items since 2004 in the district where she opened a shop. Her supplies come out of Lomé. With this initial loan of 450,000 francs CFA she is requesting, she will round out her inventory of merchandise with 10 sacks of rice, 10 containers of oil, 6 boxes of tomatoes, and 7 boxes of spaghetti. The expansion of her commerce will enable her to cover her family's expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Pak

texts.en: Mrs. Pak H. is a farmer who lives in Svay Mean Leak Village in Kandal Province. Her husband, Mr. Mok Seng, helps her in farming. They have two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school. Since their child’s workplace is far from the house, that child must spend a lot of money on transportation. Thus, Mrs. Pak H. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her child. She hopes to save the income through this solution. Her husband is shown on the left of photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her child.

loans.name: Ablawa Ikubinin

texts.fr:
Madame W. Ablawa est née le  09 décembre 2008 à Bassar, une ville au nord du Togo ; elle réside à Agoè et est divorcé de son mari qui est militaire et ont eu trois (03) enfants qu’elle a à charge. Elle pratique le commerce en gros et détail des produits d’alimentation générale, elle vend une partie de son stock à la maison.
Madame W. demande un crédit de 300000F dont elle voudrait se servir pour acquérir cinq (5) sacs de riz,  dix (10) cartons de spaghetti, cinq (5) bidons d’huile et neuf (9) cartons de tomates.
texts.en:
Ms. Ablawa W., born on December 9, 2008 in Bassar, a city north of Togo. She resides in Agoè and is divorced from her husband, a soldier, and they had three children. She does commerce in grocery items at the wholesale and retail levels. A portion of her stock is sold out of her house. She is asking for a loan of 300,000 francs for acquiring 5 sacks of rice, 10 boxes of spaghetti, 5 drums of oil, and 9 boxes of tomatoes.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in grocery items

loans.name: Yawavi

texts.fr:
Madame A. Yawavi est né le 24 octobre 1963 à Nuedjè dans la préfecture de Notsè au togo. Elle est veuve et a quatre (04) enfants à sa charge, réside dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Madame A. Yawavi est une tresseuse et tient son salon "LA GLOIRE DE DIEU" depuis 1988 dans le quartier d’Adawlato, elle fait aussi le commerce de mèches et de tissages qu’elle achète en gros et revend en détail.
La demande grandissante  surtout en ces périodes de fêtes de fin d’année, elle demande ce crédit de 500000F pour acheter deux (02) cartons de mèches et deux (02) cartons de tissages. Le profit issu de l’agrandissement de son commerce contribuera à assurer les dépenses pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Yawavi A., born on October 24, 1963 in Nuedjè in Notsè Prefecture, Togo. She is a widow and has four children to look after. She braids hair for a living and has had her own salon "LA GLOIRE DE DIEU" since 1988 in the Adawlato district. She also does commerce in hair extensions and weaves that she buys wholesale and resells retail. With the growing demand, especially during this year-end holiday season, she is asking for a loan of 500,000 francs to buy 2 boxes of hair extensions and 2 boxes of weaves. The profit derived from the expansion of her commerce will help to ensure that her children's expenses are covered.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and weaves

loans.name: Mr.than Thol's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank which consists of 32 people is located in Sambuor Village in Kandal Province. Mr.Than T. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. He and his wife, Mrs. Thoch Vanna, are farmers who own a half-hectare section to cultivate rice to earn for living.
