In their plantation, they face a small problem because their field is infertile, so Mr.Than T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to make the crops more productive.

Mr.Than T. is 54 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is working in a printing shop while the youngest one is attending the local school. All the members in this village bank are shown in the picture but some are not easy to see because they are blocked. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Twenty-three members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to make the crops more productive.

loans.name: Naqibullah

texts.en: Naqibullah, a hard-working young man is 20 years old and lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is always busy with the work on the land, doing cultivation to support a family of 7 members. He has worked since 2006 on this land, so he has got all the responsibility for his family. He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afs to buy some needed tools specific to agriculture and seeds so as to have more profit and a good monthly income.

loans.use: buying tools and seeds for the land

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr:
Madame MAMADOU Aissatou est né le 31décembre 1973 à Lomé (Togo), elle réside à Agoè et est divorcé de son mari KOUMEYI Montade qui exerce le travail de  secrétaire. Elle a trois (03) enfants et vend des produits de beauté. Sa clientèle est à majorité féminine.
Elle sollicite un premier crédit  d’un montant de 300000F pour pouvoir rentabiliser son commerce surtout en ces  périodes de fête. Avec ce crédit elle voudrait acheter dix boîtes (10) de capital detanghing, trente boîtes (30) maxi light, 50 boîtes de Talc, cent (100) boîtes vit fée et soixante (62) parfums.
texts.en:
Ms. Aissatou MAMADOU, born on December 31, 1973 in Lomé (Togo), resides in Agoè and is divorced from her husband Montade KOUMEYI, who does secretarial work. She has three children and sells beauty products. Most of her customers are women. She is requesting an initial loan in the amount of 300,000 francs to make her business profitable, particularly for this year-end holiday season. With this loan, she would like to buy 10 boxes of Tung Hing products, 20 boxes of Maxi Light, 50 of Talc, 100 of Vit Fée, and 60 of perfumes.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Taye

texts.en: Taye O. sells children's clothes and shoes. She is 30 years old and married with 3 children. She sells her goods in the streets in Benin City, and she sees this method as the best way of getting more customers. She is happy because her sales will increase during the festive season. She needs this loan to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell. She says thank you to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more  clothes and shoes  to sell

loans.name: Hamayom

texts.en: Hamayon lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is a thirty-year-old man and is married with two sons. He is an engineer and supports his family as well. He needs an individual loan of 50000 Afs to repair his house because in winter they will have trouble being in that house, so by receiving the loan he would be able to repair the house so that his family will live in a comfortable way there. He is happy about having the opportunity to repair his house, thanks to this process of small loans.

loans.use: repairing his house

loans.name: Mrs. Pao Lach's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people who all live in Chrolong village in Kampong Chhnang Province formed a village bank loan request, and they will use the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Pao L. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She owns a small lake where she grows lotus, and she also sells it for an income. Her husband, Mr. Pum Pon, is a construction worker who can make a small income to support the family. Although they have different businesses, they still cannot afford better conditions for the household. Thus, Mrs. Pao L. decided to ask for a loan to buy equipment to build their house. She is 35 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

All the members in this village bank loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy equipment to build the house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy "pagnes" and pans

loans.name: Mrs. Thy Phorn's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of ten people who are located in Chrolong village in Kampong Chhnang Province. 

Mrs. Thy P. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice on a half a hectare. Aside from this plantation, She is a pig breeder who raises only one pig. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy one more piglet for her business. Her husband, Mr. Nun Nin, is a fisherman who can gather some fish to support the household. Mrs. Thy P. is 31 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

All the members in this village bank loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy one more piglet for her business.

loans.name: Nasir Ahmad

texts.en: Nasir Ahmad lives in Kamari, Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 35 years old with four children, two of whom are students and two are still small. He the owner of plot of agricultural land and is very hard-working. He has got three years' experience in this field. He wants to take an individual loan of 50000 Afs to buy seeds and other materials to expand his business and to have more profit because he is devoted to agriculture and earns money through it.

loans.use: buying seeds and materials for his farm

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther O. is 50 years old and married with 3 children. She sells drinks to both wholesale and retail customers. She is happy because the festive season will increase the sales of her drinks. She hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She is requesting this loan to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael A. is 36 years old and married with 4 children. She has a hair salon, and she also sells baby items like clothes, flasks, cream, etc. She is requesting this loan to purchase more baby items to sell. She says thanks.

loans.use: To purchase more baby items to sell

loans.name: Tho

texts.en: Mrs. Tho M. is a villager in Doun Taur village in Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband, Mr. Met Sao, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, they face a small problem because their field is infertile, so Mrs. Tho M. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to make her crops more productive. She is 56 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another one is a construction worker and the other is enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to make her crops more productive.

loans.name: Pho

texts.en: Mr. Pho C. is a villager in Dam Nak Ampil village in Kampong Cham Province. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. His wife, Mr. Eng Phat, is a duck breeder. Since her duck business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mr. Pho C. decided to request a loan to buy more ducklings and duck food for her breeding ducks business. He is 48 years old and the father of six children, three of whom are employed in different positions, while the remaining three are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more ducklings and duck food for the breeding ducks business.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy I. is 28 years old and married with one child. She owns a salon where she sells drinks and salon materials such as weave-ons and hair extensions. She is happy because the festive season will increase her customers. She is requesting this loan to purchase more salon materials and drinks to sell. She says thanks to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more salon materials and drinks to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys E. is 46 years old and married with 7 children. Her husband is a police officer. She travels to Warri to purchase crayfish and other fish to sell in Benin City. She is requesting this loan to purchase more crayfish and fish to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more crayfish and other fish to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys L. fries bean cakes, popularly known as akara in Nigeria. She is requesting this loan to purchase more groundnut oil, beans, and pepper to fry more bean cakes to sell to her numerous customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for frying bean cakes to sell

loans.name: Ifeanyi

texts.en: Ifeanyi A. is 30 years old and married with 3 children. She sells foodstuffs like tomatoes, eggs, beans, rice, garri, pepper, yams, salt, and plantain. She hopes to expand her foodstuffs business. She is requesting this loan to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth E. is 43 years old and married with 5 children. She sells provisions and drinks in her shop. She hopes to increase her stock so she can make more profit to support her family. She is requesting this loan to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Oghogho

texts.en: Oghogho O. is a 53-year-old widow with 3 children, who are all university students. She sells foodstuffs and firewood in her community. She is requesting this loan to purchase more firewood and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and firewood to sell

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en: Shavkat B. is a 46 year-old married man who lives with his three children and owns a small farm. He lives and works in the small village of Khujand. Shavkat and has been selling sheep for fifteen years. Since sheep selling is a profitable business, Shavkat has become a very successful businessman in a very short period of time. The income has been enough to cover family needs, but as his children grow, covering family needs has become harder, so Shavkat is applying for a loan to expand his activities and to purchase more sheep.

loans.use: Purchasing sheep in order to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen O. is a widow with 4 children. She has sole responsibility for taking care of her children. She sells cosmetics such as body cream, lipstick, toothpaste, and hair cream. She needs this loan to purchase more cosmetics to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Samad

texts.en:
Samad owns a kiosk at a railway market in Simferopol. He sells children's toys. He chose this business because he loves children and wants them to be a bit happier. Samad has been in this business for 4 years. Today his monthly gross income is 18,000 UAH; his net profit is about 2,000 UAH. His kiosk with toys is the only one at this particular market. That is one of the reasons why his business is quite successful.

Samad would like to get a loan of 5,000 UAH to purchase more inventory. He and his wife (who is also an entrepreneur) hope to generate enough income to be able to fix up their apartment and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for his toy shop

loans.name: Irshad M. Mushtaq Group

texts.en:
Irshad baji is 52 year old woman and resides in Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 35 years. Her husband, M. M., works in a Government office. Irshad baji is the mother of five children: four sons and one daughter. Irshad baji has been sewing clothes for the past 15 years. She has successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and is now applying for a loan to buy more paints to expand her son’s paint selling business.

She is a group leader of a few more members in her locality. Razia begum baji is requesting a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business. Shazia amen baji is requesting a loan to buy clothes for her clothing business. Shahnaz baji is requesting a loan to buy paint brushes for resale. Niamat baji is requesting a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for repayment of the entire loan.

loans.use: To buy paints for her son's paint shop

loans.name: Maksuda

texts.en: B. Maksuda is 49 years old and a self-sacrificing mother who, since the tragic loss of her husband, had to be both mother and father to her 3 children who thanks to the education that she granted them are now in high school. She has dedicated herself to agricultural labor, which failed due to tough weather conditions. Now she is initiating a new project raising cattle and has hopes of being able to economically recuperate. This way she will be able to finish remodeling her home in order to give her family better security and prevent thieves infiltrating her home. The amount she is soliciting is 2500 Somoni ($ 750 USD) to purchase cattle that will help her to increase her earnings, which would be directed to the education of her kids and the construction of her home. Collaborate with this mother so that she can reach her highest yearnings with satisfaction.

loans.use: Purchasing the small cattle in order to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Favour

texts.en: Favour G. is single. She sells drinks and pepper soup in her shop. Since the festive season is approaching, she hopes to increase her business. She is requesting this loan to purchase more drinks to sell to her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Doniyor

texts.en: K. Doniyor is 49 years old and is married and with 3 children. Twenty years ago, he started his business of raising cattle. His primary business is with the local restaurants. Also during harvest season, Doniyor works an job as a farmer to help with the harvest. Despite having two jobs, his business is still quite small, and doesn't generate enough income for the whole family. Doniyor would like to request a loan to expand his business. He will use the profit generated by the business to repay the loan on time. K. Doniyor is asking for a loan of $ 750 in order to buy more calves to raise. K. Doniyor thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: Purchasing the small cattle in order to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en: Nasiba lives in Tajikistan, Khujand. Her husband works far away from home. They have two children, both of whom currently attend school. Her husband’s income does not provide enough money to cover their children’s education, so Nasiba is looking for alternatives. She is currently caring for 2 cows and 5 sheep. Nasiba is currently requesting a loan of $750 to purchase more calves, and hopes to expand her business in order to continue to support her family and her children’s education.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle to expand her business

loans.name: Naseem M. Latif Group

texts.en:
Naseem baji is a 51 year old woman that resides in Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 30 years. Her husband, M. L., runs a grocery shop in the community. She is the mother of seven children: four sons and three daughters. Naseem baji buys quilts from a famous city named Multan and resells them to different shops in Lahore. She has 20 years of experience in this business and works to meet the financial expenses of her household. She has successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is now applying for a loan to buy more quilts in order to expand the business.

She is a group leader of a few more women in her locality. Mahmooda baji is requesting a loan to buy chips for resale. Khalida parveen baji is requesting a loan to buy materials (clothes, colored thread and sketches) to embroider clothing for display in her boutique. Razia baji is requesting a loan to buy scissors and tools for her barber salon. Munawar baji is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics for her parlor.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each others loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for the repayment of the entire loan.

loans.use: To buy more quilts for resale

loans.name: Akmalkhoja

texts.en: As a boy, S. Akmalkhoja learned from his parents that a business, if properly managed, can give you a  good living. He has been renting a store where he sells sim-cards from the mobile company “Babilon-mobile”. He also works part time in construction. Between the store, the construction work, and his homework, Akmalkhoja works very hard to get ahead. At this time, he would like to buy more sim-cards and cards for the replenishment of the balance amount and be able to better serve his customers. He is asking for a loan of $600 which he promises to repay within 9 months. With your help, S. Akmalkhoja can finish his studies and find success.

loans.use: Purchasing of the sim-cards and cards for replenishment of the balance amount

loans.name: Oipuba

texts.en: T. Oipuba is 44 years old and is married with three children. Since she has lived with her husband, she has bought and sold cattle. She currently has two cows and two calves. Now Oipuba wants to expand her business and as her children are grown up she thinks that she will be able to sell more cattle with their help. She is requesting 750 dollars for the term of 12 months in order to purchase cattle. Oipuba expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchasing the small cattle in order to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Zarofat

texts.en: S. Zarofat is a very hardworking woman and knows that each day she has to give her best effort and all her courage. She is married and has five children. She works raising animals and feeding them with the goal of selling them later. She enjoys the feeling of owning her own business and contributing a significant amount to the family income. She makes sure not to neglect her role as a mother, because she’s very dedicated to lovingly raising her adorable little son. She wants to improve her stable stalls and produce milk in a quantity sufficient for selling it commercially. It is for this reason that she’s requesting a loan of 1300 Somoni ($400) for the term of 12 months to buy small cattle. Please support this woman who is determined to change the course of her life with dedication and hard work.

loans.use: To purchase additional cattle to expand her current business

loans.name: Zhanna

texts.en:
Zhanna is married and has one child. She owns a retail business and sells underwear at the central market as well as at two other places. One of them is a department store in the city, another is a seasonal (summer) place at a small resort town in the area. Her gross monthly income is 40,000 UAH, and she has 80,000 UAH invested in the goods at all three places.

Zhanna has great experience in sales: 10 years. She is very entrepreneurial and always looks for new opportunities. Zhanna would like to get a loan of 3,000 UAH to purchase 100 sets of women's underwear. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 100 sets of wonem's underwear for re-sale

loans.name: Anait

texts.en:
Anait is married and has two grown-up sons. She sells vegetables and fruits at the central market. She has been in this business for 2 years only. She is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial person. She started selling her own produce. Then as the business grew she began to purchase the produce in bulk and re-sell it at the market.

Today her gross monthly income is 5,000 UAH. Anait would like to receive a loan of 5,000 UAH to purchase bananas, oranges, apples, and other fruits. She hopes to increase her profits in order to buy a kiosk at the market. This would significantly improve her business conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell for Christmas and New Year

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha tiene 48 años, está divorciada y vive sola en un cuarto que alquila. Es una mujer independiente que a pesar de todos los problemas, ha sabido salir adelante, trabaja en la venta de cosméticos durante 10 años, y le ha sido favorable, ya que le ha brindado las posibilidades de vivir cómodamente. A Bertha le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que le permite convencer a las personas de adquirir sus productos y así ha ganado muchas amigas, las cuales ahora solo le compran a ella. Lo más difícil es el cansancio que se siente al caminar a las casas de las clientas para entregar los productos, pero ella es muy empeñosa y piensa seguir trabajando en busca de un mejor porvenir. Bertha se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con este dinero solicitara más productos de belleza para vender en esta época de Navidad.
texts.en:
Bertha is 48, is divorced and lives alone in a room that she rents. She is an independent woman who despite all of her problems, has learned to move forward. She has worked in cosmetic sales for 10 years and this has been favorable for her, now that she has realized the possibility of living comfortably. Bertha likes her job a lot, because it allows her to convince people to acquire her products, and like this she has gained a lot of friends, who now only buy from her. The hardest part is the exhaustion she feels walking to the houses of her clients to show the products but she is very determined and she thinks of continuing to work in search of a better living. Bertha finds herself in her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With this money she will get more beauty products to sell this Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her products to sell for the Christmas season

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos tiene 21 años, es soltero, vive de forma independiente alquilado en un cuarto. Se dedica a la venta de frazadas en su pequeño puesto ubicado en la ciudad de Juliaca, el incursionó en este negocio hace 4 años, sabiendo que por estos lares el frío es inclemente y que las personas demandan de estos cobertores. Carlos aprendió a querer su trabajo, al ver las satisfacciones que le brinda, aunque no todo es color de rosa, ya que se ve obligado a viajar para adquirir sus productos a la ciudad de Desaguadero que queda a 3 horas y media aproximadamente de su ciudad natal, Juliaca, que es en donde vende estas frazadas. Se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de frazadas para vender en estas épocas.
texts.en:
Carlos is 21-years old and is single. He lives independently in a rented room. He has dedicated himself to the sales of small blankets in his small post in the city of Juliaca. He has been in business for the past 4-years, and knows what is needed in cold temperatures as people are demanding these blankets.

Carlos learned to love his job, seeing the satisfaction it offers, but not everything is so rosy as he’s obligated to travel to purchase products from the city of Desaguadero, which is approximately 3.5 hours from his hometown, Juliaca. It is in Juliaca where he sells his blankets. This is his second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and with these funds he will purchase a larger stock of blankets to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a supply of blankets to sell

loans.name: Eddison

texts.es: Eddison tiene 21 años, vive solo, ya que aún es soltero. Se dedica al servicio de llamadas por celular, de forma ambulatoria, para ganarse la vida. El incursionó en este negocio hace dos años, para ya no depender de su familia y por fin independizarse, lo cual logró gracias a su trabajo, le gusta mucho trabajar y sabe que el trabajo dignifica al hombre, sintiéndose muy feliz y útil. El negocio está marchando bien y Eddison quiere que siga creciendo, pero sabe que aún le falta un largo camino por recorrer y mucho trabajo por realizar. Se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado quiere comprar otros equipos celulares para ponerlos a trabajar.
texts.en:
Eddison is 21 years old and lives on his own as he is still single. He offers cellular phone services as a street vendor for a living. He started this business two years ago so that he would not have to depend on his family. He finally became independent with this job. He really likes to work and knows that work dignifies mankind, so he feels happy and useful. Eddison’s business is going well, and he wants it to keep growing, but he knows that he must go a long way and work hard. This is his second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and he has been punctual with his payments. With the money that he is requesting, he would like to purchase more cellular phones.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cellular phones

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 25 años, es madre soltera de una pequeña de un año llamada Yadira. Se dedica a la atención de su tienda de abarrotes, en la ciudad de Puno, ella se ocupa íntegramente a su negocio, ya que le permite mantener a su pequeña que está empezando a crecer y por ende a solicitar más gastos. La venta es muy buena en al tienda de Elizabeth, ya que siempre tiene una sonrisa y una buena atención a las personas que frecuentan su negocio, lo difícil de su trabajo es tener que cumplir con el rol de madre y de trabajadora a la vez, ya que su pequeña requiere de muchos cuidados. Elizabethse encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero que solicita va a comprar más productos para la implementación de su tienda y así lograr mejores ingresos, para el bienestar de su hija.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 25 years old and a single mother to a young one-year old daughter named Yadira. She dedicates herself to tending to her general store, located in the city of Puno. She is integrally involved in her business, as it helps her to support her daughter who is growing and therefore requires additional funds. Sales are good at Elizabeth’s store as she always has a smile on her face and takes good care of the people who frequent her establishment. What is difficult for her is single-handedly fulfilling both the role of mother and primary bread-winner, since her daughter requires a lot of attention. Elizabeth finds herself in her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the funds she is requesting, she will buy more products to supply her store with so she can increase her income for the benefit of her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her store.

loans.name: Franklin

texts.es: Franklin tiene 29 años, es natural de la ciudad de Ayacucho, vive en Puno hace 5 años, convive con su pareja, la cual es enfermera. El es un joven muy trabajador que migró desde la alejada ciudad de Ayacucho en busca en un mejor porvenir, es así que desde hace 8 meses, gracias al arduo trabajo en otros oficios, logró ahorrar un dinerito para poner su stand de venta de celulares. El negocio va viento en popa, ya que cada vez se hace más conocido, obteniendo mayor clientela, además que el buen trato que Franklin da a sus clientes logra que el negocio crezca más y más. Se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de celulares para aumentar sus ingresos y así tener un futuro prospero, para estabilizar a su familia.
texts.en:
Franklin is 29 years old and is originally from the city of Ayacucho. He has lived in Puno for five years now, along with his partner who is a nurse. He is a hard-working young man, who migrated from the distant city of Ayacucho in search of better work prospects. For eight months now, thanks to hard work in other areas, he managed to save enough money to open a cell phone sales stand. The business is going well as he becomes more well-known and expands his customer base. Also, because he provides such care and good customer service, his enterprise is growing more and more. He finds himself in his first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the funds requested, he will purchase additional cell phones to increase his income and have a better future and stability for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of cell phones that he sells.

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday O. is 36 years old and married. He owns a shop where he sells provisions and repairs radios and televisions. He lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. 

He is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard Uwunwmose makes furniture like chairs, cupboards and shelves. He has lots of customers who buy his furniture. He hopes to meet the desires of his customers during and after the festive season. 

He is 46 years old and married with six children. His wife sells yams. He is requesting a loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more furniture materials to make more furniture to sell. He says thanks to Kiva and all the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more furniture materials to make more furniture to sell

loans.name: Maria Leonor

texts.es: Leonor B., tiene una venta de tortillas, ella también vende cómales para caber tortillas, y los vende en diferentes lugares, también se dedica a la venta ropa típica  de mujer.  En la venta de tortillas ya tiene 20 años, antes era de su mama quien tenia ese negocio y se lo dejo a ella.  En la venta de cómales tiene 10 años.  Leonor se siente satisfecha porque en el transcurso de su negocio Dios la ha Bendecido grandemente, y ha podido ir mejorando las condiciones en las que vive, tiene dos hijos una tiene 22 años que trabaja con ella en la venta de tortillas, y el otro es mas pequeño y esta estudiando.  Con este préstamo ella quiere comprar mas materiales por mayor y  maíz por quintales, ya que le sale mas barato y puede tener de esta forma mejores ganancias, también quiere comprar cómales por docena que los tiene encargados. Leonor sueña con comprar un vehiculo, ya que el que tenía se le descompuso, y pagar los transportes de materiales le sale demasiado caro porque viaja lejos.
texts.en:
Leonor B. works selling tortillas, and she also sells cómales (ceramic dish for cooking tortillas), which she sells in different locations. She also dedicates herself to selling traditional women’s clothing. She has been selling tortillas for twenty years, having learned from her mother who left her the business. She has been selling the cómales for 10 years. Leonor is happy because God has blessed her greatly, and she has been able to continue to improve her standard of living. She has two children, a 22-year old who helps her with the tortilla business, and a younger child who is still in school. With this loan she would like to buy more materials at wholesale and corn in bulk, as this would be more cost-effective and would allow her to increase her profits. She would also like to purchase cómales that she has on order by the dozen. Leonor dreams of buying a vehicle, as the one she had broke down, since buying her supplies is expensive because she must travel far for them.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for her tortilla-making business, and comales (ceramic dish for cooking tortillas) to sell.

loans.name: Djidéré

texts.fr: Djidéré D., 54 ans, mariée, 07 enfants et 04 petits fils en charge est membre du banc villageois de Vélingara  Maréwé depuis 2 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter des légumes, de l’huile de palme et des produits alimentaires divers pour renforcer son commerce. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Djidéré D., age 54, is married and has seven children and four grandchildren to look after. She has been a member of the village loan group Vélingara Maréwé for two and a half years. She wants to buy vegetables, palm oil, and various grocery items to bolster her business. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in vegetables, palm oil, grocery items

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en:
Beauty O. is 50 years old and married with eight children. She sells cooked foods like beans, plantains, etc. She also sells drinks. The demands for her cooked foods are high. She desires to expand her business.

Beauty is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin A. is 50 years old and married with four children. His wife is a tailor. He sells tailoring materials such as thread, zippers, etc. 

He plans to increase his tailoring materials to meet his customers' demands. He is requesting a loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Maria Faustina

texts.es: Faustina Díaz tiene un negocio de venta de ropa típica, la y crianza y venta de marranos, pollos y chompipes (pavos) los cuales vende un poco de cada cosa.  Ella tiene cuatro hijos y tres están estudiando, la mayor ya trabaja y le ayuda económicamente.  Ella ha salido adelante sola porque su esposo tiene el vicio del alcohol y es muy irresponsable, ella no cuenta con el apoyo de el.  La mayor responsabilidad la tiene Faustina es el sostén de su casa, ella sale fuera de su casa para poder vender sus productos.  Ahora necesita el préstamo para poder comprar mas mercadería, lo que se refiere a  ropa y comprar algunos marranos que en esta época de fin de año se vende más y a mejor precio. Faustina desea poder vender agrandar su negocio, y así poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos y que sigan estudiando ya que ella lamentablemente no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar.
texts.en:
Faustina D. has a business selling typical clothes, and the raising and selling of pigs, chickens and turkeys of which she sells a few of each. She has four children and three are studying, the oldest is now working and helps her economically. She has moved forward alone because her husband has an alcohol problem and is very irresponsible, so she doesn't count on his support. The major responsibility that Faustina has is the maintenance of her house, she leaves the house to be able to sell her products. Now she needs a loan to be able to buy more merchandise, which refers to clothes and buy some pigs, which this time of year sell more and at a better price. Faustina hopes to be able to grow her business, and like that she can continue supporting her children and they can continue to study, since she unfortunately did not have the opportunity to study.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothes and pigs for her business

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es chofer interprovincial La Paz – Sataqui; también trabaja como productor de frutas y la esposa es la que comercializa los productos en la ciudad de El Alto. Estas dos actividades constituyen sus principales fuentes de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de su hijo, tiene dos domicilios, en Sataqui (a tres horas y media de la Ciudad de La Paz, y en Senkata en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará a la reparación y mantenimiento de su herramienta de trabaja (vagoneta) para poder continuar trabajando como chofer.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada califica a Pedro para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Pedro is an interprovincial driver on the La Paz to Sataqui route; he also grows fruit which his wife sells in the city of El Alto. These two activities constitute the main sources of income to help cover the expenses for their son and to maintain their two small homes--one in Sataqui (three and a half hours from the city of La Paz) and another in Senkata in the city of El Alto. This loan will be used to repair and maintain his vehicle to be able to continue his work as a driver. This is Pedro's first loan from Impro and he was evaluated and approved to receive the loan that he requested.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance and repair of mini-bus for interprovincial transport

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia O. is a caterer. She built a small open shop with wood where she sells cooked foods like rice, beans, plantains, etc. 

She is 32 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a commercial driver. Her children are in primary school. 

She is requesting a loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es: Leonarda tiene 25 años, vive con su pareja y su pequeño bebé de pocos meses de nacido. Se dedica a la atención de su pequeña tienda de abarrotes desde hace 5 años. Leonarda es una mujer que ha pasado muchos inconvenientes en su vida y que ha sabido sobrellevarlos, haciéndola más fuerte, siempre ha trabajado, desde que terminó sus estudios secundarios, brindándole toda la atención a su negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder realizarlo desde casa y atender a su pequeño bebé al mismo tiempo, ella quiere seguir trabajando muy duro para poder brindarle un futuro mejor a su familia, para lo cual necesita de nuestra ayuda. Leonarda se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitad comprará más cantidad de productos para implementar su tiendita.
texts.en:
Leonarda is 25 years old and lives with her husband and their small baby who is only months old. She has run a small grocery store for the past 5 years. Leonarda has passed through many trials in her life and has been able to overcome them, which has helped her to become stronger. She has worked since she finished high school, dedicating all her time to her small business. What she enjoys most about her work is her ability to run her business from her home where she can tend to her baby at the same time. She would like to continue working to offer a better future for her family which is why she is seeking help. This is the second loan she has requested from Microfinanzas Prisma and she has always been punctual with her payments. She will use the money to purchase more products to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the merchandise of her store

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es: Lizbeth tiene 26 años, es soltera y viven en casa con su madre. Se dedica desde hace 4 años a la venta de casacas de cuero, las cuales trae desde la ciudad de Desaguadero, que queda aproximadamente a 3 horas de Puno, lo cual se le hace difícil, ya que ella vende al por mayor y tiene que traer grandes cantidades. A Lizbeth le gusta su trabajo porque le da independencia y puede ayudar en los gastos a su mamá. La venta es muy buena, ya que vende cada casaca a un buen precio y la demanda de estas prendas van en aumento, es por eso que Lizbeth quiere aumentar su venta, comprando más casacas para vender en estas épocas navideñas. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, y está comprometida en pagar de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Lizbeth is 26 years old, single and lives with her mother. For the past four years, she has sold leather jackets which she brings from the city of Desaguadero, approximately three hours from Puno. This is very dififcult for her since she sells the jackets wholesale so she has to bring huge quantities. Lizbeth likes her job for the independence it provides her and because she can help her mother with household expenses. Sales are very good and she is able to sell each jacket at a good price. Demand for her goods is increasing which is why Lizbeth would like to increase her sales, buying more jackets that she can sell during the Christmas season. This is her first loan from Microfinanzas Prisma and she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the stock of jackets to sell

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda se dedica a la elaboración de masitas y las vende en las tiendas. También trabaja como empleada domestica y tiene una hija que le ayuda en su negocio.
Esta separada de su esposo por lo cual la actividad de masitas le ayuda de gran manera ya que cubren sus gastos familiares.
Vive en la zona de alto sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz, en la casa de sus padres.
Es la Octava vez que solicita un crédito, es cliente con categoria 1 debido a un excelente comportamiento en el cumplimiento de sus cuotas.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de insumos ( harina, manteca, levadura, y huevo) para su negocio de repostería.
texts.en:
Nilda works making pastries which she sells in local stores. She also works as a maid; she has a daugther who helps her in her work. She is separated from her husband which makes her job making pastries all the more important in order to cover her household expenses. She lives in La Paz in the Alto Sopocachi neighborhood in her parents' home. This is the eighth time she has requested a loan and she is a Category 1 customer due to her excellent record of on-time payments. The loan will be used to purchase ingredients for her pastries such as flour, shortening, yeast, and eggs.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour, shortening, yeast, and eggs for her pastry business

loans.name: Lola

texts.es: Lola tiene 41 años, vive sola, ya que es soltera. Se dedica desde hace 20 años a la venta de F., trabajaba anteriormente para otras personas, pero gracias a su arduo esfuerzo logró poner hace 10 años su propio negocio. A Lola le gusta mucho trabajar con las F., porque siempre le han gustado, ella sabe que tienen vida propia y que hay que cuidarlas, y gracias a ese cuidado es que mantiene a sus F. siempre lindas y frescas, logrando que la clientela la prefiera. Lola se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de F. para vender y así incrementar su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Lola is 41 years old, lives alone, and is single. For the past 20 years, she has worked selling flowers. She used to work for other people, but thanks to her hard work, ten years ago she was able to start her own business. She loves working with flowers as they are one of her passions. She knows that each flower has it's own life and she must take care of it. Thanks to the care she provides in maintaining her flowers, they always appear beautiful and fresh which is why customers prefer her flowers. This is Lola's second loan from Microfinanzas Prisma and she has always been very punctual with her payments. She will use the money to purchase a larger quantity of flowers to sell in order to grow her business and earn more income.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a larger quantity of flowers to sell

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith O. sells provisions and drinks. Her husband is an ambulance driver for a government hospital. She is 37 years old and has two children. 

She plans to increase her stock during and after the festive season. She is requesting a loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario tiene 30 años, es madre soltera, de Shijar de 12 años de edad. Desde hace 5 años y después de haber trabajado en varios oficios, Rosario decidió incursionar en el negocio de la venta de celulares. Trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, en su stand ubicado en una de las galerías más concurridas de la ciudad. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que es muy carismática y la venta se le hace fácil, ella sabe que si sigue trabajando arduamente podrá cosechar los frutos muy pronto. Se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más cantidad de accesorios para celulares y así poder aumentar su venta.
texts.en:
Rosario is 30 years old and a single mother of Shijar who is 12. For the past 5 yeras and after working in various jobs, Rosario decided to start a business selling cellular phones. She works from 8 am till 9 pm in her stand in one of the busiest markets of the city. She loves her work since she is very charismatic which makes sales easy for her. She knows that if she keeps working hard, she will be able to harvest the fruits of her labors sooner. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She will use the money to buy more accessories for the phones to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cell phone accessories

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Roxana tiene 33 años, es soltera y vive en casa de su madre. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, por un buen futuro, trabaja incansablemente en la venta de zapatos, ropa para niños, etc. ha venido realizando este trabajo desde hace ya 10 años, haciendo crecer poco a poco su negocio. Lo difícil de la venta es el tener que viajar a las ciudades de Tacna o Lima a traer la mercadería, pero es una molestia mínima a comparación de las gratificaciones que le da su trabajo. Roxana se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado viajará a traer ropa y zapatos, a la ciudad de Tacna, así vender más en estas fiestas navideñas.
texts.en:
Roxana is 33 years old, single, and lives in her mother's home. She is a very hard-working woman who, in order to create a better future, works tirelessly selling shoes, children's clothing, etc. She has worked in sales for the past 10 years, growing her business little by little. The difficult part of her job is having to travel to larger cities like Tacna or Lima in order to bring merchandise; however, it is a small annoyance compared to the rewards of running her own business. This is Roxana's first loan from Prisma Microfinance; she will use the money to travel to Tacna to bring more clothes and shoes to sell during the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Travel to Tacna to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra tiene 26 años, es una joven soltera que vive en la casa que su familia le dejó. Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza hace ya 6 años, empezó a trabajar en este rubro inclinada por sus dotes estéticos, sin llegar a pensar que esta actividad significaría su fuente fundamental de ingresos. Usualmente vende sus productos solicitados por catalogo, lo cual se le hace muy cómodo, el único inconveniente es tener que caminar a las casas de sus clientes para entregar y cobrar los productos, a pesar de ello, Sandra está muy feliz con su trabajo, pensando en crecer cada vez más. Se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero que solicita adquirirá mayor cantidad de productos para poder ofrecer a sus clientas.
texts.en:
Sandra is 26 years old, single, and lives in the home that her family left her. For the past 6 years, she has sold beauty products. She started in this business due to her talent for esthetics though she never thought that this would become her main source of income. Usually she sells her products through catalogues which is easier for her; the only difficult part is having to walk from house to house to deliver the goods and collect payments. In spite of the difficulties, Sandra is very happy with her job and always thinks about how she can grow her business. This is her second loan from Prisma Microfinance and she will use the money to buy a larger quantity of products to sell to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amout of products she sells

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: S. tiene 26 años, es soltera y vive en casa de su familia. Se dedica a la atención de su botica, desde 4 años atrás, desde que pudo instalarla, a base de mucho esfuerzo. Se dedica a su trabajo la mayor parte del día, abre desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 12 de la noche aproximadamente, está acostumbrada al trabajo duro y esto no se le hace complicado. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que permanecer durante tanto tiempo en su negocio, pero ella sabe que la dedicación que le da se ve reflejado en las ganancias que recibe. S. se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de medicinas para implementar su pequeña botica.
texts.en:
S. is 26 years old, single and living at home with her family. She works in her drugstore, which she was able to open 4 years ago after much effort. She is used to working long hours typically opening at 6:00 AM and not closing until midnight. The most difficult aspect of her work is being in the store for such long hours, but she knows that this dedication is reflected in the earnings she receives. This is S.’s second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she was very punctual with her previous payments. With this loan, she plans to purchase more medicines to stock her small drugstore.

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of medecines in her drugstore

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 53 años, vive en la casa de su familia independientemente, ya que se mantiene sola. La venta de combustible ha significado para Victoria la fuente principal de ingresos económicos desde hace 5 años, incursionando en el negocio por ser muy rentable. Victoria ha trabajado desde hace 22 años en otros oficios que no arrojaban los mismos ingresos que ahora logra, está muy contenta con su trabajo, el cual empieza desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 o 6 de la tarde, siendo la única dificultad que enfrenta, los fuertes olores de los combustibles que a veces la marean un poco, pero Victoria ha sabido sobrellevar estos inconvenientes y superarlos pareciéndole ahora insignificantes. Se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de combustible para comercializarlos y así aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Victoria is 53 years old and is living alone in her family home. The sale of fuel has been her principle source of income for the last five years and her business has become very profitable. Victoria had worked for 22 years previously in other occupations that did not produce as much income. She is very happy with her work, which begins at 8:00AM and lasts until between 5:00-6:00PM, with the only difficulty being the strong odors coming from the fuel that sometimes make her feel a bit ill. Victoria has learned to overcome these problems, which now seem insignificant to her. She is borrowing her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and has been very punctual with her payments. With the proceeds of the loan she will purchase larger quantities of fuel for sale so that she can increase her revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the amount of fuel available for sale

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 20 años, es soltera y vive en casa de su madre. Se dedica a la venta de golosinas en la escuela primaria del Distrito de Cabana un pequeño pueblito el cual es muy acogedor. A Vilma le gusta su trabajo, ya que sus clientes son los niños de la escuela, los cuales en al hora del recreo adquieren las golosinas que ella vende. El negocio es muy bueno, por ello desea expandir, hace 6 años trabajó vendiendo en la tienda de su hermana, pero hace 3 años se independizó, poniendo su propio negocio con el cual quiere forjarse un mejor futuro. Vilma se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor variedad de golosinas para poder satisfacer las necesidades de los niños a los cuales quiere ver feliz.
texts.en:
Vilma is 20 years old, single and lives with her mother. She sells candy and snacks in the elementary school of the Cabana District, a small, friendly village. Vilma enjoys her work since her customers are school children who purchase her goods during recess. Her business is going well and she would like to expand. Six years ago, she worked selling in her sister's general store, but three years ago she was able to start her own business in order to work for a better future. This is Vilma's first loan from Prisma Microfinance and will use the money to purchase a greater variety of candy and snacks to satisfy the needs of the school children who she enjoys making happy.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the variety and amount of snacks/candy she sells

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria Ajagbona is 50 years old and married with 11 children. She sells provisions like toothpaste, milk, detergent, etc. She plans to expand her business by stocking her shop with more provisions. She needs a loan in the amount of N80,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She is indeed grateful to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: William

texts.es: William tiene 20 años, es natural de la provincia de Azangaro, vive solo, ya que aún es soltero. Es un joven muy empeñoso que se dedica  a la venta de celulares desde hace dos años para cubrir sus gastos, ya que vive de forma independiente en casa de su familia. El quiere progresar y en un futuro contar con un negocio estable que le arroje buenos ingresos, es por eso que necesita del dinero con que le podemos apoyar. Se encuentra en su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado quiere comprar mayor cantidad de celulares para su posterior venta, y así hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
William is 20 years old, a native of Azangaro province, and single. He is a very hard-working young man who has sold cellular phones for the past two years to cover the costs of living in his family home. He wishes to progress to a stable business that will bring in a good income, and for this he needs your support. He is seeking his first loan from Microfinanzas Prisma. With this money, he would like to buy a greater quantity of cellular phones to sell, which will help his business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of phones for sale

loans.name: Yesica

texts.es: Yesica tiene 20 años, vive con su pareja Humberto de 24 años, el cual es chofer, y con sus dos hijas, Joselin de 4 años y Shamely de 11 meses. Ella se dedica a la venta de “salchimote”, que no es otra cosa que granos de maíz sancochado con salchichas fritas, en un pequeño carrito, donde brinda este rico platillo a sus clientes, los cuales son muy asiduos a su pequeño puesto. Lo que le gusta a Yesica de su trabajo es el poder realizarlo en compañía de sus dos pequeñas y así poder compartir junto a ellas, mientras que lo más difícil radica en tener que trasladarse desde su hogar que queda en Cabana, a casi una hora de la ciudad de Juliaca, siendo muy trabajoso trasladarse con su carrito y sus dos pequeñas. Yesica se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado refaccionará su carrito y además comprará mayor cantidad de productos para aumentar el número de platos para vender.
texts.en:
Yesica is 20 years old and lives with her 24-year-old husband, Humberto--a driver--and their two daughters, 4-year-old Joselin and 11-month-old Shamely. She sells "salchimote", a simple corn and sausage dish, from a small cart, which her customers visit regularly. What Yesica likes about her work is that she is able to stay with her two small children, but the most difficult part is having to transport her cart and daughters from their home in Cabana to the city of Juliaca, almost an hour away. Yesica is seeking her first loan from Microfinanzas Prisma. She will use the money to repair her cart and to buy more produce to increase the number of dishes she can sell.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair cart and increase food sales

loans.name: Yudy

texts.es: Yudy tiene 33 años, vive con su pareja y sus hijos Yesica de 14, Damián de 12, Diego de 10 y Adriana de 6. Se dedica a la venta de celulares, los cuales adquiere en la ciudad de Juliaca y distribuye a sus clientes en al ciudad de Puno. Ella incursionó en este negocio hace 2 años, tratando de cubrir los gastos que requerían sus pequeños hijos, afortunadamente, el negocio es muy bueno y le arroja buenas ganancias, no encontrándole dificultades. Yudy quiere seguir creciendo y aumentar su stock en estas fiestas navideñas, cuando el consumo de estos productos aumenta. Se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma con lo cual se compromete a ser responsable con sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Yudy is 33 years old and lives with her husband and their children: 14-year-old Yesica, 12-year-old Damian, 10-year-old Diego and 6-year-old Adriana. She sells cellular phones, which she acquires in the city of Juliaca and distributes to her customers in the city of Puno. She began this business two years ago to try to meet her children's needs, and fortunately, her business is doing well and her earnings are good. Yudy would like to continue growing and increase her stock for the holiday season, when cellular sales increase. She is seeking her first loan from Microfinanzas Prisma and promises to be responsible with her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of cell phones for sale

loans.name: Baptist Primary School Group

texts.en:
These are teachers from the Baptist Model Primary School in Makeni. Baptist was founded in September 1984 by the Baptist Mission. It has a total of 449 pupils currently enrolled in the school and a total of thirteen staff. Baptist Primary School always prides itself on its good results on the National Primary Schools Exams (NPSE). In 2004, for example, they produced the one student with the best testing results in the entire district.This is Baptist’s first loan with SMT.  They heard of SMT from colleagues in other schools who have benefited greatly from SMT’s services. The use of the loan varies amongst the teachers.  Some of the staff members will start a small business.  Those who are already small business owners will invest the loan into their businesses. Some of the staff members will be using the loan to buy pieces of furniture for their domiciles and others plan to pay either for their children’s education or to pursue further studies themselves. 

Government salaries are usually quite small for teachers, thus making teaching an unattractive profession for many whose primary motivator is money. Many choose other jobs over teaching because of the small salary, thus starving the field of qualified personnel to teach the children. The few who remain in the classroom have to find other ways of making ends meet. The vast majority of them, engage in either business or agriculture or they provide extra tutorial classes for the children (though this is a practice the government is trying to stop). Needless to say, loans from SMT are a great help to the teachers in order to boost their businesses or invest it in something productive. Many want to go to school but could not afford the cost. Some will want to buy pieces of furniture, but their monthly salary is not enough to let them do so. With a loan, they will be able to meet some of these needs.  And with their monthly salaries, they can repay easily via a payroll deduction type of system

Fifty-three year old David E. T. (right) is the head teacher at the Baptist School.  David was born in Makama in Makeni City. He is married with seven children – one in primary school, four in secondary school, one in college and the oldest is an adult working for a living. David will use his loan to pay college and school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay children's school/college fees

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina U. is 31 years old and married with two children. She sells tailoring materials and sarongs. She also sews clothes for her customers. 

She is happy because the festive season is approaching and the demand for her sarongs will increase. She is requesting a loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Monday

texts.en:
Monday Aigbogon is 47 years old and married with four children. He sells foodstuffs like fufu made from soaked cassava. Fufu is a staple food in Nigeria. He purchases the cassava from farmers to make into fufu to sell. 

He uses his motorcycle to supply fufu to his customers in the market. The demands for his fufu are high. He is requesting a loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more cassava to make into fufu to sell. He is indeed grateful to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava

loans.name: Zenovia

texts.es: Zenovia tiene 27 años, convive con su pareja Fredy de 26 años y sus dos hijas; Judith de 11 y Daniel de 6 años. El tejido de prendas es el negocio de Zenovia desde hace dos años atrás, buscando apoyar a su pareja con los gastos familiares, ya que su trabajo de obrero no alcanzaba para cubrir la manutención de la casa. A Zenovia siempre le ha gustado tejer, aprendiendo de su madres desde muy pequeña, hoy en día, ella también le enseña a su pequeña Judith para que tenga un oficio con el cual defenderse en el futuro. Las ventas son buenas y con el apoyo de su hija, el negocio va creciendo poco a poco, es por eso que Zenovia requiere de ayuda para cumplir con las metas trazadas. Es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Y con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad lana, en variados colores y texturas, para aumentar la variedad de su producción de prendas tejidas a mano.
texts.en:
Zenovia is 27 years old and lives with her 26-year-old partner, Fredy, and their two children, Judith age 11 and Daniel age 6. Zenovia has been making knitwear for two years. She is working in an attempt to help her partner with the family expenses because he could not support his family on his salary as a laborer. Zenovia has always loved to knit, a skill that she learned from her mother at a very young age. Today, she is also showing Judith how to knit so that she can have a skill with which she can get by in the future. Sales have been going well, and with her daughter’s support, the business has been growing steadily, which is why Zenovia needs help in order to reach her goals. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money being requested, she will purchase a greater quantity of wool, in assorted colors and textures, so that she can increase her variety of hand-woven garments.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more wool for knitwear

loans.name: Marian

texts.en:
Marian O. is 25 years old, and she is single. She makes lovely African designs for her customers. She also sells tailoring materials. She is happy because the demands for her tailoring materials and skills will increase this festive season. 

She hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She needs a loan in the amount of N52,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley O. is 40 years old and married with a child. His wife sells clothes. He makes and sells shoes. He also repairs worn out shoes.

He is requesting a loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more materials for shoe making. He is happy because he will make more sales during this festive season.  He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for shoe making

loans.name: Emerencia

texts.en:
Emerencia T. is married to Ngwa Michael and they have five children, three of whom are below the age of fifteen years. This will be Emmerencia’s fourth loan with GHAPE.  Emerencia and her family live in a three room house in the Nkwen neighborhood. Nkwen just outside downtown Bamenda.  She is the bread winner of the family, and she finds it very difficult to take care of the family single handedly.  In addition, she sustained serious injuries after being robbed by thieves.  Faced with her low level of education, she could not secure a good job for herself and thus she embarked on farming and retail trade which she has been doing for 10 years.

Becoming a member of GHAPE, she was fortunate enough to have acquired some techniques which have helped her to improve her business.  She has proven successful with her previous loans, which she had consecutively managed, and repaid loans worth $930 USD.  She is planning to contribute 70,000 CFA ($140 USD) of her personal savings towards this business plan. 

She will help her community as she will be able to supply the market with food crops like cassava and vegetables, and she will also provide the community with good palm oil. She intends to pay her children’s school fees and health costs with the profit from this loan, as well as reinvest in her business.  She plans to repay the loan in 18 months and repayment shall commence on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: To purchase palm oil, piglets, pig feed and seedlings

loans.name: Illenikhene

texts.en: Ilenikhene I. is 44 years old and a widow with 2 children. Her eldest child is studying pharmacy and the youngest child is studying business administration in the university.  She sells palm and groundnut oil both wholesale and retail to her customers. Ilenikhene is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase more palm and groundnut oil to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more palm and groundnut oil to sell

loans.name: Eki

texts.en: Eki O. is 32 year old and married with 2 children. She sells sarongs, jewelry, shoes and bags. She has many customers. As the festive season is here, Eki hopes to make more sales and profit. She is requesting a loan amount of $600 to purchase more sarongs, jewelry, shoes and bags to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more jewellery, shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Komi

texts.en: Mr. Komi G. is 31 year old. He is married and has 2 children.  He lives in the village of Wome, a small town approximately 130 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital.  To provide for his family, Komi operates a taxi-moto business. Komi picks up passengers along the road with his motorcycle, and drops them off at their destination.  This service is always in demand in Wome as there is no electricity in this village and people must often travel further than walking distance to take care of business.  Komi hopes to use this loan, through Kiva, to buy a new motorcycle.  With the profits that he will earn from his business over the next year, Komi will be able send his children to school and provide for his wife and family

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob E. sells planks. He sells his planks to people that are building their houses. He is 34 years old and married with 3 children. He is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase more planks to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Bright

texts.en: Bright Udoawujo is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She sells foodstuffs like palm oil, beans, rice, crayfish and stockfish. She plans to increase her foodstuffs business. Bright is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Kingsley

texts.en: Kingsley E. is 33 years old and married with 2 children. His wife is a school teacher. Kingsley sells planks both wholesale and retail to his customers. Kingsley is requesting a loan amount of $600 to purchase more planks to sell to his customers. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Godspower

texts.en: Godspower C. is 37 years old and married with 2 children. He owns a phone booth where he makes phone calls. His wife is a hair stylist. He hopes for the loan amount of $350 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. Godspower says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth G. is 35 years old and a single parent with a child. She sells drinks and salon materials like weaveons, hair extensions, and hair cream. Elizabeth is requesting a loan for $600 to purchase more drinks and salon materials to sell. She is indeed grateful to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and salon materials

loans.name: Chuks

texts.en: Chuks I. is 47 years old and married with 4 children. All his children are in school. He sells motorcycle spare parts. Chuks is also a commercial motorcyclist. He needs the loan amount of $425 to purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell. He says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina O.  is 37 years old and married with 4 children. She sells provisions and drinks. The location of her store gives her high patronage from customers.  Regina needs the loan amount of $425 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell.  She says thanks you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Ufuoma

texts.en: Ufuoma O. is a hairstylist. She also sews and sells clothes. She stated her business in 2004. Ufuoma is 37 years old and married with 3 children. With the festive season fast approaching, the demands for her clothes will increase. Ufuoma needs the loan amount of $700 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support and to LAPO MICROFINANCE for their business training.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Bright

texts.en: Bright B. makes phone calls and also sells rechargeable phone cards. Bright hopes to expand his business by purchasing more rechargeable phone cards. He is 32 years old and single. He needs the loan amount of $525 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. He is grateful to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Okoye

texts.en: Okoye I. is 26 years old and single. He has a phone booth for making calls and he also sells rechargeable phone cards. He started this business in 2005. He needs the loan amount of $425 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. He says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase  more rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia I. is 52 years old and married with 5 children. She and her family live in Benin city, Edo state, Nigeria. She sells provisions, drinks and plastics from her house. She hopes to expand her business by stocking her shop with all that her customers need. Patricia needs the loan amount of $350 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more  foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Belén Group

texts.en:
The Belen (Bethlehem) Village Bank is beginning its seventh loan cycle with 21 group members.  The women are involved in a variety of activities: they sell sweets, clothing, meat, fruit, prepared meals, cosmetics, and work as artisans. They sell their wares from home, in the marketplace, and on foot, making door-to-door deliveries. 

Julia, Nélida, Carmen, Yusly and Maritza are five of the 21 group members. 

Julia is a 53-year-old widow with two children. She has a stand in the newly-opened Americas Market, where she sells alfalfa and vegetables. She will use her loan to offer a wider variety of products. 

Nélida is 24 years old and lives with her partner and their daughter. Nélida and her husband sell cleaning products, which they sell in the stores of the Ayacuchan jungle towns. She buys her wares in Lima.

Carmen is 35 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their five children. She currently sells tripe from a mobile cart. She plans to use her loan to buy tables and chairs for the small restaurant she plans to open.

Yusly is 21 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their 3-year-old son. She sells haberdashery like necklaces and earrings, which she buys wholesale in the markets of Ayacucho City. She is using this loan to start anew: Yusly and her husband lost a lot of money when his household appliance stO. was robbed three months ago. Yusly thought about leaving FINCA, since she didn’t think she would have the money to keep making loan payments. Instead, she’s decided to stay in the group, but to start over with a small loan of 300 soles.

Maritza is single and 21 years old. She and her sister run a ceviche restaurant, which they just recently opened. She used to run a small stand, but now the restaurant has moved into a mO. central location. She plans to use her loan to buy television spots to promote her restaurant. 

The women are requesting different loan amounts (300, 450 or 600 soles) and the group as a whole is requesting a total of 12,000 soles. They will use their loans to buy vegetables, pasta, sugar, fruits, cookies, and animals.

loans.use: Buy vegetables, pasta, sugar, fruits, cookies, tables and chairs, TV ads and animals

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan Jiménez es originario del municipio de Condega en la ciudad de Estelí donde se dedica arduamente a su actividad agrícola destacándose en la siembra de hortalizas como lo es tomates y chiltomas. Su actividad económica agrícola la dedica desde muy joven y a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo ha logrado basta experiencia en esta labor.

Hoy en día atraviesa la necesidad de mejorar la condición económica de su actividad para mejorar de igual forma la condición de su familia y para esto ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito con el cual dar asistencia técnica al cultivo de las hortalizas. Por este motivo es que espera que su crédito sea otorgado para continuar con su actividad en el municipio de Condega.
texts.en:
Juan Jiménez is a native of the Condega municipality in the city of Estelí, where he works arduously in agriculture. He excels in planting vegetables like tomatoes and sweet peppers. He has been working in the farming business ever since he was very young, and as time passed by, he has managed to acquire a vast amount of experience in this field.

However, today he needs to improve his business’ financial situation so that he can also improve his family’s living conditions, which is why he now turns to Ceprodel for a loan so that he can maintain his crops. For this reason, he hopes that he will be given the loan so that he can continue with his business in the municipality of Condega.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crop maintenance

loans.name: Betilú

texts.en:
Betilú is a member of the Azucenas (“White Lilies”) Village Bank. She is 31 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their two daughters. 

Betilú sells dishes and pots and pans in a rented store in Ayacucho. Her husband buys the dishes and cookware in Lima (a nine-hour bus ride from Ayacucho) and brings them back to Ayacucho for Betilú to sell in their store. Her husband also works as an ambulatory vendor on the streets of Ayacucho; he sells a wide range of products that vary according to what his customers request.
