Betilú is requesting a loan of 3500 soles to buy pitchers, glasses, pots, frying pans and tea kettles. Her goal for the future is to expand her business and own her own store.

loans.use: Buy wholesale kitchen wares

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es: Rufina tiene 43 años de edad, es casada, pero actualmente no vive con su esposo, está viviendo sólo con uno de sus hijos. Le llaman Yolita, que es su segundo nombre, es una mujer empresarial, anteriormente su oficio era de captar trabajadores para diversas empresas, pero hace como 10 años emprendió su propio negocio, tener un hotel en su propia casa, y notó que le era muy rentable, para ello a contratado personal de servicio para que le apoyen en su negocio. Adicionalmente, implementó otro negocio de servicio de llamadas telefónicas, cabinas de Internet y venta de tarjetas para celulares. Ella está muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza y no le ve inconvenientes. Es su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará gran cantidad de tarjetas para celulares prepago.
texts.en:
Rufina is 43 years old and married, but is currently not living with her husband. She lives with one of her children. They call her by her middle name, Yolita. She is a very enterprising woman who used to work at a job agency recruiting employees for several companies. Ten years ago, however, she started her own business—a hotel in her home—and she realized that it was very lucrative. She has hired staff to help her with the business. Addiotionally, she has a business in which she offers telephone and internet services, as well as cellular phone calling cards. She is very happy with the work that she is doing and sees no shortcomings with it. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money being requested, she will purchase a greater quantity of prepaid cellular phone cards.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cellular phone calling cards

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 33 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo aun pequeño. De profesión, es profesora, en la mañana trabaja en una escuela del nivel primario, por ello que se levanta a 5.00am para preparar el desayuno y atender a su hijo en lo que sea necesario, al regresar del colegio a partir de las 3.00pm se dedica a ofrecer prendas de vestir de casa en casa, y quienes la conocen, la buscan en su propio domicilio. A ella le conviene tener una actividad adicional a su trabajo porque le es muy rentable, ya que si vende al crédito el precio de la prenda se incrementa, y cuando vende al contado inmediatamente puede obtener ganancias, además de la venta le gusta mucho conversar con la gente. Es su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. El dinero se invertirá en la compra de más prendas de vestir, sobre todo en ropa para niños por campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Rosa is a married 33-year-old mother with one young son. She is a teacher who works in an elementary school in the morning, which is why she must get up at 5:00 am in order to prepare breakfast and help her son with whatever he needs. After returning from school at 3:00 pm, she sells clothing door-to-door. The customers who are familiar with her go directly to her house to buy merchandise. This side business is very convenient for her because it is quite lucrative. If she sells on credit, the price of the garment increases, and if she is paid in cash, she can immediately obtain her profits. Aside from liking retail, she also very much likes to interact with people. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She will invest the money in purchasing more apparel, especially for children and for the holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more apparel

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina tiene 49 años de edad, es conviviente, tuvo 6 hijos, de los cuales solo viven ahora con ella, 4 de ellos. Desde muy niña trabajó al cuidado del hogar y de los niños de sus vecinos, una vez que tuvo su familia se puso a vender comida en las ferias sabatinas que están cerca de su casa. Hace como 8 años puso un pequeño restaurante en su domicilio, y hace un año lo implementó con la venta de gaseosas y golosinas. La venta de comida le es muy rentable, lo dificultoso es cuando le sobra comida y no recupera parte de su capital, pero en los dias de feria, si le sale muy bien e inclusive le falta la comida. Es su 2do préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado va a incrementar sus golosinas y gaseosas para su restaurante.
texts.en:
Paulina is 49 years old, is the mother of six children, and lives with her partner and four of her children. Since she was very young she worked taking care of her home and of her neighbor's children. Once having her own family, she began to sell food at local Saturday markets. About eight years ago she opened a small restaurant in her home. One year ago she expanded her business to include the sale of soft drinks and sweets. Selling food is very lucrative and the only problem is when there is unsold food and Paulina does not recoup her investment. But on market days, she does well and even runs out of food.

This is Paulina's second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She will use the money to stock up on sweets and soft drinks for her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on soft drinks and sweets for her restaurant

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: Moisés tiene 36 años de edad, conviviente, tiene dos hijos muy pequeños aun, él y su esposa trabajan en la chacra. Desde muy niño se dedicó a la agricultura, ahora que tiene su familia con mayor razón está sembrando varias hectáreas de frutos cítricos, carambolas y mangos, lo bueno nos dice, que las carambolas producen constantemente y se puede cosechar progresivamente, solo se le tiene que fumigar contra las mosquitas con insecticidas muy fuertes para que puedan erradicar estos insectos que afectan a todo cítrico. A Moisés le agrada su trabajo, sobre todo le es muy rentable, porque durante todos los meses del año puede cosechar mientras que estén bien cuidadas las plantas, la dificultad mayor son las plagas afectan sus cultivos. Es su 3er préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Después de tanta entrega a la agricultura, ahora quiere invertir en la implementación de una pequeña bodega, el resto del dinero será usado en la compra de insecticidas para fumigar sus frutas.
texts.en:
Moisés is 36 years old, is in a civil union, and has two small children. He and his wife work on a small farm. He has been a farmer since he was very young, and now that he has a family he is especially motivated to succeed. He plants several hectares of citrus, star fruit, and mangoes. The good thing about star fruit trees is that they bear fruit and can be harvested continually, though they must be fumigated with insecticides to eradicate mosquitoes. Moisés is very grateful for his job, especially since it is so profitable. As long as his trees are well-tended he can harvest all year long. His main difficulty is in dealing with the insects that effect his crops.

This is Moisés's third loan from Microfinanzas Prisma. After so much time farming, he would like to invest in having a small general store. The remaining amount of the loan will be used to purchase insecticides to fumigate his fruit trees.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase insecticides for his crops

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.es: Madeleine tiene 40 años de edad, estaba separada del padre de sus hijos, pero hace 6 años decidieron darse otra oportunidad de convivir, tienen 5 hijos, solo 3 viven con ella. Cuando era  muy niña veía que su madre preparaba tortas y las vendía, pero cuando ella tuvo 10 años su madre falleció, su padre no era tan responsable con sus hijos, entonces ella decidió poner en practica lo que su madre hacia, y poco a poco se fue perfeccionando en el oficio de la repostería, y ahora vive de ello, haciendo grandes decoraciones  para fiestas y eventos de gran significación, y también sigue ofreciendo tajaditas de queque por las calles, que fue como comenzó su negocio. A ella le agrada mucho su actividad, sobre todo ahora que ha tomado cursos de repostería ha adquirido mucha clientela y no encuentra dificultad alguna. Es su 5to préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Este dinero que solicita será usado en la compra de decoraciones y acabados en la ciudad de Lima, porque en su localidad no hay este tipo de objetos.
texts.en:
Madeleine is 40 years old and was separated from the father of her children. However, six years ago, they decided to try living together again. They have five children, three of whom still live with her. When she was a young girl she observed that her mother made cakes and sold them. But, at the age of ten, her mother passed away and her father wasn’t as responsible with the children. At that point, she decided to put into practice what her mother did and little by little she perfected the art of baking. She now lives off this trade, making large decorations for parties and events of great significance. She also continues to offer small cakes on the streets, which is how she started her business. She gets great enjoyment from these activities and, especially now that she has taken some baking classes, she has attracted a good customer base and proceeds without any difficulty. This is her fifth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. The funds she is requesting will be used to buy decorations and finishing touches in the city of Lima, because in her area there are no items of this type.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cake decorations.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es: Jenny tiene 35 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos menores que estudian en el nivel primario. Desde muy niña se ha dedicado a la agricultura, desde que se casó siguió en esta labor, pero en menor tiempo, ya que está dedicada más a la atención de su esposo que es chofer y trabaja en la ciudad haciendo taxi  y sus hijos que estudian, pero hay temporadas donde que tienen que ir a cosechar o cultivar sus chacras, entonces, madruga a eso de las 4.00am para prepara el almuerzo y estar temprano en sus campos, a ella le agrada mucho la chacra, solo que no le puede dedicar mucho tiempo, por los estudios de sus hijos, pero en tiempo de vacaciones se dedicará de integro a su chacra, juntamente con su esposo. Es su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. El dinero solicitado será invertido en el abono de sus plantaciones de plátano, ya que empezará la preparación de sus tierras los fines de semana, para que de ese modo las hojas del plátano reaccionen y no estén amarillas.
texts.en:
Jenny is 35 years old, married, and has four young children who are in primary school. Since she was young, she has dedicated herself to agriculture and she continued in this labor after she married. She spends less time at it, however, in order to dedicate more time to her husband -- who is a taxi driver and works in the city -- as well as to her children, who are students. However, there are times when they have to go to harvest or care for their farmlands. To do this, she rises at 4:00 a.m. to fix lunch and arrive at her lands early. She very much enjoys farming, only she can’t dedicate much time due to her childrens’ studies. During vacation times, she will dedicate herself wholly to farming, along with her husband. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. The funds requested will be invested into fertilizing her banana plantings, since she will be starting to prepare her lands on the weekends so that the leaves on her banana trees will react and not yellow.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 42 años de edad, es casada, tuvo 7 hijos, de los cuales viven con ella 4 de ellos. Desde niña se dedicaba a la chacra, después cuando se casó, en un inicio se dedicaba a cuidar de sus hijos, y después comenzó a vender gaseosas en la puerta de su casa, mientras la iban construyendo. Una vez que construyó instaló su tienda, sobre todo para en la venta de gaseosas y golosinas. Gladys dice, que en lo días de feria, es donde en mayor cantidad vende, pero cuando no lo es su venta baja, ella está muy contenta con su negocio y sobre todo puede intercambiar conversación con sus clientes. Es su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado va incrementar la venta de gaseosas y cervezas para su bodega denominada “Kely”.
texts.en:
Gladys is 42 years old, married, and has seven children, four of whom still live with her. As a youngster, she has dedicated herself to farming. After she married, she initially cared for the children and later started to sell sodas from the doorway of her house while it was being built. Once the house was completed, she installed her store which specialized particularly in the sale of sodas and sweets. Gladys says that she sells the most on market days, but on other days her sales are lower. She is very happy with her business, particularly because it allows her the opportunity to interact with her customers. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the funds she is requesting, she will increase her soda and beer sales for her grocery store which is named “Kely”.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the amount of beverages that she sells in her grocery store.

loans.name: Elifia

texts.es: Elifia tiene 52 años de edad, es separada, en su vida conyugal tuvo 5 hijos, con ella están viviendo ahora, su hija y su nieta. De niña trabajaba en la chacra ayudando a su padre, y cuando tuvo sus hijos se dedicaba a la venta de comida en el mercado, su esposo, es ese tiempo era chofer y le apoyaba en lo posible. Ahora tiene una tienda donde vende perfumes, joyas y objetos personales para mujer, pero también sigue vendiendo, en los días de feria, los sábados, salchipapas y refrescos. Los productos de su tienda las adquiere por catálogo, y le gusta mucho su negocio, cuando llegan sus pedidos sale a repartir de casa en casa, mientras que su hija se queda en el negocio para no perder clientela. Es su 2do préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Todo el dinero del préstamo será invertido en la compra de perfumes y tarjetas de navidad por campaña para venderlas en su tienda.
texts.en:
Elifia is 52 years old, separated, and had five children while married. Currently, her daughter and granddaughter are living with her. As a youngster, she helped her father work on the farm. Once she had children, she dedicated herself to food sales in the market. Her husband was a driver at the time, and helped her as much as possible. Currently, she has a store where she sells perfumes, jewelry and personal care items for women. She still, however, sells food and beverages on market days. She acquires her store’s products by catalog and very much enjoys her business. When her orders arrive, she leaves to distribute them door-to-door while her daughter tends to the store so she won’t lose customers. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. All the funds requested will be invested into the purchase of perfumes and Christmas cards to sell in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of products that she sells.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es: Dionicia tiene 47 años de edad, es casada, tuvo dos hijos que están estudiando el colegio. Desde muy niña se ha dedicado al comercio, siempre le agradó vender abarrotes y otros productos, cuando tuvo 18 años empezó a vender solo en las ferias sabatinas, así estuvo por muchos años, luego se casó, entonces con ayuda de su esposo hicieron su casa y pusieron su propio negocio en su domicilio, lo bueno es que a su esposo también le gusta el comercio. Decidieron que su esposo atendería la bodega y ella vendería en el mercado verduras y demás productos. Para esta pareja, la actividad que realizan le es muy rentable, el reto es la competencia. Es el segundo préstamo de Dionicia con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con todo el  dinero solicitado van incrementar la cantidad de verduras y mercadería para la bodega.
texts.en:
Dionicia is 47 years old and married with two children who are still in school. She has worked in sales since she was a girl and she always enjoyed selling groceries and other products. When she turned 18, she started to sell at the Saturday fairs and she continued that pattern for many years. After she married, with the help of her husband, they built a home and put a small grocery store in the house. What's great is that her husband also enjoys working in sales. They decided that her husband would tend the store in their home and she would sell vegetables and other products in the market. Business is very profitable for this couple, but the challenge is the competition. This is Dionicia's second loan from Prisma Microfinance and she will use the money to increase the amount of vegetables and merchandise in their store.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of supplies and merchandise she sells

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 29 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos, actualmente está viviendo en la casa de su suegra. Desde que se comprometió estaba sólo al cuidado de sus hijos, pero hace como 10 meses le ofrecieron traspasar la tienda su cuñada, desde entonces está ligada al mundo del comercio de abarrotes y verduras en general, no se arrepiente al haber tomado esa decisión, y ya está adquiriendo clientela para su negocio. Su esposo trabaja haciendo servicio de transporte en motocarro y le ayuda en los momentos cuando ella tiene que ir al mercado y comprar los productos para su bodega, por esa parte no tiene dificultad, tiene anhelos de luchar muy duro para la rentabilidad de su negocio. Es su 5to préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma y es puntual en sus pagos. Con la cantidad solicitada incrementará la mercadería de su bodega.
texts.en:
Isabel is 29 years old and lives with her husband with whom she has two children. They currently live in her in-law's house. When she got engaged, she was only in charge of taking care of the children, but about 10 months ago, her in-laws offered her the chance to work in her sister-in-law's small store. Since then, she has been tied to the world of sales, helping to sell groceries and vegetables, and she doesn't regret the decision for a second, as she continues to increase her customer base. Her husband makes a living running a transportation service and helps her when she needs to go to the market to buy products for the store. She is anxious to fight hard for the profitability of her business. This is her 5th loan from Prisma Microfinance and she has always made her payments on time. With this money, she will increase the amount of merchandise available in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of merchandise in her store

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: Marcela tiene 52 años D. edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, ahora está viviendo solo con el mayor. Hace 20 años atrás se dedicaba  a la venta D. comida, pero le era muy trabajoso y dificultoso, entonces, hace 8 años comenzó a vender productos D. belleza, dice que le va bien, sobre todo le deja márgenes D. ganancia muy alentadores porque tiene clientas buenas pagadoras, pero hace como 2 años decidió implementar el negocio con la venta D. prendas D. vestir, pero con lo que más gana es la venta D. perfumes y joyas D. catálogos muy conocidos. Y ahora hace como 4 meses que está cuidando a la hija D. su sobrina, la cual le da una propina por eso, la dificultad es que tiene que ofrecer sus productos cargando a la pequeña. Es su 5to préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. El dinero solicitado lo va invertir en la compra D. perfumes, ella trata D. estoquear su negocio por campañas, ya que le dan a un menor costo y los pueD. vender D. acuerdo al precio del catalogo y gana más.
texts.en:
Marcela is 52 years old and married with three children, though only the oldest lives with her. Twenty years ago, she worked selling food, but it was a very difficult job for her so eight years ago she started selling beauty products. She tells us that the business is going well and overall she earns very encouraging margins on her products since her customers pay her well and on time. About two years ago, she decided to set up a business selling clothing, but she earns more selling perfumes and jewelry from very well-known catalogues. About four months ago, she took over the responsibility of taking care of her niece's daughter (for which she earns a bit of money) but now her difficulty is that she has to carry the girl as she walks around selling her products. This is her 5th loan from Prisma Microfinance and she will use the money to buy perfumes. She tries to stock her business in phases since she receives better pricing as she buys in bulk and she is able to earn greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the stock of products she sells

loans.name: Yarty

texts.es: Yarty es una jovencita de 19 años, soltera que vive con su madre y hermanos. Sus padres se dedicaban a la agricultura, ella por motivos de estudios tuvo que migrar a la ciudad, estos últimos años sus padres y sus hermanos decidieron vivir con ella en la ciudad, por ello que Yarty incursionó en el comercio de abarrotes hace 5 años, y hasta ahora hizo mucha clientela que consumen sus productos. Ahora está estudiando secretariado por las tarde, en horas de la mañana atiende su bodega y en la tarde se lo encarga a su madre, a pesar que su negocio no le da grande ingresos, nunca les falta dinero, por eso le agrada, porque le permite ser independiente. Es su 5to préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, pagando de manera puntual sus cuotas. Con el dinero solicitado va incrementar la compra de útiles escolares, acondicionará un lugar especial para ese rubro en su tienda.
texts.en:
Yarty is a young lady who is 19 years of age, single, and lives with her mother and brothers. Her parents dedicated themselves to farming and she, for educational reasons, had to migrate to the city. These past few years, her parents and brothers decided to live with her in the city. Due to this, Yarty embarked into the sales of groceries five years ago and to this day she has a good customer base that buys her products. Currently, she is taking secretarial courses in the afternoons and in the mornings she tends to her store. Her mother cares for the business in the afternoons. Despite the fact that the store doesn’t generate a great income, they never lack for money and she enjoys her enterprise because it allows her to be independent. This is her fifth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has paid all her installments in a timely manner. She will invest the funds she is requesting into school supplies, and will set up a special area in her store for this endeavor.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase school supplies to sell in her store.

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.en:
Olimpia is a member of the Confianza (“Trust”) Village Bank. She is 37 years old and has two children. 

She owns a small store in the Carmen Alto neighborhood of Ayacucho, where she sells “salichipapas” (French fries with hot dog slices, a popular local snack). Olimpia is in her last year of studies to be an educational assistant, and hopes to find work soon after getting her degree. 

Olimpia is requesting a loan of 600 soles to pay for the rest of her schooling and to buy ingredients to make salichipapas. 

Olimpia’s goals for the future are to expand her store and to put a solid roof on her house (her current roof is just a sheet of corrugated tin). She also likes to do handicrafts, and she makes her own puppets. She would like to open a store in her home to sell puppets and other educational materials.

loans.use: School fees, potatoes and hot dogs to make "salichipapas"

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a member of the Confianza (“Trust”) Village Bank. He is 30 years old and lives with his girlfriend and their daughter. Victor and his brothers own a workshop where they make weavings on a loom. They then sell their weavings in a local market. Victor has been working as an artisan for 14 years. 

Victor is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy wool and dyes for his weavings, as well as to buy new heddles for his looms, since they need to be replaced periodically and his have gotten worn out. 

Victor’s goal for the future is to export his work to sell. He may be able to do this through FINCA Peru Exports, a branch of FINCA that works with artisans to sell their work internationally.

loans.use: Buy new heddles for loom, new wool and dyes

loans.name: Keita Nelly

texts.en:
Keita is a member of the Confianza (“Trust”) Village Bank. She is 27 years old and lives with her partner and their three children. 

Keita buys grains, which her mother then takes to the city of Pisco to sell. Pisco is about seven hours from Ayacucho, where Keita and her family live. Her mother travels to Pisco by bus with seasonal grains, then buys whatever local products are in season in Pisco to bring back to Ayacucho to sell (since the two cities have different climates, different locally grown products are in season at different times). She leaves each Friday and returns on Wednesday of the next week. Since her mother does all of the traveling, Keita is able to stay home with her three children in Ayacucho. 

Keita is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy grains. Her goal for the future is to open up her own clothing store in Ayacucho so that her mother doesn’t have to travel any more.

loans.use: Buy grains to sell in Pisco

loans.name: Judie

texts.es:
La microempresaria Judie J. Malespín tiene 54 años de edad es madre soltera con dos hijos tiene por mas de 20 años un restaurante ubicado en uno de los barrios céntricos de esta ciudad de Bluefields, en donde oferta el servicio de venta de comidas tanto regionales como nacionales y chinas así como   bebidas de diferentes marcas.

La señora J. es bastante conocida principalmente por sectores creoles que la visitan por el tipo de atención y música que tiene en su local. Sin embargo por el alto costo de la vida en esta región con su capital no puede comprar todos los productos que necesita, por lo que solicita se le financie para comprar lo siguiente:


80 libras de carne de res a US$ 1.50 dólares cada libra, 80 libras de carne de cerdo a US$ 1.20 dólares cada libra, 100 libras de pollo a US$ 1.30 dólares cada libra, 1 quintal de arroz americano a US$ 56 dólares cada quintal, 1 bidón de aceite  a US$ 33 dólares cada bidón y 10 cajas de jugos a US$ 6.50 dólares cada caja.
texts.en:
The small-businesswoman Judie J. M. is 54 years old. She is a single mother of two, and for more than 20 years she had had a restaurant located in one of the central neighborhoods of Bluefields. There, she sells both regional foods and ethnic foods, such as Chinese food and the like. She also sells different brands of drinks. Mrs. J. is fairly well known by the creole people who visit her restaurant both for the good service and music. Still, because of the high cost of living in the region and its capital, Mrs. J. can't buy all the products she needs, and because of this, she is asking that you finance her to buy the following: *80 pounds of beef for US$ 1.50/lb *80 pounds of pork for $1.20/lb *100 pounds of chicken for $1.30/lb *1 quintal (46 kg) of American rice for $56/quintal *1 barrel of cooking oil for $33/barrel *10 boxes of juice for $6.50/box

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for the restaurant

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Risitas Group

texts.es: El grupo Risitas esta representada por la señora Zulema ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos al igual que sus compañeras D. grupo que son madres D. familia D. hijos menos a cinco años, las integrantes son gente joven, dinamica, respondable y con ganas D. progresar. Una mayoria del grupo se dedica al comercio D. diferentes productos como ser: venta D. pollo, cereales, tela, cosmeticos, cotillon algunos se dedican a la elavoracion D. pan, D. prendas D. vestir y al trasporte público. Las socias tiene vastante experiencia en el rubro al cual pertenecen por lo que saben manejar a su beneficio el mercado competitivo. En general los socios (as) no tienen experiencia trabajando con grupos solidarios ya que es su primer financiamiento, pero se sienten capaces D. cumplir con la Fundacion Agrocapital y con los integrantes D. su grupo con responsabilidad. el destino del crédito es para el incremento D. insumos y materiales a la venta así como para el mejoramiento D. sus herramientas D. trabajo.
texts.en:
The group, Little Smiles, is represented by Mrs. Zulema. She is single with three children, just as the other women of the group are mothers with children under the age of five. The members are young, dynamic, responsible, and have goals for advancement. A majority of the group sells different types of products such as chicken, cereals, fabric, cosmetics. Others bake bread, sew clothes, and proviD. public transportation. The members have plenty of experience in their areas, so they know how to gain a competitive edge in the market. In general, the members don't have experience working in these types of groups, and this is their first microloan, but they feel capable of fulfilling their responsibility to Kiva partner Fundacion Agrocapital and to the other members of the group. This loan will lead to increased income and (the purchase of) more products to sell and improve the members' ability to do business.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational expenses

loans.name: Horizontes Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "HORIZONTES" ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA EDITH. EN SU MAYORÍA  SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO D. PRODUCTOS COMO PASTILLAS, COMIDA, ROPA CHOCOLATES Y ENTRE LOS VARONES SE DEDICAN A ACTIVIDADES COMO LA CHAPERÍA, PINTURA, SOLDADURA Y AL TRANSPORTE PÚBLICO. SON GENTE TRABAJADORA Y RESPONSABLE POR LO QUE NO TEMEN A LAS BAJAS DEL MERCADO. EL DESTINO DEL CRÉDITO ES PARA EL INCREMENTO D. INSUMOS Y MATERIALES A LA VENTA ASÍ COMO PARA LA MEJORA D. SUS HERRAMIENTAS D. TRABAJO. EN GENERAL LOS SOCIOS (AS) NO TIENEN MUCHA EXPERIENCIA EN GRUPOS SOLIDAR. PERO SON GENTE RESPONSABLE Y TODOS SON CONOCIDOS ENTRE SI POR LO QUE JUNTOS SABRÁN SALIR ADELANTE CON CAPACIDAD Y RESPONSABILIDAD.
texts.en:
The group horizons es represented by Mrs. Edith. The majority of the group sells products like pills, food, and chocolates. The men sell services such as metal work, painting, soldering/welding, and public transportation. They are hard working people and responsible, so they are not afraid of the drops in the economy. This loan will serve to purchase more products to sell and increase revenues and therefore improve the members' ability to do business. In general, the members do not have much experience working with groups like this, but they are responsible people and they all know each other well, so they know they will go forth with capability and responsibility.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating expenses

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Pablo Calderon es originario de la ciudad de León y vive en el municipio de El Sauce junto con su familia compuesta por su esposa y su hijo al que tiene que mantener. Él se dedica a su actividad agropecuaria con la que mantiene a su familia que tanto necesita de su apoyo financiero.

El señor C. se ha destacado en la crianza de novillos y siembra de hortalizas y la razón por la cual ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los novillos para desarrollo. Por este motivo es que espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito será otorgado y de esta forma logrará salir adelante en su actividad a la que se dedica.
texts.en:
Mr. Pablo Calderon is originally from the city of Leon, and he lives in the town of El Sauce with his family, which are his wife and son whom he cares for. He supports his family through farming, and needs your financial support. Mr. Calderon has focused on raising cattle and planting vegetables. Therefore, he has asked for Kiva partner Ceprodel's help by applying for a loan to buy more cattle and expand. Because of this, he is hopeful and confident that his loan will be authorized, allowing him to advance in his work.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Milder Antonio

texts.es:
Milder C. es originario del municipio de Condega de la ciudad de León donde se dedica a laborar en su actividad económica de ganadería y agricultura por medio de la siembra de hortalizas y la crianza de terneros para luego sacarles el máximo provecho y de esta forma subsistir junto con su familia la cual se compone por su esposa e hijo.

Es de relevancia mencionar que este caballero es muy esforzado por lo que hoy en día ha duplicado sus esfuerzos debido a que desea obtener mejores ingresos para suplir las necesidades de su hogar en estos momentos en los cuales se acerca el fin de año. Por esta razón es que ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita la compra de insumos para las hortalizas y además para invertir en la compra y crianza de terneros en su municipio.
texts.en:
Milder C. is from the Condega area of the city of Leon, where he works in livestock and agriculture by planting vegetables and raising cattle. Later he reaps the benefits of this, thereby surviving with his family - his wife and son. It should be mentioned that this young man is a hard worker and has now doubled his efforts because he wants to have better income to fulfill the needs of his home since the end of the year is approaching. Therefore, he has asked for the support of Kiva partner Ceprodel and a loan that will allow him to buy materials for planting his crops as well as to invest in purchasing and raising cattle in his area.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural materials

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es:
Justo Rufino Pérez,  es un hombre que se dedica al comercio de ropa (mujer y niño).
Lleva aproximadamente 15 años de experiencia en el negocio; donde actualmente es la fuente vital de ingresos para su familia y para él; él tiene un puesto de ropa en la banqueta de un mercado muy conocido a nivel nacional de Guatemala, es el mercado el Roosevelt, allí le llegan a comprar señoras, señoritas, madres para sus niños, niñas.
Rufino Pérez dice que él se ha propuesto atender bien a sus clientes para que puedan regresar de nuevo, además índica que les da un buen precio para que lo busquen en otra oportunidad.
Rufino compra en una bodega la ropa para mujer, como suéteres, blusas, trajes para dama, trajes para niño, y también playeras, pantalones, blusitas para niños.
Rufino comenta que en esta época él tiene la oportunidad de colocar un negocio mas, por la  temporada navideña; la municipalidad de Guatemala, en el mes de Diciembre le alquila un dos metros cuadrados de una banqueta para poder poner negocios navideños; esto ocurre en la famosa SEXTA AVENIDA DE GUATEMALA, un lugar donde hay mucho comercio.
Rufino necesita el dinero para poder adelantar la compra de mercadería y así poder tener lo necesario para poder comercializar; en esa temporada tiene una persona que le ayuda en el otro puesto, para no descuidar ninguno de los dos.
Además Rufino indica que en el mercado el Roosevelt allí ya es conocido, lo llegan buscar estudiantes de la universidad de San Calos, y menciona que llegan hasta doctoras que le llegan a comprar, esto a él lo ha motivado por seguir adelante con su familia.
El sueño de Rufino es ver a su familia prospera, brindándoles educación, salud, vivienda y sobre todo el amor en familia.
texts.en:
Justo Rufino Pérez is a man who dedicates himself to selling women’s and children’s clothing. He has approximately 15 years of experience in this business, which currently is the primary means of income for him and his family. He has a clothing stand in a well-known market in Guatemala, the Roosevelt Market, where women come to purchase his items as well as mothers for their children. Rufino Pérez states that he has undertaken to provide excellent service to his customers to ensure repeat business, and also indicates that he sells his products at good prices so that they will return to see him. Rufino buys items to sell such as sweaters, blouses, women and children’s suits, as well as onesies, pants and tops for children. Rufino comments that during this season he has the opportunity to add another business, given the nearness of the Christmas holidays. The Guatemala municipality, in the month of December, rents two square meters of space to sell holiday-related items. This occurs in the famous 6th Avenue of Guatemala Street, a location with a great deal of commerce. Rufino needs funding to purchase supplies, so he will have the necessary items to sell. During this season, he has one person to help him at his other stand so that he can make sure both locations are well tended to. In addition, Rufino indicates that he is well-known at the Roosevelt Market where students from San Carlos University seek him out. He mentions that even professional women visit him to buy his goods, which motivates him further to continue forging ahead along with his family. Rufino’s dream is to see his family prosper, providing education, good health, a home and, most of all, a loving family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing at low prices to sell.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es: El Sr. Ramón tiene 36 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, su esposa es ama de casa y le tiene un niño de 10 años de edad, que esta estudiando la primaria, don Ramón trabaja como guarda de seguridad, anteriormente estuvo sin trabajo le costo encontrar debido a inestabilidad del gobierno, pues estuvo trabajando de ayudante de albañil, y su esposa lavaba y planchaba para ayudar a los gastos del hogar, pero gracias a Dios tengo un trabajo fijo, con el préstamo que esta solicitando lo quiere para infraestructura en la construcción de un muro frontal para tener seguridad con su familia, esta es su cuarta solicitud en Afodenic, lo cual han sido de muchos beneficio por la oportunidad y confianza que le han brindado. A largo plazo  es poder obtener otro trabajo donde pueda ganar mejor, ayudar a su hijo con los estudios.
texts.en:
Ramón is 36 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Laureles Sur in the capital of Managua. His wife is a homemaker, and he has one 10-year old child who is in primary school. Ramón works as a security guard, having previously been unemployed due to political instability. He was working as a construction assistant, and his wife laundered and ironed to help out with the household expenses. However, thanks to God, he found stable employment. With the loan he is requesting, he would like to improve the infrastructure of his house by building a front wall to better secure his family. This is his fourth loan request with Afodenic, loans that have been very beneficial to him for the opportunities and confidence they have provided him with. Long-term, he hopes to obtain other employment that pays better and to help his son with his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies to build a wall.

loans.name: Alvin Alis

texts.es: El señor Alvin Alis L.,  tiene la edad de 50 años,  habita en la Concepción, junto a su esposa y  hijos, la señora le ayuda con el negocio en la casa de habitación, este señor desde hace doce años tiene una pulpería la cual atiende su esposa, el trabaja como albañil para poder cubrir los gastos del hogar, con sus propios esfuerzos han logrado mantener un poco el negocio y la mano amiga de Afodenic. Los sueños de de don Ali es llegar a  tener una micelania, con esta solicitud del préstamo va para incrementar su negocio y poder realizar sus sueños. Don Ali argumenta que esta muy contento con nuestra institución ya que le han apoyado durante seis préstamo y le han dado la oportunidad de salir hacia delante con su familia
texts.en:
Alvin Alis L. is 50 years old, and lives in Concepción with his wife and children. His spouse helps him with the business, which is in their house. This man has had a grocery store for twelve years which is tended to by his wife. He works in construction in order to cover the household expenses. Thourgh their own efforts, they have managed to maintain the business with the helping hand of Afodenic. Mr. Ali dreams of having a small general store and, with this loan, he hopes to grow his business and realize his dreams. Mr. Ali comments that he is very happy with our institution as it has supported him with six loans, and has given him the opportunity to get ahead along with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various products for his general store.

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
La señora María B. se dedica  a la venta de frutas y verduras en el Mercado Ivan Montenegro de la ciudad de Managua donde comercializa sus perecederos a sus fieles clientes que le visitan a diario en el mercado.

Su trabajo lo realiza todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana y es por esto que se ha dedicado a laborar mas en su actividad para mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia. Hoy en día la razón por la cual espera en Ceprodel es porque ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de los perecederos, es importante destacar que por medio de este crédito logrará la compra de las frutas y verduras que tanto requiere.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria B. sells fruits and vegetables in the Ivan Montenegro Market in Managua. She sells goods to her faithful customers who visit her daily at the market. She works every day, starting early in the morning, in order to improve the economic condition of her family. Because of this, she has put her hope in Kiva partner Ceprodel and applied for a loan to buy more products. It is important to bring out that this loan will help with the purchase of fruits and vegetables that she needs so much.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan L. es una persona muy trabajadora, labora para una empresa constructora desde hace 20 años, el poco a poco le ha ido haciendo mejoras a su vivienda y ahora esta solicitando este crédito para colocar la losa de concreto para su casa en un cuarto que termino de construir y así brindarle a su familia una mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Juan L. is a very hardworking person. He has worked for a construction company for 20 years. He has gradually been making improvements to his house. He is now requesting this loan so he can pour the concrete slab for a room that he has finished building and therbey provide his family with a more comfortable home.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pour a concrete slab

loans.name: Valentin Guadalupe

texts.es:
El señor Valentín trabaja para una empresa reconocida de la ciudad en el área de operador.
El es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, esta solicitando este crédito para la ampliación de su casa en el área de la sala para darle a su casa y familia mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Valentín works for a business that is recognized in the city in the area of telephone operation. He is a very hardworking and responsible person. He is requesting this loan to expand the living room of his house so that he can provide his family with a more comfortable home.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House expansion

loans.name: Noe

texts.es:
El señor Noe N. vive en una casa prestada junto con su esposa y sus tres hijos.
Como desea tener su propia vivienda está tramitando una casa por medio de Infonavit (Crédito Gubernamental), pero el valor de la vivienda es superior al crédito que el puede recibir ya que su sueldo es bajo.
El trabaja como guardia de seguridad. Por tal motivo solicita un préstamo para completar el Crédito Gubernamental y así adquirí su casa.
Desea tener un Patrimonio seguro para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Noe N. lives in a house that has been lent to him, along with his wife and three children. Since he would like to have his own house, he is applying for a house through Infonavit (governmental credit). However, the value of the house is more than the loan he can receive because his income is low. He works as a security guard. For this reason, he is applying for a loan to complement the government loan so that he can buy his house. He wants to provide his children a secure future.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The difference on the down payment to purchase a house through Infonavit

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El señor Guillermo A. y su esposa María Inés Esquivel son originarios de San Luis Potosí, México; pero tiene 10 años viviendo en Nuevo Laredo y 9 años dedicándose a su negocio de venta de abarrotes.
Sin embargo, a su negocio le falta más variedad de mercancía y además desean iniciar la venta de alimentos congelados t así obtener ingresos adicionales para su hijo que actualmente es estudiante. 
Por ello solicita un préstamo para comprar más mercancía.
texts.en:
Guillermo A. and his wife, María Inés Esquivel, are originally from San Luis Potosí, México. They have been living in Nuevo Laredo for ten years, however, dedicating themselves for nine of the years to their business selling groceries. Regardless, their business is lacking a wider variety of products. In addition, they would like to start selling frozen foods to earn extra income for their son who is currently a student. For this reason, they are requesting a loan so they can purchase more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Sok Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Sok Ly K. lives in Doun Taur village in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a duck breeder. Her husband, Mr. Suon Siem, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, he now faces some problems because his field is infertile and he does not have much money to hire laborers to work on the field. In order to solve these problems, Mrs. Sok Ly K. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and hire laborers to work on the field. She is 34 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom attends the local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire laborers to work in a rice field.

loans.name: Sophear

texts.en: Mrs. Sophear C. is a villager in Prey Mei Khang Thboung village in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a dessert seller. Her husband, Mr. Phin Sophorn, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, he faces some problems because he does not have enough money to buy rice seed and pay for plowing the field. Mrs. Sophear C. decided to ask for a loan for these purposes and, with the rest of money, to buy fertilizer and pesticides to kill insects. She is 41 years old and the mother of three children who attend the local school. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and pay for plowing a field.

loans.name: Chinda

texts.en: Mrs. Chinda P. is a farmer in Prey Totoeng village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Tuy Lay, is a fisherman. Mrs. Chinda P. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed and a pump to bring water to her field, which is distant from the irrigation system. Additionally, she would purchase fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive. Mrs. Chinda P. is 22 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, a pump and fertilizer.

loans.name: Kear

texts.en: Mrs. Kear L. is a farmer in Prey Mlou village in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice during the wet season, but she can earn little rice revenue to support her family. She now wants to also cultivate rice during the dry season. Thus, she decided to request a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticides to kill insects. She hopes to increase her rice revenue to provide better conditions for her household. Her husband, Mr. Suot Thorn, is a construction worker. Mrs. Kear L. is 40 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom attends the local school. Another child stays at home to do housework and the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials to support a mat-making business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a new machine for his construction.

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhorn K. lives in Preak Ta Aung Ti Bei village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She is a mat maker. Her husband, Mr. Yorn Sam Art, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from his plantation, he operates a motorbike taxi. In this business, he now has an obstacle because his motorbike is too old and he usually spends too much money on fuel. To solve this problem, Mrs. Sokhorn K. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her husband's business. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. She is 34 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school while the third is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for a taxi business.

loans.name: Thon

texts.en: Mr. Thon T. is a villager in Sambour village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. He and his wife, Mrs. Kao Sout, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables to earn a living. In the plantation, they face some problems because their field is infertile and it is too far from the irrigation system to get enough water. In order to deal these problems, Mr. Thon T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and petrol for the pump. He hopes to increase his rice revenue with this loan. He is 52 years old and the father of four children, one of whom is a jewelry maker, another is employed in a garment factory, and the others are farmers who help their parents.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and petrol for a water pump.

loans.name: Rano

texts.en: Rano U. has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2004. She first applied to MicroInvest when she started selling eggs. She started her business from scratch. In time she improved the business significantly and she has her own trade outlet in a central bazaar where she trades the eggs wholesale. Her prices at the bazar are lower than others because she works directly with the supplier. Mrs. U. is looking for a loan of 1700 TSJ for 1 month to open one more trade outlet. This loan will allow her to increase her revenue by adding another store.

loans.use: To open another store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair an irrigation pump.

loans.name: Piseth

texts.en: Mr. Piseth P. lives in Thmey village in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. His wife, Mrs. Nin Ney, is an egg middleman. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mr. Piseth P. decided to ask for a loan to buy more eggs for his wife’s business. He hopes to increase income and improve his family living conditions. He is 23 years old and the father of two children who are too young to work or study. His wife is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more eggs for resale.

loans.name: Omina

texts.en: J. Omina  is 44 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Mrs. J. has been an active client of our program since 2004. She is a reliable and executive client. She trades eggs in the central bazaar and is a hardworking woman. Mrs. J. has been selling eggs for 5 years and she is thankful for Kiva's support.

loans.use: support her egg selling business

loans.name: Saray

texts.en: Mrs. Saray A. is a villager in Prey Chhoeur Teal village in Takeo Province, Cambodia, where she owns a small grocery store. Her husband, Mr. Bo Sitha, is a worker. Their two incomes together are less than what they need to provide better conditions for their household. In order to improve her living conditions, Mrs. Saray A. decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for breeding. She is 27 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding.

loans.name: Mrs. Sam Art Ean Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people in S. Raong village in Takeo Province, Cambodia, have formed a village bank loan group. Mrs. S. Art E. is the village bank president. She sells Prohok (crushed, salted and fermented fish paste, usually of mud fish, that is used in Cambodian cuisine as a seasoning) in the local market. Her husband, Mr. C. Dol, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. He is also a successful duck breeder and he wants to expand this business. Thus, Mrs. S. Art E. decided to request a loan to buy more ducklings and duck food to support them. She hopes to increase income and improve her living conditions with this loan. She is a 35-year-old mother of four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school while the other is too young to work or study.

Mr. Saroeurn B. does not come to take a loan but his wife is, so she is presented in the picture instead of her husband.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Fourteen members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more ducklings and duck food

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: I. Dilorom lives in Khujand. She is married and has three children. Mrs. I. trades in the city’s local bazaar.  She purchases the goods from Istravshan and the Kyrgyz Republic two to three times a month.  Because she travels to buy her own supplies, she is able to sell them at a low price to make a high profit.  Over the past 4 years, she has developed loyal customers.  She will use her loan to buy and import more clothes to sell.

loans.use: Buy and import clothes

loans.name: Siddiqan M. Latif Group

texts.en:
I am Siddiqan and reside in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. I am 42 years old and married to M. L., who has a scrap business. He has 20 years of experience in this business. I have three sons. My husband and I are trying to give our younger son a good education, because he wants to become a doctor. I sew clothes and make embroidered dresses to order and share the income with my husband so that we both will be able to fulfill our sons wish. I’m applying for a loan to buy scrap (iron and plastic bottles) to expand my husband’s business.

I’ve some women in my group. Amna baji is requesting a loan to buy washing powder for her laundry. Irshad baji is requesting a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. Tabasum baji and Bushra baji each are requesting a loan to buy materials (beads and thread) for their decorative embroidery business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each others loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for the entire repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy scrap for her husband's scrap business.

loans.name: Nazia M. Safdar Group

texts.en:
My name is Nazia and my husband's name is M. S., who is a worker in a cotton factory. I have two kids: one son and one daughter. My daughter is in kindergarten and my son is not old enough to attend school. I work in the decorative embroidery business, a skill that I learned from my mother. After marriage, I began this work because my husband’s salary was insufficient to meet household expenses. For the past 10 years I have owned a boutique where I display my own garment collection. Most of the people come to my boutique to purchase clothes. It is now the month of occasions such as Eid and Christmas and the demand for new clothes is high. I am requesting a loan to purchase more materials to make more embroidered dresses to display in my boutique.

I have some other women in my group. Bashiran baji is requesting a loan to buy clothes for her clothing business. Fahmida baji is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine. Mukhtar baji is requesting a loan to buy washing powder for her laundry. Imtiaz baji is requesting a loan to buy bricks for her brick selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each others loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for the repayment of the entire loan.

loans.use: To buy material to make embroidered dresses

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en: K. Manzura lives in Khujand. She is married and has 2 children. K. currently works in the commercial service and trade, and trades costume jewelry. Mrs. K. is currently requesting a loan to expand her business and improve her customer base. She hopes to use the profit earned to support her family and care for her children.

loans.use: To increase the range of her goods

loans.name: Nazia M.usman Group

texts.en:
Nazia baji resides in Lahore, Pakistan. She owes a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 22 years. Her husband, M., is a tailor by profession. She has two children: one son and one daughter. Both of her children are not of school age. Nazia baji sews clothes for a living and teaches the girls of her community how to sew clothes. She earns Pak Rupees 3,000 on a monthly basis. She shares her income with her husband because they both want to give their children a good education. Nazia baji is applying for a loan to buy a sewing machine for her husband so that he will be able to hire an employee and complete the large number of orders from his customers.

Nazia baji is a group leader of a few more members in her locality. Fozia daud baji is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics for her parlor. Suraiya baji is requesting a loan to buy washing powder for her laundry. Rubina baji is requesting a loan to buy material (cloth, colored thread and sketches) to make embroidered dresses for her boutique. Shahida parveen baji is requesting a loan to buy woods for her furniture making business. Shagufta baji is requesting a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. Rukhsana baji is requesting a loan to buy shoes for her shoe selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each others loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for the entire repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and hire an employee to sew clothes

loans.name: Zulfia

texts.en: N. Zulfia has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2006. She has never had a problem with repayment of loans. Because of previous loans, she has opened a trade outlet at her own home. She trades food products such as sausages, sweats, sugar, rice, etc. Mrs.N. is asking KIVA for a loan to increase the number of kinds of food she can sell.

loans.use: assortment wideness

loans.name: Chhat's Group

texts.en:
This is a group of three members. Mrs. Chhat S., 28, a rice farmer who took this up over 9 years ago, is the mother of two children. She is married to Mr. Tuy Sarat, 31, who makes a living catching fish for selling, as well as he is a construction worker and currently earns approximately $3 each day. To earn additional revenue and make work easier, S. needs a loan to buy a fish to resell and to pay for harvesting her rice. S. is the leader of two other members:

Mrs. San Y., a farmer, age 48, who is applying for a loan to purchase a piglet for raising.

Mrs. Sos R., 33, who is a rice farmer requesting a loan to pay for cutting her rice crop. 

They all reside in Anlongveul Commune in Battambang Province.

loans.use: To buy a fish to sell in local market

loans.name: Roatha

texts.en: Mrs. Roatha S. lives in Ang Ta Kouk village in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a beautician and her husband, Mr. Hong Vuthy, is a photographer. Their combined income is not enough to provide a better life for the family. Thus, Mrs. Roatha S. decided to ask for a loan to buy steel and timber to build a better house for her family to live in. She is 31 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy steel and timers to build the house for her family to live in better conditions.

loans.name: Yang's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. Mrs. Yang S. is the leader of the loan, and she is age 39. She owns and runs a fruit shop in the local market and sells items such as grapes, apples, and oranges, making an income of $3 per day. She takes care of five children, all of whom are single and attend school. Her husband, Mr. Choun Sophal, 37, is a taxi driver. In order to enlarge the business, S. is applying for a loan to purchase different kinds of fruits to sell. S. has two members with her:

Mrs. Sok S., age 27, a fish seller who is seeking a loan to buy more fishes for selling.

Mrs. Yang R., 62, is a fruit seller. She needs to ask for a loan to enlarge her business. 

The borrowers live in Battambang Province.

loans.use: To purchase different kinds of fruits to sell

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Mr. Phorn S. lives in Ang Ta Kouk village in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He is a farmer who earns a small income by cultivating rice on his small piece of land. In order to improve his living, he decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business. Mr. Phorn S. is a 52-year-old widower and the father of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Noem

texts.en: Mrs. Noem U. is a farmer in Kor village in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She can earns only a small revenue to support her family so she wants to also cultivate rice during the dry season. Thus, she decided to request a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticides and to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field. Her husband, Mr. Vong Chek, is a construction worker. Mrs. Noem U. is 34 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, and hire a laborer with two oxen to plow a field.
